Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ckuo21
Reviews.Content: We used our Marriott Reward and stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. The room is small by Marriott standard but clean. The staff is very polite and helpful. The reason we chose this hotel is because of the location - 10 minutes walking distance to Louve Museum and 15 minutes to Champ-Elysee. Another key reason we love this hotel is the pool and sauna room. After a day of walking and sightseeing, this is the best place to be. There are many great restaurants around but definitely don't go to the Chinese restaurant next door. We would go somewhere nice if not because my husband was too hungry one night and wanted to get something quick. The staff in that restaurant is so rude that I can't believe it can actually survive next to a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Although rooms are small...”
Reviews.Author: jdmascarello
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful! Great location near landmarks and public transportation. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms new and spotless. We also enjoyed the food at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Stancroft
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paris Vendome for three nights recently. Excellent base for exploring the city. Staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. Room on the small side but had everything you would need.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room, Helpful staff, Good location”
Reviews.Author: lllClifflll
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long weekend having arrived by car into the city. The hotel staff was quick to check us in and the valet quickly parked the car and quickly retrieved it when required. I could take the metro to my meetings and on the weekend I could walk to the Louve. The nighborhood is somewhat touristy but still a wonderful area in Paris. The Beds were excellent and the rooms were a good size. They are recently remodeled and in good condition. Technology is good as is the wireless internet. I had no problems with any of the hotel services. Room service was prompt and the food pretty good. Rates were not bad either using one of Marriott weekend escapes packages. Overall I was quite happy with my stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ebobee
Reviews.Content: My first time to Paris and I stayed at the Renaissance for over a month during February and March. The location was great, and my room, while small, was cozy and comfortable. A slightly larger room might have been better for my extended business trip, but for a few days or a week, this room and hotel would be great. The room had what I needed in the way of a work area and the bed was simply fantastic. Storage space was limited to one small closet and a few shelves in a built-in storage area. There was one small backed chair in the room along with a desk chair. I had a corner room on the sixth floor that had windows facing both the front of the hotel and a small side street. With the windows closed I could hardly hear a thing, although some traveling companions moved to court facing rooms after a few days, street noise and sounds from a local Irish pub given as the reason. For me the corner room was great; two windows, and a lot of light when the curtains were open and fresh air as temperature permitted. The room’s thick curtains blackened the room for afternoon naps and late weekend wake-ups. My long stay was made even more enjoyable by a very pleasant staff and a very nice breakfast that was included in our room price. The concierge arranged dinner for us on Valentines day at a nearby restaurant with little notice and the front desk staff were always there to help with questions. The hotel has a small gym with just a few treadmills that were difficult to use as a result of the small space they were placed in. The hotel’s indoor pool is nice, and while I didn’t indulge, massages were available as well. The bathroom in my room was quite nice with one exception, the bathtub. It must be the new style, bathtubs in hotels are getting more narrow, and this bathtub is no exception. I found standing in the tub to take a shower a balancing act, and side placement of the tub’s faucet didn’t help any. The location of this hotel couldn’t be better, I walked to just about every place to see in Paris, and when I needed to, the metro was just a short distance away. While I opted to eat outside the hotel except for breakfast, I sat with friends for a short time while they had dinner at the hotel, the food looked great, and my friends were very happy with what they got. I’d definitely stay here again, and I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: coach888
Reviews.Content: Great location Great service Great room Great experience

Reviews.Title: “Location for The "Art Lover" in everyone!”
Reviews.Author: jerrycoin
Reviews.Content: The property is so easy for visitors to walk or Metro to most of "Artisitic" Paris. Not just Louvre, or other Museums, but to wonderful dining, Seine activities, or just "People watching. This historic site, is sort of "Hidden", on a narrow, one way street, which makes it "Quiet". One can enjoy a very well furnished room and an excellent dining experience. Take a short walk and see the famous "Columns" used in the Cary Grant, Audrey Hepburn movie "Charade". Would not recommend driving to this hotel, unless you know exactly how to get there. Enjoy this hotel and the pleasures nearby!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: amtrak58
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights the end of January on Marriott points. Was upgraded to a premium room... very nice and spacious (for Paris). Windows overlooked an interior courtyard but based on comments from previous reviews, it was probably a good thing. Bathroom was clean and decent size - love the heated towel rack!!! Wi-Fi service was good - no issues. The hotel has a small but nice pool (not many hotels in Paris have one), and a good gym with a sauna and a steam room. Breakfast buffet (free for Gold and Platinum members) was a plus with lots of choices including cooked to order omelets. Staff was very friendly and helpful... my French is weak, but most of the front desk and restaurant personnel are fluent in English. The location of the hotel is excellent - within walking distance to the Louvre, Jardin Tuilleries, Notre Dame, Musee d'Orsay, Sainte-Chapelle (go see - the stained glass windows are amazing!), etc. The streets of the Sainte-Germain area near Notre Dame are nice to stroll thru... lots of litte shops and markets. The Metro is close and convenient, but I recommend walking if you are up to it... you get a very different feel for the city, and the opportunity to stop and explore the shops and parks as you pass by. Negatives... not a one. I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: LindleyK
Reviews.Content: Booked a ten night stay on Marriott points - so I know a lot about Marriott hotels. Some of you may relate. GOOD 1) free coffee, hot chocolate, and candies 2) clean gym and pool (small) 3) free sparkling water at the gym 4) EXCELLENT location - half a block from the metro station (Tuilleries), the Louvre, the Paris ferris wheel, the Jardin Tuilleries (like a small but cool Central Park), the Musee D'arts Decoratifs (Decorative Arts Museum). 5) Ample shopping that is more expensive than in other areas, but not hugely. For shoppers I'd recommend Le Marais (3rd arrondisment) and the Ile de Cite and Ile de St Louis (04-05 arrondisment). There are no doubt better places to buy stuff, but for the average tourist hitting the highlights, plan your trip to Paris during "Soldes" (mid-January-February, and mid-June-July) or wait til you get home) 6) Easy walking distance to the D'Orsay museum and L'Orangerie. Reasonable walking distance to La Tour Eiffel. 7) Excellent recommendations from the Concierge for places to eat within walking distance. 8) Nice safe neighborhood 9) Super staff. Very kind and helpful. FOR PLATINUM MEMBERS 1) Free breakfast buffet is extensive and tasty, and service is good 2) Free wireless with reasonable bandwidth CAUTIONS/DOWN SIDES 1) The rooms are small from an American perspective 2) Ask for a room away from the street - there's an Irish Pub (excellent food by the way) across the street that stays open late 3) The Concierge may promise to make reservations and call you back, but get too busy to actually do what they said... or call you back. MEH / NOT SO BIG A DEAL 1) The Bvlgari toiletries? Not all that exciting despite the brand name.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good stay ...Location...Location & Location”
Reviews.Author: Elyes B
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel in Mid November 2011 for 3 nights ...It was a pleasant surprise: Room was spacious - According to French/European Standards!-, comfortable, nicely decorated. Hotel location is really great ...Few minutes from Champs-Elysees and from Rivoli Street. Hotel Staff very helpful and I was honestly gladly surprised, they speak good English, very helpful, friendly and SMILING!!!! -I used to live in France and I am very familiar with the french rudeness and their weak languages skills!!! sorry to say that but it's a fact!- Tried the room service, very limited choice but tasty ...A special thanks to the bell boys ...They are very helpful and very dedicated (sorry forgot your names guys ...It was in November 2011!)... I highly recommend this hotel for short business visit mainly ...Best things: The service, the welcome, and location, location, location ... Regrettable things: nothing to report. Will be coming back for sure...

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel comfort in Cozy Parisian Style”
Reviews.Author: LKG_11
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here this past New Year's Eve. Fantastic place - small rooms, but well equipped and cozy. Great design, complimentary champagne on New Year's Eve, and very friendly and helpful staff. Didn't try the restaurant but the location of the hotel is excellent - in the heart of the city with tons of fantastic shops and restaurants nearby, as well as easy access to the metro. All in all a great hotel and somewhere I will be staying many more times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MrHubaHuba
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Vendome Paris was one of the nicer hotels I have ever stayed in. Upon checking in they upgraded both of our families rooms. Since I contacted the concierge prior to check in, they also made all reservations for us for restaurants and also the Louvre. The rooms were very comfortable and clean and the staff was always smiling and polite. What more can you ask for in a hotel? I was 100% satisfied and on my return to Paris will stay there for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingFeline
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 5 minutes from Place Vendome, between the Place and the Louvre. Hence, it has a marvellous location, you can walk to all central Paris sights and it's 2 minutes from nearest metro station (Tuileries). The area is a bit quiet in the evenings but you can find some restaurants and bars, or walk a little bit further to more lively areas. Typical business hotel, nothing special but nothing wrong with it either. Clean and newish furnishings. The windows provide excellent insulation against the street noise, we were not disturbed at all.The rooms are quite small for the price, but perfectly adequate and there are more interesting things to do in Paris than sitting in your room. A good breakfast for Paris, including eggs made to order. However, be prepared for a long wait. The hotel has clearly not hired enough staff to cope with the number of guests. Generally, breakfast service is very slow, with tea & coffee taking a long time to arrive, buffet being replenished slowly and even a shortage of basic cutlery. We found the reception staff to be helpful and polite. There is a spa in the hotel but we didn't use it so can't comment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bocagrlz
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth visit to Paris and the location of Paris Vendome was great. Small, quaint, boutique hotel. Rooms were larger than I expected. Very clean. Ask for an 'interior' room as they are extremely quiet. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was quite good. The only thing I really missed about this hotel is that it lacked the 'neighborhood' feel. If you want pastry shops and bistros on every corner, then the Latin quarter or the Marias is a better bet. Staff was quite accomodating, considering we stayed here over Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: johninflorida
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay in Paris! It is in the heart of the city, which makes everything accessible. We walk most of the time when we go on vacation, and the Renaissance Vendome made this very easy. We were a block from the jardin des tuileries gardens, a 10 minute walk to the Louvre and a 15 minute walk to Champs-ElysÃ©es. There are restaurants and cafes abound as soon as you leave the property. The morning breakfast was great and the staff was very attentive. One of the people who was most helpful to us at the front desk was Michael. If we had a question or a problem, he immediately took care of it. He even told us where he goes for the best pastries and bread in Paris! The I can't recommend the Renaissance Vendome enough. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ArlingtonVATraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just finished a 4-night stay. We booked it using Marriott points. The location is outstanding - a 2-minute walk to the Metro (Tuileries), and the Louvre, Ile de la Cite, Musee d'Orsay and Ile St.-Louis are all within quite comfortable walk. Beautiful, safe neighborhood with amazing window-shopping opportunities (as well as actual shopping, though it's a Ritzy neighborhood - literally - the Ritz and Place Vendome are two blocks away). The lobby is small but nice, with complimentary coffee in the morning and water and sweets throughout the rest of the day. We were in Paris to celebrate an anniversary, and we were upgraded to a small suite facing Rue du Mont-Thabor. We definitely heard some noise from the bar across the street on a Friday night, but it was manageable - perhaps being on a high floor made it so. We had a two-room suite - sitting room and bedroom - with a full bath with shower and another bathroom with sink and tub (but no toilet). We really appreciated having two bathrooms. Bedding and finishes were very nice but nothing spectacular. It felt rather like a nice stateroom on a cruiseship - compact. Large Bulgari toiletries in the bathrooms, which were replaced when needed. There was a funky smell in one of the bathrooms but it wasn't overly bothersome. The front desk sent up an anniversary note with a small guidebook, a bottle of wine, and a box of chocolates on our first night - a lovely touch. The front desk staff were helpful, and the concierges were able to give us directions, confirm a dinner reservation via phone, and respond to other small requests. We never went to the spa or pool. Breakfast was included in our stay (Marriott Gold status), but we only ate there our first morning and our last. Breads, eggs (including cooked-to-order omelette if we wanted), fruit, yogurt, cereal, sausage, juices, coffee. No complaints since it was included, but if you're buying breakfast you may be better off finding a cafe on the Rue St.-Honore'. I would recommend this hotel for couples or families if you can snag the suite (the sitting room had a sofabed). The location is wonderful and the staff accomodating. The "rack rate" is shockingly high, though - do this one on points if you can!

Reviews.Title: “pity about the noise”
Reviews.Author: Goessag
Reviews.Content: Great location, tiny rooms, I agree. It is a great location in Paris, fabulous in fact. However we had a tiny room right opposite the Irish bar. Friday night was just about ok but we did not get to sleep Saturday night until 4am. when the crazy noise from outside finally died down Its a really big problem, despite double glazing. Unfortunately we also had the in room alarm go off at 5.30 am in the morning. I felt the hotel personnel were very uninterested in these problems. A pity, other than that they were very nice. Bed was a bit too soft also. Pool and gym etc. were great We recommend eating in one of the restaurants in Place marche st honorÃ©, its very close by and has a number of reasonably priced places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Drpablo10
Reviews.Content: We stayed on room 214, with a king bed, the room size is correct to Paris standard. As all Paris hotels, price is a little bit high, but the location deserves each euro spent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MJN905
Reviews.Content: Great in every way. My wife and I stayed here on the first night of an 11-day trip to Paris, London and Munich in October 2011. We were going to London initially, but we flew from the U.S. in and out of Paris for various reasons, and decided to stay one night at a Paris hotel first, to decompress. We chose this hotel for our "decompression: night and it was terrific. The hotel is easy to find and very well-located just south of the Place Vendome, in the 1er arrondissement. The surrounding neighborhood is nice and there are lots of attractions (like the Opera) within easy walking distance, but the property isn't noisy at all, which is terrific for Paris. Upon check-in, I was greeted very warmly and we were immediately upgraded without even asking, to a junior suite. I believe this was because I'm a Marriott Rewards member; also, we arrived just off the plane from CDG at about 11:30 AM, so they probably had a good amount of rooms available. Anyway, I wouldn't count on the upgrade happening every time, but it was certainly very welcome. We had to wait only a few minutes in the lobby for the room to be ready - - no problem. The junior suite was very spacious and comfortable. It was impeccably clean, and the staff was very friendly and responsive to our requests (extra towels and such). The employee who showed us to our room and explained all of the amenities was very friendly and helpful. We mostly slept during our time in the room, but the overall experience couldn't have been better. I was sorry to leave. Upon returning to Paris, we had a near-disaster at a highly-reviewed boutique hotel, and tried to return to this property, but it was booked. (Everything turned out fine as we stayed at another great place.) The staff was once again very friendly at checkout and helped us with our bags into the taxi they called to take us to the train station. Some room specifics: we had a nice interior courtyard view, which was very pretty. The bathroom in the junior suite is really big with a separate tub, shower, and toilet compartment, and a very good-sized counter. The suite has a small living area with a couple of comfy chairs and a TV, and the sleeping area is quite sizeable for Paris. If there's any possibility of upgrading to or booking a junior suite, take it. I would stay here again in a hot minute. Terrific place, and not all that expensive considering the overall condition of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Still terrific”
Reviews.Author: HVB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful stay here in 2007 and I was wondering if a repeat visit would live up to my already high expectations. It did, and then some! For some context, we booked our stay on points and my husband is a marriott elite member and we were in town to celebrate my birthday and my husband had some work to do in the area. Prior to our stay I emailed the hotel, mentioned it was a special occasion and asked for some restaurant recommendations as the excellent restaurant, L'Ardoise down the street was closed on Mondays. I heard from Olivier, the concierge, right away with several excellent choices. He made us dinner reservations prior to our arrival. Upon check-in, they noted that it was a special event for us and we were upgraded to a suite with a small balcony! they also sent up a bottle of wine! The hotel had the same familiarity as our last visit with no signs of wear and tear. Everything was spotlessly clean and looked brand new. We were on the 5th floor (502) facing rue du Mont Thabor and were not bothered by any street noise. The breakfast was included and the buffet was more than adequate with fresh fruit, breads, pastries, cheese, and meat, and the scrambled eggs were divine. The omelets were also very good. The wireless internet worked very well for me in the room and if you sit at the wall in the restaurant along the main street, you can also pick up Carr's free wifi signal at breakfast. The bathroom in the room was spacious enough and the room had plenty of storage. The bed was very comfortable and i loved the linens. We did not watch any TV but it was a new looking flat screen. There were outlets near the bed convenient to charging cell phones, etc. The service was always very friendly and professional. You don't have to walk far to find some less expensive restaurants. We really enjoyed eating at Auberge St. Roch nearby (went twice, great value, service, and atmosphere, reviewed separately), also La Petite Chaise (diito), and the restaurant at the hotel, Pinxo. It was fabulous! Bistro Volnay was a recommendation of the concierge and while the food was good there, the service was a little slow. We also enjoyed a lunch at Carr's across the street. Carr's also seemed to be very popular for happy hour and their posted drink prices were very reasonable. I also like the bar at the hotel. It has good ambiance and we paid 9 Euro for a generous glass of excellent Bordeaux, I did not think that was a bad price at all. We did not use the steam room or pool on this trip but it is definitely a nice feature to have after walking all over Paris. It's certainly a hotel worth saving points for and also for good weekend specials!!!

Reviews.Title: “great gem in Paris !”
Reviews.Author: cx123
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel, boutique stile but with great brand behind, good value. metro near by, walking distance from major attractions, Louvre, Madeleine, Hotel de Ville... big shoping centers, luxury stores in rue saint honore... etc endless great stuff to do all day around, even walking distance to les marais, and Norte dame area for late night drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Level 8 Marriott Property; no Executive Lounge”
Reviews.Author: KathyPoe
Reviews.Content: Hotel website calls this a "boutique hotel". We liked: -Location superb, quite close to Louvre (open late Wed & Friday nights). -Incredible swimming pool which becomes your private spot (no one uses it). An evening swim is so relaxing after a day of tourism. -Great staff: When I had trouble with wifi internet connection, 3 "engineers" teamed on problem-solving. The front desk then gave me a laptop to use for 5 days, at no cost, no deposit. -As Platinum Club members, we were given upgraded room. -Room was 100% quiet, on inner courtyard. This is critical point, because Paris is one noisy city, with constant sound of motorcycles & mopeds zooming around. -Bathroom was extremely sophisticated, with big containers of Bulgari toiletries. -Excellent selection of newspapers & magazines available daily outside breakfast room. -Buffet breakfast is available until 10:00am, which is big help to USA folks with jet lag. -For Marriott Reward members, remember to book 5 nights. 4 nights at Level 8 hotel is 160,000 points. The 5th night costs no extra points. So for sure, book the extra night! We didn't like: -Even tho this hotel is Level 8 Marriott, it has no Club Level. (We bought our own wine/cheese for evening snacks in the room.) -Place Vendome is very expensive area of Paris. Neighborhood restaurants are premium priced. It's a hike to get to less expensive part of the city for ethnic restaurants, bakeries. or wine shops. -Even tho we stayed 5 nights/6 days, none of the staff knew us by name. Surprising for a boutique hotel. -No tea/coffee pot in room. At end of day, I really wanted to take off my shoes, sit quietly in room, make a cup of tea & have quiet time.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in the Autumn”
Reviews.Author: DonProsser
Reviews.Content: Located in an excellence spot in reach of nearly everything you'd want t see in the City of Lights, we enjoyed a fantastic stay here. Although the rooms are a tad small (we used 160,000 Marriott points), it was clean, organized and accessible. Breakfast was included but don't expect to feast. The coffee though was amazing. They made us feel a home, brought extra towels, never complained a bit. If you want to see Paris AND stay in comfort, this is the place. Many evenings, we were lucky enough to eat close to the hotel, and some of the best meals we had! Our teenage daughter really enjoyed the "Gummi Bear Bar."

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location-Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dsmart17
Reviews.Content: We had 3 fantastic days in Paris and other than unusually small rooms for a five star hotel, this place was a nice suprise. Having been to Paris before and stayed by the Arc i would argue that the Vendome area is the best location to stay and tour the city. Very safe, within 1/4 mile walk from the tuleries near the Louve, it puts you right in the middle of everything without all of the commotion. 1/4 mile walks to some of the best shopping and restaurants in Paris and walking distance to all the top attractions. The service at this Renaissance was first rate. Front desk, door-men and house service try hard to exceed expectations. The breakfast which was included with our stay was adaquate however, we always felt a bit rushed. The room as mentioned was small. My wife and I had very little room to put 2 bags and it was cramped around the bed area. The bath was also small and had not one spot to put a toiletry bag. The shower/tub had no door and the floor was soaked after every use. All that said, the location, service and cleanness are well worth a smaller room size in my book and I would recommend the Renaissance Vendome.

Reviews.Title: “Does the important things well”
Reviews.Author: divvy_l
Reviews.Content: This is a well-located small hotel in the 1st with impressive service and small (this is Paris) but comfortable rooms. The beds are easy to drift asleep on and the Bulgari products highlight the bathroom. There really is little to complain about however there is probably little distinctive as well - but it is hard to be disappointed with this outpost of the Marriott empire. It is a great base whatever your purpose is in Paris and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for seeing the sights of Paris”
Reviews.Author: days32110
Reviews.Content: We were only in Paris for two short days but this was the perfect location for a Marriott property. We stayed on points so I can't say much about the value but the hotel met our expectations for a very comfortable stay. The rooms are very small, similar to New York in the states, but it was fine considering we weren't in Paris to stay in our room. We arrived very early and they were able to quickly accommodate us. We did spend some of our time waiting for our room by taking a shower downstairs (since we came in on a red eye flight) in the spa which was small but provided what we needed. The hotel is just a stones throw from Tuileries Garden and that Metro stop but beware - - the hotel website recommends you take the M1 to get to the Tuileries stop to get to the hotel. On Sundays this line doesn't open until 10am so you need to take another line if you are arriving before then or just take the bus that drops you off near the Paris Opera which is just a 10 min. walk from the hotel. We took this back to the airport and it was much easier and cost about the same. Definitely use the concierge and email them prior to your arrival for any special requests. They were very helpful in trying to get us tickets to the Paris Opera for a tour but unfortunately it was closed for performances while we were there. We were celebrating our anniversary and came back from a long day of sight seeing to a nice bottle of wine, a cute book on places to kiss in Paris and yummy desserts. This completely exceded our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Quick Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mikedaily
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Paris Vendome was a perfect hotel for my wife and I during our brief stay in Paris. The hotel is in an excellent location, we were able to walk to the Louvre, and the Notre Dame, and it was a short cab ride to the Eiffel Tower. The breakfast that the hotel provided was very delicious with an assortment of different breakfast foods. The room was very elegant and quaint, and the bed was very comfortable. The room was a standard size room for a hotel in Europe. Overall we had a great experience, the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and service, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: AmethystTravel
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Renaissance Paris Vendome and loved it. From the minute we arrived we were greeted by a doorman and bellman who didn't expect to be tipped for assisting us. The front desk staff were friendly and upon completing check-in we were escorted to our room and shown how to work everything in the room. The room was small but that's normal in most European cities, and it was very comfortable. The bed and linens were exquisite and gave us excellent sleep quality. The bathroom was just large enough to be comfortable, and we loved the heated towel rack. The vanity had an open shelf below which was large enough to store our items, and two drawers to further help keep the vanity top orderly. The hotel provided Bulgari toiletries which have a light unisex fragrance and a luxurious feel. There were plenty of hangers in the small closet and just enough space for us to hang the clothes that needed to be hung up. The rest of our clothes went on shelves in another small closet. The service we received was perfect. The concierge not only provided us with Museum Passes at cost, he helped us plan our days. Any request or question we asked was responded to pleasantly and effortlessly, as though the staff lives to serve guests. The location was excellent, and I think it was actually better to be one block away from the Tuileries rather than be directly on the Rue de Rivoli as that is a very busy road with noise and exhaust fumes. The only negative thing we can think of is that the bathroom has a split door of frosted glass for space-saving purposes. Unfortunately this split door provides very little privacy and even when travelling with someone you love, there are times you want privacy. When making our reservation we had requested an inside room, as suggested by prior reviewers, and our request was honored. Therefore we had peace and quiet and slept wonderfully each night. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Vendome is a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: plmvirginia
Reviews.Content: The location is great. It is four blocks from the Louve and offers access to the Arce De Triumph(?) and elsewhere. This is the elite shopping area and the prices show it. Good service, nice but very small rooms and 5 euro full breakfast. The only negative is that there are no walk-in showers. This hotel and the twin in Amsterdam put in dangerous tub showers. The sides are very high, the tub small and there are no handrails. The shower is a lawsuit waiting to happen, beware if you have any handicapps. Thus, only 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimtonge
Reviews.Content: I have been trying to write this for a year now. My sister and I stayed here last year, We loved the room, location and service. I cannot say enough about the helpfulness and support of the staff. They all out did themselves with helping us with directions etc. I have recommended this hotel to everyone I know visiting Paris. I look forward to visiting again. Give it a try, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pglein
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here at the last minute using reward points after missing our flight and deciding to stay for a day in Paris. We didn't spend a whole lot of time in the room other than sleeping due to how many wonderful things there are to do nearby, but the time we did spend was very enjoyable. We were on the 3rd floor and had no particularly spectacular view, but the room was very comfortable. The queen sized bed brought a good night's sleep. Flat screen tv with a good selection of shows and on-demand options. The bathroom was large enough (though not overly so), with a heated towel rack offering a nice touch of luxury. The room was small by American standards, but about typical for Europe. It didn't FEEL small, until you tried to open the closet door beside the bed; it doesn't open all the way, and blocks access due to it's proximity to the bed. A minor annoyance. Most hotels don't even have closets, so it was nice to have a place to stuff your clothes, keeping the room nice and tidy. No complaints, but I imagine if we'd paid cash for the room, we would have found it rather expensive. It cost us 45,000 reward points, which is roughly equivalent to a year's worth of spending on our Marriott credit card or two years worth of regular business travel exclusively at Marriott hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and location but side step the overpriced breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Akd73
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a junior suite for one night and was happy but not ecstatic with my stay and left feeling that it was lovely but that as a chain it tried to overcharge you in every way possible. 7 euros for one hour wifi connection (which you couldn't stagger) seemed very ungenerous when you're paying 500euro for a night, along with a charge just to listen to a music album on the tv system. Worst was the very below par breakfast which wasn't worth it for the 23euro charge per person (cold eggs, solid croissants etc). I'd definately recommend strolling to one of the lovely roadside cafes in the smart area for breakfast instead. On a positive note the swimming pool was a lovely luxury and the bar looked cosy and welcoming in the evening. I would definately return if they stopped the silly extra costs!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gaylen C
Reviews.Content: Room was very comfortable and the air conditioner worked quite well. Although the room was small, the bathroom was quite large. We loved the quiet street view. The hotel is very close to all the wonderful Paris sites and we particularly liked being able to walk every where. Originally we had planned to stay at a less expensive Marriott property outside of city centre, but were glad we opted to pay a little more for this great property. We cannot offer a review of the dining facilities since we choose to eat a side-walk cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Would be great if it were 250 euros less”
Reviews.Author: denany
Reviews.Content: Really this property is between a 3 and 4 rating. The staff is very good and accommodating and the location is quite good but for the price, I'm not impressed. I'd be thrilled if I stayed here on points but I'm not. We had a junior suite which was a decent size for Paris but in truth, it was little snug. Very little room to maneuver around a king size bed. For this rate, I expect a little more space. The incidental charges for 15 euros for wifi and 11 euros for English language television are outrageous. It is purportedly a 5 star property but really feels more like a 4.5 star, as a another reviewer said earlier. I'd rather save the money and stay at one of the nearby 4 stars or stay at a true 5 star establishment. frankly everything from the lobby, to the room, to the spa (below ground level and truly unimpressive) looks better in photographs.

Reviews.Title: “Did we just stay at the same hotel as the past reviewers were at !?”
Reviews.Author: sadiebell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 8th trip to France , which always includes some time in Paris. We own several Marriott timeshares and thru that program we have always been able to stay in Paris using points and have stayed at the Marriott on the Champs Ã‰lysÃ©es and at the Renaissance Trocadero near Victor Hugo in the 16th Arr. Because of the mostly great reviews of the Vendome Renaissance, I was excited to stay here and see how we liked this location, so we stayed 3 nights at this hotel last week. First I'll mention the positive things. Several months ago I emailed the hotel and asked if they could get us a dinner reservation at Frenchie, which they did and it was a great restaurant. Our room cost us many points but we also upgraded to a larger King bed room for 90E per night more. And the room was a nice size- bigger than many Paris hotel rooms and the bed was great- very comfy with nice linens- the bed may have had a featherbed topper on it as it was soft, which we like because we have a featherbed at home. As mentioned in most other reviews, the location is very good if you want to be near the Louvre and the Tuileries. For those who mentioned it being close to the Arc de Triomphe.....well, let's put it thie way, the Louvre is at one end of the Champs and the Arc is at the other end and it's not a short street. Now for the negatives from our recent experience. When we arrived a bellman helped us right away and the doormen were always nice, but at the desk the reception was cool at best. I asked for a room on a high floor and the 3rd floor was the best they could do. I asked if we could have a room with a balcony- they said no rooms with balconies were available. I asked if there were corner rooms available and the woman then turned to a man who was also working at the desk and he said, in a very aloof manner, that those rooms are suites and thus would cost much more money. So, when reading past reviews that say they were upgraded for free, etc, this sure didn't happen with us. And we have an upgraded Marriott Visa card and have spent enough on Marriott time shares to have probably bought a 2nd home ! So, we go to our room and it is facing the street, which I thought was ok- but read on a bit later about that. The bathroom is large but there is no place to put toiletries except at the back of the tub where they get all wet from the shower. Right across from the bathroom there is a small (really small) closet and it had a couple shelves, so I used those for some hair products, etc. Before arriving in Paris we had been in Provence for a week at a couple great places- they had free wi-fi- did this hotel ? No- it cost 7E per hour or 15E per day. And I think there was even a charge for using the TV, which we didn't care to use anyway. As far as being on the 3rd floor facing the street- there is an Irish Pub across the street that seems to be a popular place- especially the later it gets at night. So every night we had quite a bit of noise from the Pub, but thhe worst night was last Saturday night- we had an early flight from Paris Sunday am so we had to get up at 5 am. Went to bed about 10:30pm, while at the Pub they had a group that.played horns- very loud horns- til at least midnight. That and the very cool front desk reception we got were the worst things about this hotel. Not sure I'd ever stay there again, but if we did, I would want a room in the back/inside of the hotel- course if I asked for that, they probably wouldn't give it to me ! As far as the Marriott on the Champs- it is a very nice hotel and we were always treated well there, altho it is a very busy area to stay in considering the location. The Renaissance Trocadero is in a quiet residential area but it's near Place Victor Hugo and about a 15-20 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower or the Arc de Triomphe. It is an older property and the smallest rooms are small, but they have a variety of room sizes. This is the first review that I have done on any Marriott or Renaissance property that's been mostly negative, but sadly, I was very disappointed in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: penguin28173
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Marriott points- which seemed to be everyone else was doing too. I am not sure if anyone actually pays to stay there, but with that said the service was great, the breakfast was wonderful. The room we received was very small- almost too small for our luggage. There was no executive lounge for business travelers. Location Locaction Location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Frequent guest.”
Reviews.Author: RagtopDazed
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property many times over the years. The rooms are typically European, (Read:small); however they are very nicely appointed with iron, ironing board, minibar, hair drier and internet access. The restaurant is a destination restaurant so you will need to make reservations to eat here. There is a Spa, indoor pool and workout room that are adequate for the property. I request inside rooms, but remember to close the shades as the view from the hallway is right into the inside rooms. The staff is generally helpful and certainly very professional. There are a lot of good restaurants nearby and the Musee de Louvre is about three blocks away. Carr's Irish pub across the street is a good place to go to escape the high priced "adult beverages" on the property. I highly recommend this property if staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Once again EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Amaryviajar
Reviews.Content: We return to this fabulous hotel because of the personal and professional service. Not only do they know you by name but are accommodating to any requests. Location is excellent for shopping, dinning and the Louvre. We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Fathers Marriott”
Reviews.Author: donojames
Reviews.Content: First Question..Does anyone pay to stay here? Everyone we met in the lobby or Bar or restaurant seemed to be staying on Marriott points and frankly who could blame them when you combine great service, charming boutique hotel feel and an amazing location but hey how do they stay in business! We had a great 5 night stay here, beautiful room overlooking a small private courtyard, outstanding servcie from the concierge staff in particular who suggested quite a few interesting restaurants and single handedly negotiated a psycho cab driver via phone who felt that our latin quarter restaurant was actually somewhere near the arch de triomphe. They then offered to pay for the cab since it had resulted in a late arrival for dinner despite having no culpability for the nutcase other than calling for a taxi! I would really strongly endorse staying here as the location , service and ambiance really make this a nice place in Paris

Reviews.Title: “In the center of town”
Reviews.Author: FilipeLisbon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in business. The hotel is in the center of town, close to Louvre, the subway, and MusÃ©e D'Orsay. Rooms are nice, the street is very quiet and it is an excellent choice for a visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “"The Perfect Paris Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Dave T
Reviews.Content: Combination of warm and gracious staff with a perfect 1 st Arond. location. Whether on vacation or business, it would be difficult to find a better choice. This is a very well-run property.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - repeat stay!”
Reviews.Author: cup-of-jo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel years ago & loved it. They'd been sold out during my subsequent visits to Paris, but they had rooms this time. I was very fortunate. It has a great location & wonderful staff. It is an easy walk from Tulleries Garden & the Louvre. Tulleries metro stop gives easy access to the rest of Paris, or an easy walk to many points of interest. Exit left, turn left & then right for an ATM/bankomat & great shopping. Or walk to Haussman for even better shopping. The room was comfortable & the bed was devine! Robes & slippers provided, along with Bvulgari bath products. Breakfast was good with hot & cold options, & even omelets upon request. It was a short trip, so I left my PC at home. The internet was included in my room, but my smartphone had issues connecting to iBahn, so they let me borrow their PC. I was completely & pleasantly surprised. I saw another guest use it later in the weekend. This is such a nice perk to have available. Again, this is a wonderful hotel with fabulous staff. It has a great location & easy access to all of Paris. This hotel is always top on my list whenever I go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Delmart
Reviews.Content: We were guests for four nights earlier this month. The location is perfect. We found everyone to be very helpful. The room was somewhat small but it was acceptable

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FabF0urTravelers
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic. We stayed here with our two little kids (6 and 2). It feel like a boutique hotel. When we checked in, the person at the front desk let us see two rooms to select (we picked one with a terrace -- so lovely with wicker furniture and a big umbrella). He gave us a tour of the hotel (took us to the pool, gym, and locker rooms). As an aside, the pool is like a spa pool with chairs to lounge. The gym is great. Each cardio machine has a tv (there is music playing in the gym). There are two treadmills and two cross training machines (maybe more), weights. There is free fruit down there and peach flavored water). There is a sauna and steamroom. Back to the hotel, the beds are extremely comfortable. The shower products are amazing and high quality. The tv doesn't have any entertainment channels in English. There is a DVD player but American DVDs don't work. They have some free DVDs to borrow. There are movies that you can stream for a charge. There is a coffee machine for lattes and American coffee put out in the am. There is a lovely breakfast, which we highly recommend. There is also free candy (gummy kind and lollypops) as well as infused water in the afternoon. Also, there is a computer and we had a card with a certain amount of time for free internet access.There are also the morning papers and magazines to read. You don't go to Paris to stay in the room. The hotel is in walking distance to the Louvre and the Orsey. We walked to Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter. The metro is also right there. We had a great trip and the hotel made it very special.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Muccimooch
Reviews.Content: I searched the Marriott website for a hotel in Paris and decided to stay at the Renaissance Vendome using my rewards points. I could not have been more lucky! The staff at this hotel went out of their way to smile, be friendly, and make sure all of my needs were met all of the time. I was in room 501, which was on the 5th floor and had it's own little balcony. The room was larger than what I expected, as I had been warned that hotel rooms in Paris are notoriously tiny. The bed was very comfortable, and the air conditioning pumped out cold air all of the time. In fact, I think my room was the only place in Paris that had "real" air conditioning. When I arrived, there was a box of chocolates and a bottle of wine waiting for me. Also, the toiletries in the bathroom were all Bulgari: all of the soaps, shampoos, lotions, shower gel...wow! But, the very best part of the hotel was the excellent location. You are one block from Rue di Rivoli, which is perfect because you do not want to be "on" Rue di Rivoli because of the noise. The Renaissance is tucked on a little street just behind Rivoli, so you are near the main drag without having the nuisance (noise) of being on the main drag. You are close to a ton of great restaurants and cafes. There is a small spa in the lowest level of the hotel. There is a steam room and a sauna. The steam room had an unusual ceiling, which gave the effect of tiny little stars. Sitting in the steam room after a long day of walking around Paris was heaven! There is also one "body shower" in the spa, which I took advantage of after each steaming. I was pretty surprised to find that there was a pool in the lower level, too. The spa is not large and is for hotel guests. The reason why I point this out is because sometimes a hotel will advertise to come to their hotel for the spa (ie, the spa is the destination) and then you find that the spa is the size of a closet. The spa at the Renaissance is definitely not large, but also is not the size of a closet. Recommended places in Paris: Cafe Richlieu at The Louve (get the Angelina brunch), Chez Flottes (french onion soup and creme brulee), Don Juan II (very lovely dinner on the Siene), Les Dux Magots (duck salad), Cafe Le Mouff'tard (mussels and toast)

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MichalP76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 night at the beginning of August. We arrived early and our room was ready, got a complimentary upgrade to bigger room so we didnt experince any issues with space. Our room also had a litte backyard with two chairs for sitting outside. Unfortunately The weather was cold. The location is outstanding, you can walk to Le Louvre in less than 10 minutes. The subway is 5 min walk from the hotel. Alvaro from Seville at the Front Desk was outstanding, always helpful and with great attitude. Next stay in Paris will be here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - great value for points redemption.”
Reviews.Author: Fejman
Reviews.Content: Stayed using Marriott points plus â‚¬50 a night. Did not experience any of the other reviewers rude desk staff. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready but the front desk sent us to the bar, bought us a drink and had the room ready when they said it would be. Breakfast was nice by American standards and fantastic by European ones. We had a room on the 5th floor with a small balcony. Nicely sized, huge tub, standard European shower. A/C worked (not that it was needed much), the room was nicely furnished and as quiet as a room in the 1st can be. With my status not only did we get breakfast but also free internet; a great deal for a hotel two blocks from the Louve!

Reviews.Title: “Plush, clean, but small space”
Reviews.Author: Paris-Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week in November. It was a very luxurious experience. It well furnished and decorated, with nice amenities in the room. Both my wife and I thought the bathroom was very nice. The housekeeping service kept the room extremely clean. The window in our room opened up out to the street, with the front door. The room was very quiet, with no street noise or sounds from the adjacent rooms. Our only complaint is that the closet space was pretty slim â€“ literally. I managed to get one medium suitcase to lay flat on the bottom and we put the other medium suitcase on a luggage rack between the window and the bed (it barely fit). The other closet door opened up to shelving, where we unpacked our toiletries. Overall, we were pretty cramped in the room and were able to make it work. The neighborhood is very nice. Itâ€™s located in Parisâ€™ classiest shopping district with a number of nearby restaurant options. While it is a couple blocks away from the metro; the station is pretty small and is not serviced by multiple lines. But that doesnâ€™t seem to matter much in Paris where typical tourist destinations always seem to involve a transfer to a 2nd metro line. There is a pretty casual Irish bar right across the street, where we found nice low-key relaxation after a day of being tourists. In summary, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite”
Reviews.Author: jenglar
Reviews.Content: I always stay here while in Paris. The location cannot be beat. All of the staff and especially the concierges are fantastic and so helpful. WiFi was a bit spotty and some areas are just starting to show some age but all in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute find”
Reviews.Author: Keano_dad
Reviews.Content: Just come back from trip to Paris, a present for my Wife's Birthday. Eurostar makes this trip easy for us, booked this hotel as a package on the Eurostar website, having stay in Vendome a couple of times over the years on work visits. The chap in reception, welcomed us warmly and said "I have taken the liberty of upgrading you..." . You know its going well. When they found the purpose of the trip was to celebrate my wife's birthday, they put a bottle of wine and some chocolates in our room, with a note from the staff, signed by them all. Brits tend to think of the French as pretty aloof, but all the staff were very, very warm and helpful. Nice pool, fantastically comfortable beds. Lunch at L:'Avenue, Dinner at Hotel Costes, drinks at this place on the lawns opposite the Louvre Pyramid all highly recommended. But this Renaissance is an excellent base to explore Paris and we will be going back next August with the Kids for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: abrownchair
Reviews.Content: We stayed here almost a week and felt very comfortable. The hotel is pricey, but had everything we could want or need. The indoor pool/workout area/steam/sauna & day beds were perfect for relaxing after a hard day of sightseeing. We were in the "worst" room, right over the front door, on the first level and still found the room to be well appointed. The noise across the street was only audible once - not a big deal for us. The staff was helpful but not really interested in having the high level of service/attitude needed for the price of the hotel. Overall, very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a five star. Just a generic corporate chain hotel.”
Reviews.Author: peneloperose
Reviews.Content: This hotel was indistinguishable from dozens of soul-less corporate hotels I have stayed at in the States. Everything was more or less fine, except that the room was so tiny we could barely walk around the bed (and this was an upgraded room!) Also, the toilet was separate from the rest of the bathroom, and was so close to the bed that it gave zero privacy...smells and noises one would rather not share with their significant other... I also stayed at Le Meurice while on this trip, and found it to be much better, although 25% more expensive....but Le Meurice is a true 5 star...Renaissance is a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: Wonderfulworld2009
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews we decided to stay at the Renaissance Vendome. What a perfect choice! Pardon Me French community, but my 2 previous experiences in Paris were not very good. People were not very " friendly" in the hotels ,restaurants and shops. However this was a totally different experience. I loved it! The staff in this hotel was great, they went out of their way to please us and even try to speak my native language ( Portuguese and Spanish). The staff was super polite and made our experience unforgettable. The room was spacious ( for Paris standards) and had an amazing bed and all the amenities you would expect in such hotel. The location was excellent, close to many GREAT restaurants, shops and cafes. I loved the fact that it was located in a charm, quiet, calm street yet close to everything. I would be back tomorrow! Don't miss close to the hotel: Angelina Cafe for breakfast or afternoon tea! Chez Flottes Restaurant- for lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant suprise!”
Reviews.Author: EllenNewJersey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel at the last minute for a quick long weekend in Paris. As several of the charming hotels we have stayed at in the past were booked, American Express booked a room for us at this hotel. We were very pleasantly surprised at how nice it was. Prior to arrival, the conceirge were very helpful in booking restaurants withing walking distance of the hotel. They made very nice recommendations at typical France restaurants that did not cater to tourists! Upon arrival, Francois at the front desk went out of his way to make sure we had a non smoking room with a king size bed in a quiet location. He showed us several rooms before we settled on one overlooking the courtyard. I have to say that we had the best sleep we have ever had in Paris. The bed was very comfortable, the room was quite cool and there was not any street noise. Overall, we found the staff at this hotel to be very friendly and helpful. It is well located and you can walk everywhere. The only downside for us is that it is filled with mostly Americans, most likely because it is a Marriott property. All in all it is a very good choice in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not â‚¬480 good”
Reviews.Author: janwayne69
Reviews.Content: If you don't care whether you spend â‚¬300 or â‚¬450 per night, then this is a good hotel for you. Pleasant interieur, typically good Renaissance staff, small but nice SPA area with 15m pool, overall quite pleasant. But, in a normal city, I would have expected much more for my money, more space in my room, free internet, bigger breakfast selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especially location”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyage555
Reviews.Content: This is a very well located hotel covenant the The Louvre etc. It is clean and the staff is very helpful/professional. breakfast, although free because of our Marriott level was marginal. But, oh well....free...that's about it. we didn't have dinner there because of average breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Locataion, Great Pub Next Door"”
Reviews.Author: hbflaw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights and loved it. This hotel sits in a wonderful location and provides access to everything. As to be expected the rooms are not very big however they are very clean, modern and the hotel over is very well maintained. The staff is very helpful in every aspect, their suggested restaurants we excellent, the only bad meals we had were when we chanced it. The pool and sauna were wonderful, quite and high end. Our tip to fellow travelers after a day of running around the city often paying way to much for everything, stop at the Carrs Irish Pub, (either before dinner or on your way home) Literally across from the front door of the hotel. Its a nice pub to get a "in-expensive" beer and listen to live music. There is usually a nice mix of locals and fellow travelers. After a day of feeling like a tourist its a great place to chill.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, but breathtakingly expensive for the size of room!”
Reviews.Author: lilyloves2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on the occasion of a special birthday celebration. The hotel is fantastically located, you couldnâ€™t ask for much better in my opinion. Within a couple of minutes walk, we were at the river Seine, or the Louvre, fabulous shops like Chopard, Cartier, Chanel and many other designer brands, as well as lots of cafes. Everything was right on the doorstep. The decor in the lobby is modern, fresh and funky. During our entire stay we were treated well, and the staff were very helpful, friendly and accommodating. The concierge helped my husband organize flowers for our room, which were there on arrival. When they heard it was my birthday, a little present was left for me to unwrap, which was a nice touch! Iâ€™ll admit the room was small. However the bathroom was beautiful and spacious, with separate tub and walk in marble shower, high gloss tiling and lovely Bulgari products. We had a room facing the courtyard, and it was very quiet. We could open the French doors facing the courtyard and it was peaceful and lovely in the morning to have the sun streaming into the room. The sheets were crisp and the bed exceptionally big and comfortable. The highlight of the hotel for us was the restaurant, Pinxo. We thought the food was fabulous and reasonably priced as well, considering the hotel and surrounding area. We ate 2 out of 3 nights in there! However, we werenâ€™t so keen on the small bar/lounge area. Not much atmosphere and the decor was not in keeping with the rest of the hotel. I would prefer to have drinks in the lobby than the somewhat dingy bar! I have to say that the price we paid for our three nights was eye-watering. We are well travelled and donâ€™t mind splurging occasionally for a special treat, but I would not go back to the Renaissance if paying the full rack rate. Once in a lifetime is enough. Great location and service, but agree with other reviewers: breathtakingly expensive for the size of room. We also found the internet wifi price to be extortionate!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, nice rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: DaisyDay484
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel. The location was perfect for walking to many sites or accessing the metro. Service was excellent in all regards. The concierge services were very helpful; they helped us with many tips along the way but most importantly secured us great seats at the French Open Another example was when one of the doorman was eager to intervene when we were having difficulty with a taxi that had taken us to the hotel from one of the sites. The room was very nice: upscale, spotless, very quiet (6th floor, facing the courtyard). We were glad to have a shower, and the bathroom was roomy by French standards. The room, however, was quite small. We were upgraded to a superior room, and the space on either side of the bed was just enough to talk down. Our only complaint was the high fee for wifi access, which seems excessive for such a pricey hotel; all our other hotels in France had free wifi. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms very very small (even with an upgrade)”
Reviews.Author: cordelia1988
Reviews.Content: Location cannot be beat for the main attractions in Paris. The hotel was clean, the staff excellent. The rooms however are very small and we had upgraded. Overall I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: TravlAgain
Reviews.Content: The primary complaint is that this is a very small hotel and I felt claustrophobic during my stay. From the lobby, to the bar, to the elevator, to the hallways, to the room (and everything in it). It was all uncomfortably small, so that I kept tripping over things in my room. I even moved the chair to the entryway of my room to try and get more space within the room, but then I had to jump over the chair to enter and leave! It was annoying. I was so glad that I'd only brought a carry on bag, as I'm not sure what you would even do with a full-size suitcase. There's no place to put it in the room! The service of the hotel was mediocre. The front desk staff I found to be somewhat intrusive, the bar staff was distracted, the restaurant food was just o.k., the room service was decent and they at least seemed to try fairly hard. I just wasn't impressed with the place - as perhaps I had higher expectations for a Renaissance hotel. It was not dramatically superior to a good Marriott, and as Marriott Rewards Gold member I didn't feel that I got any special treatment during my stay. This hotel has one important thing going for it - an excellent location. It is very centrally-located, which is why I chose to stay there. Very convenient place, which makes walking easy. The location also is important because it is on a side street - thus, it is a quiet place to stay. No complaints about getting sleep (e.g., no traffic noise, no subway noises, etc. - which I've read is problematic about other luxury hotels in Paris). For that reason alone, I might stay there again. That's what I'd say to anyone considering the hotel - it's a quite place to stay, close to many sites, but don't have high expectations. The "view" out the windows is somewhat dreary - overlooks apartments on one side and a small street on the other. I've read others say they were pleased with an interior courtyard view, which might be fine, as there's obviously nothing to see out the window.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, perfect location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Glenstone
Reviews.Content: We got a room on the back side of the hotel (615) where there was absolutely no street noise. The room was exceptionally clean. and, the bath products were first class. While Renaissance normally maintains a great hotel, this one is one of the best. Everything in the room worked properly. This hotel is ideally located in one of the best parts of Paris. The metro is only 1 minute away and wonderful restaurants are only steps away. I have to say, the staff went out of their way to be helpful in ways I have never experienced. When we left for 3 days, they offered to keep our extra bags in their closet until we returned. Every employee, including the doorman and maids, always smiled and said hello whenever we were within 15 ft. Every time we entered the lobby, someone would greet us and offer assistance. Anything we wanted, from cabs, to restaurant recommendations. They were friendly and always willing to do whatever it takes to make our vacation a pleasant one. I travel 100+ nights a year and I know good hotel. A few times a year, I find an excellent hotel with a great staff. I am not being paid or rewarded for these comments. I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone........even road warriers like myself.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive although good location!”
Reviews.Author: SDN13
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in April 2011 at the Renaissance Vendome hotel in Paris. The room was very small, with no tea or coffee making facilities and the price did not include breakfast (which was an extra â‚¬30 each). The location was very good and you are close to Tuileries metro station which is great to explore the city, however, this did not make up for the cost of the hotel room which was â‚¬352 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great hotel and recommended”
Reviews.Author: Saar814
Reviews.Content: You simply cannot beat the location of the Renaissance Paris Vendome, walking distance to the Tuleries, Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Place Vendome, Opera, etc. In addition, you are only 1 minute from the Metro. The staff are all very friendly and helpful, the only knock against them is that the concierge recommended a restaurant that gave me food poisoning. Both breakfast and dinner at Pinxo were fantastic. The rooms were a decent size for Paris, but the lack of storage space for clothing and luggage was a minor annoyance. The size of the shower is tight as well. The room came with a larger than King Size bed, that was exceptionally comfortable, we slept great every night. On the downside, the internet costs 15 EUR per day, which can add up quick, and wifi is not available in the rooms, only ethernet cable , which was an issue for someone traveling with a Macbook Air. Luckily the apple store is just a 5 minute walk away. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again, and would recommend it with little hesitation to friends. The marshmallows in the lobby were a nice treat after a long day of walking and seeing the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, A Few Glitches”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1992
Reviews.Content: To start, the hotel staff was great. To a person they tried very hard to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. When we arrived they got us into our rooms early, but the rooms were not consistent with what I had reserved. They were able to move us to two other rooms, one that first day and the second the next, that were correct. The hotel is in very good shape. The decor is modern European and well done. The room sizes were pretty good for Paris and the bathrooms were large. The main issue we had with the hotel is that the room keys would not work for long. These are the magnetic strip type and they were constantly failing, which required multiple trips to the front desk for replacements. We were told the keys are very sensitive and any contact with cell phones or credit cards (!) would demagnetize the room key, but we were extremely careful after the first couple of occurences and still had significant troubles. Other issues were phones and tvs that failed to work during our stay and delayed maintenance to address the issues. Also, note that internet access is not included and at 15 Euro a day it is pretty pricey. The location is perfect, just a block from Place Vendome, a few blocks from the Louvre and a half block from the Jardin des Tuileries (and a short walk through the garden takes you to the pedestrian bridge to St. Germain). Over all, a very nice stay. The hotel is new, clean, modern, well located, and with a fantastic staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: EBNY_15
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2011 with my husband while on vacation. We loved this hotel! It's in a great location - we walked to everything we wanted to see. The customer service was fantastic, the food was good, and the beds were very comfortable. When we return to Paris we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal location for a perfect 'Heart of Paris' holiday”
Reviews.Author: VaBeachSmiths
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a super location (Vendome/Concorde/Louvre) on a quiet street, with 5 Star accommodations, restaurant and service - you have found the Renaissance Paris Vendome! Traveled with 2 teenage boys which made this an even better place for them to see the sights, grab a bite or hop on a bus, metro or train in a few minutes walk. I will ONLY stay here again on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely deserving of high praise. Friendly, competent staff.”
Reviews.Author: lesmil123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I used Marriott points for our stay and upgraded for 50 Euros extra. The staff treated us extremely well. The concierge ( Julian and Oliver) were exceptional and accommodated our every request. We had an early morning flight and arrived at the hotel at 10. They had a room for us which was wonderful after a long trans-Atlantic flight. This was my second stay there and would definitely return again, with or without reward points!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique 5 Stars Gems”
Reviews.Author: Bonbon1399
Reviews.Content: Close to metro station (3 mins walk), the hotel was located on a quiet street. Lobby was small but cozy. The whole hotel was run under boutique style, guest room are smaller than other in town. Got upgraded to superior room which has bath tube. Excellent service throughout stay. Plenty of restaurant choices around the hotel area. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helps to have status with Marriott”
Reviews.Author: kkotarek
Reviews.Content: Travelling as a platinum elite Marriott member made the entire experience even better since we were provided free internet and breakfast, if I had to pay for either I would have been greatly disappointed. We were in room 312 with a window that opened into the courtyard. The room was small and it was difficult to store two large pieces of luggage along with carry on pieces however we got creative and made it work. The bathroom was large with both a tub and separate shower. The bedding was excellent and very comfortable. We found it hard to maintain an ideal temperature so often opened our window to quickly cool down the room. We used the fitness center every morning and enjoyed having the place to ourselves each morning; the pool resistance system was not working which was a bit disappointing since we had been looking forward to using it. After the first day we advised the front desk that our serve bar was warm and not working, service did stop by once when we were napping and never returned. We never made mention of it again since I assumed our service order was still open yet the fridge never was fixed. Walking to the Opera House, Vendome, Louvre and dâ€™orsey was quick and easy. We left the hotel nightly for dinner in the Vendome area and enjoyed coming home to the lobby to grab some marshmallows and gummy bears, nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: minideee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. The day we arrived, it was our son's birthday and our anniversary. Before arriving we mentioned in the email that it will be our very special time in Paris. When we arrived, we had wonderful complementary gifts for our son and for us waiting in our room. We were so grateful for their hospitality. The room was wonderful. We realy liked it the personal greeting on the TV screen saying "welcome mr and mrs". That meant a lot to us. It was also nice to have some water pitchers in the lobby to refresh ourselves after the long day. ALL workers (including Ms. Marie) were very very nice and helful. Our 6 years son loved the hotel, loved Paris love the whole trip. It was the best family time in Paris and this Renaissance Paris Vendome hotel helped that to fulfill.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: alfa2727
Reviews.Content: We had been to this hotel a couple of years before and it was a pleasure to return in November. The hotel is perfectly located near the shops and sights and doesn't take too long to get to from gare du nord. I requested in advance and was given a room on the top floor that although very small was had a tiny balcony. It ended up being too chilly to use during this stay, but in our previous stay we had really enjoyed sitting out there in the evening after a day of walking and having a glass of wine. The room itself is very cosy and comfortable and although small is perfect for a short city break when you're likely to be out for most of the day. I can't comment on any of the other facilities in the hotel, apparently there is a pool but we didn't use it, and apparently there is a chinese restaurant that is very good but we didn't try it. We did have breakfast and weren't that impressed, it was fine for a quick bite before heading to the airport or a meeting etc but if your day is going to be spent wandering around paris i would skip the hotl breakfast and find a cafe nearby. Additionally i want to say how helpful we found the staff there, every request we had from finding us a plug adapter to location shops/restaurants, drawing maps etc was handled quickly and very agreeably.

Reviews.Title: “The OK stay”
Reviews.Author: franklin116
Reviews.Content: When i walked down the marble hallway to get to the reception desk i thought this was going to be a great stay but then it turns out the first day was not that great at breakfast because they don't really have a breakfast buffett but kinda of i could say. Then there is the surroundings you are about 15 minutes away from the Louve which is the most amazing sight but i would reccomend taking a taxi cab to most resturants just like we did. The pool and fitness center was the coolest to.

Reviews.Title: “OMG - We Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: GeraldandMarie
Reviews.Content: What can one say...Paris in the winter, GREAT hotel, terrific weather...can't really expect more, but this hotel delivered it!! We must admit that this is the second time in 3 years that we have stayed here, and it was outstanding!! Let us first compliment the concierge staff...David, Olivier, and Marie. They truly make the experience here terrific! They helped us with train reservations and ticketing before we arrived, they made numerous recommendations and reservations, and as my wife would say, put up with my questions and inquiries always with a smile and warmth of true professionals. They know so many great restaurants and places to go to, that we ultimately forgot about the research we did, and relied ontheir suggestions. We have travelled to many places in the world, and can honestly say that our experiences at this hotel rank in the top few we have had. We can whole-heartedly recommend this hotel to anyone seeking luxury, outstanding and impeccible service, great accommodations, and a perfect location. Thank you for a wonderful stay, and thank you David, Olivier and Marie for making it so!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Location is Unbeatable!”
Reviews.Author: THeElfsMama
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days here with our four year old. The location is truly unbeatable. A block from Tuileries garden (which in the winter houses a carousel and Ferris wheel in addition to a playground and trampoline area). Walking distance to the Orangerie, Orsay and Louvre. Three Metro stops nearby (though we only used them for trips to the Eiffel tower). Staff was very helpful, rooms were small but nicely outfitted, breakfast served int he hotel restaurant was great. Indoor pool was also a plus with a small child (in the middle of a snow storm outside).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cafcolonel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in walking distance to most attractions. The employees and concierge were most helpful and friendly, and were very well informed. The Christmas market was very close too! Our room was small and we had no issues with the service. We did not eat out everynight, but did go to a smaller, well stocked food market about two blocks away to pick up supplies. The hotel does have a charge for the internet. I will consider this hotel in the future, with the biggest factor being the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location and a surprise for a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_SnobinSeattle
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a quick weekend to spend in Paris â€“ and selected this hotel based primarily on location, but also description as a â€œBoutiqueâ€� type hotel. It was an excellent choice, and for a Marriott, â€œchainâ€� hotel, it lived up to its marketing â€“ it didnâ€™t feel like a large â€˜chainâ€™ hotel, but like a Boutique hotel. We stayed on Marriott points, with an upgraded (50 Euro/night) to get a larger room - so I can't speak to value if I was paying full price. The points upgrade was worth it, but probably not necessary. No hotel is cheap in Paris, and itâ€™s very difficult to find anything that is well done (upgraded), that isnâ€™t dated or shabby, or feels like itâ€™s been â€˜chopped upâ€™, without spending a very large amount of money. This is a Marriott, not the Ritz (around the corner), but the service was top-notch â€“ very helpful. Best quality: location. Incredibly central â€“ close walking to Vendome, Rue Saint-Honore, Gallery-Lafayette â€“ lots of great upscale shopping and choice of restaurants nearby, but on a quiet street. Walk to the Louvre, Champs-Elysees â€“ and a Metro stop to get anywhere else easily. I canâ€™t say enough about the location â€“ especially if you want something central in town. Next best - Rooms/hotel. The hotel was remodeled in the last three years, but looks like in the last six month â€“ both rooms and lobby. The main lobby was at one time a small inner (outdoor) courtyard for the building surrounding it. A vaulted glass roof at the 1st floor level closes in the court-yard to create the hotel lobby. Some of the interior hotel roomsâ€™ windows look down on the roof, and into the lobby. There is plenty of comfortable seating, and a side sitting room with a REAL, wood burning fire-place (and they use it). DÃ©cor is chic is and contemporary/modern, but not stark.
