There is a self-serve coffee/espresso maker to make coffee at any time. Our room was excellent â€“ facing the street, with little street noise (on a Friday/Saturday night). The room was one â€˜classâ€™ up from the standard room (not a suite), with plenty of room to get around, and lots of clothing storage (hanging space and shelves), and an excellent sized bathroom, especially by European standards. Best - The room and hotel didnâ€™t feel like it was â€˜all chopped upâ€™ like many remodeled hotels in Europe. Comfortable bed with Cotton sheets and comforter. Slept very well. The pool area and fitness center are both good, located in the basement. The pool is particularly nice â€“great lighting, mood-music (lounge), and chaise and chair seating all around â€“ come here to swim a couple laps and get wet, or chill out with coffee or tea and book â€“ it has a very relaxing feel. The fitness area is small (but probably very typical in size for Paris), however useable â€“ with new Life-fitness equipment - two tread-mills, and one elliptical, and one summit-trainer (stair climber), some lighter dumbbells and a cable machine. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it! â€“ for both the location and the hotel. Best for couples and business travelers, but would probably work for small families too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Surreyintheknow
Reviews.Content: The best location. Walking distance to all major attractions. Cant comment on most facilities as spent most of our time out and about. Room was perfect. People at desk very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Oh la la Oh Oui Oui”
Reviews.Author: heyyouPittsboro
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel, staff, rooms, cleanliness, and food. The breakfast was terrific. We had Gold status so it was included. The location is the best in Paris I think, and on a very quiet street. One block from the Tulieries metro station. Walk to the Lourve, Norte Dame, D'Orsey, Vendome, Arch D' T, etc.. Marriott should consider this staff one of the best - top to bottom. Doormen, Cleaning persons, Check-in folks, Wait staff, cooks, everyone. They really make you feel welcome. English no problem. The place is spotless, lobby, rooms, great turn down at night (so considerate they even will boost the temperature for you, so you arrive back at nite to a warm room). Bathroom and shower were immaculate. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The service let us down, consistently.”
Reviews.Author: LovesLondon29
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a service on par with four star was very disappointed. The rooms were small as one expects in Paris but perfectly formed; the room amenities were also good. Room service for a simple late supper took the best part of 80 minutes following three phone calls. I'm fine when people are honest about little screw-ups, we're human and it happens. The first two excuses were straightforward lies which was very frustrating and my sweetheart was getting rather unhappy at the lack of food. A glass of champagne was sent by way of an apology but at 2230 we'd rather just have our supper. Breakfast arrived in the morning with missing things; and then I discovered that my pre-ordered taxi was not ordered in advance at all; the telephone call was made when I arrived in down in reception and so I waited a further 25 minutes for the taxi. A touch stressful because I almost missed my connection with the late taxi. If they got the service right here, this could be an impeccably place to stay. And so all in all, a good trip with my amazing boyfriend but the hotel service let it down.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel with lovely staff & a great pool -- blocks from the Louvre”
Reviews.Author: AdamandAmanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Paris Vendome for seven nights and hated to leave! The lobby always had beautiful flowers (and a candy jar) and the staff was helpful & kind. We only made it down to the pool once, but it was a beautiful swimming pool. We loved the recommendations at the concierge desk and the rooms were super clean.

Reviews.Title: “probably should avoid”
Reviews.Author: travelandtravail
Reviews.Content: Good location but rooms small and overpriced. Peeling pain in bathroom. "complimentary water" by bedside only on day 1, and when called to see why no other bottled water was told only the first night otherwise room service charge. Funny for several hundred euros a night. They arranged a car for me to airport but expensive. Not a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, superb, magnifique”
Reviews.Author: ProvidenceJn
Reviews.Content: Before venturing to Paris, I read every Trip Advisor review. The following is the the only one you will need. Small, intimate, close to metro, quiet, unparalleled concierge staff, well appointed rooms, not like any Marriott I have ever visited. It will not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: luvtotraveltheworld1
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel in a great location. Within walking distance to upscale shopping, dining and attractions. Only several blocks to the metro. We had a well appointed room that overlooked a beautiful street that ended at the Tulleries Garden. The staff is extremely friendly and accomodating, always having answers to the many questions and requests we bestowed upon them. Make sure to dine in the hotel's Pinxo Restaurant. Wonderful presentation, taste, atmosphere and service.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but well located”
Reviews.Author: Mostly_business1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to its proximity to the tourist sites, especially the Louvre which are within walking distance. On arrival we were informed that our room was not ready and we'd have to wait for 2 hours before it was. After an 12 hour overnight trip we did not want to wait and agreed to take a 'slightly' smaller room that was ready. Thank goodness we weren't in the room much as it was one fo the most clausterphobic rooms I have stayed in in Europe (which is saying a lot). It was a nice, well appointed room but was so small I had to store my suitcase in the closet or we wouldn't have even been able to move around. The shower design was very poor and leaked resulting in water damage to the painted wall next to it. I'm also not a fan of the glass doors to the bathroom as it affords no privacy. The bed was lumpy and not of the usual Marriott quality; if we had stayed longer it probably would have been an issue. The room was quiet though thankfully. We were very unimpressed with the room service which arrived without covers and was barely warm. Thankfully there are lots of good restaurants close to the hotel so we ate out the rest of the time. Staff were friendly and professional. This hotel is VERY expensive so I don't think it offers great value for your money but we stayed using our Marriott/American Airlines points so it was affordable for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: GreatCoupleWithKids
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend. The hotel is lovely - a boutique hotel four blocks walk from the Louvre. Quiet rooms, small, elegant lobby. The Rooms Division Manager, Julie Lohezic, went out of her way to make our visit fantastic. We truly felt like valued guests thanks to Julie. (Wild contrast to our stay immediately after at the London Marriott County Hall, where management was awful and no one cared less when things went wrong.) The Vendome has a great indoor pool - not common in Paris. It gave my family the perfect way to end our days of sightseeing. The concierge was quite helpful with suggestions. Recommended awesome restaurant nearby (Gambinis), also very helpful with transportation suggestions. My husband is Marriott Platinum, so breakfast was included. It was delicious but of course like everything in Paris, would have been pricey if we were paying for the whole family. Overall, this is a lovely hotel but the thing that made the difference was superb customer service from Julie and the whole staff. We were traveling with a teen with autism, I emailed her in way advance of our specific room needs and I would say they were met beyond my expectations. I felt that Julie and the staff genuinely cared that we had a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Paris...Loved, loved our stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: watraveler
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Paris Vendome is a GREAT hotel! We enjoyed everything about it! The check in attendants were fabulous and the concierge David and Oliver were very helpful with advice. They both gave fabulous recommendations! Our room was very nice and comfortable; the bathroom toiletries (Blvgari) were a nice touch! The hotel has a nice workout/pool facility. The location was the best as it is near great shopping (Rue St. Honore), restaurants, Louvre, Jardins Tuilleries, Metro, and more. Each morning we had breakfast in their restaurant and there was quite the array of foods...we loved it and the restaurant staff accommodated me with soy milk since I was allergic to regular cow's milk! Great job Renaissance! We will definitely stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Paris!

Reviews.Title: “it was great”
Reviews.Author: Dovile_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. The day we arrived, it was our son's birthday and our anniversary. Before arriving we mentioned in the email that it will be our very special time in Paris. When we arrived, we had wonderful complementary gifts for our son and for us waiting in our room. We were so grateful for their hospitality. The room was wonderful. We realy liked it the personal greeting on the TV screen saying "welcome mr and mrs". That meant a lot to us. It was also nice to have some water pitchers in the lobby to refresh ourselves after the long day. ALL workers (including Ms. Marie) were very very nice and helful. Our 6 years son loved the hotel, loved Paris love the whole trip. It was the best family time in Paris and this Renaissance Paris Vendome hotel helped that to fulfill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: Two-Wheel_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Our week stay (or rather 6 nights) at the Renaissance Vendome was very enjoyable. We chose the hotel for its location and the pool, a combination not easy to find in Paris. Check-in was easy and welcoming. The hotel is not large, but it is well appointed and attractive, in my view. The lobby looks like it was recently renovated and is comfortable. There's a lounge / pseudo business area off to the side of the lobby with reading material and a fireplace. Thumbs up on the lobby / lounge. The elevators are very much "old Paris". They're cozy, but reasonably fast. On the other hand, hallways on each floor are reasonably sized and reasonably well done. In contrast to other reviews I've seen, we were pretty happy with the size of our room. However, we stayed in a junior suite, where there is a separate room with a couch that folds out to a bed for a third person, which we needed. TVs, beds, desk, etc. were all tasteful and functional. Drawer space was lacking, though the shelves in the closets do allow for sufficient space to put clothes, etc. Bed was comfortable, however, was not a true king size bed. They pushed together two twin beds and then put a pad over that. Not a big deal, but not as comfortable as a real king. One quibble with the maid service was that they did not clean obviously used glassware until we asked. They also left insufficient towels twice, despite the room being set up for three people. No big deal, the desk had towels brought up both times. We slept extremely well. The curtains when drawn let in absolutely no light ... which makes it easy to sleep away half the day if you're not careful. It was also extremely quiet despite being in the middle of the city. The bathroom was large with a very nice bathtub, separate shower, and a toilet in its own alcove with a door for privacy. The bathroom lacked sufficient bars to hang wet towels, so essentially, you either refold your wet towels and put them on the shelf where they do not dry or leave them on the floor for the maid service to pick up. Not very environmentally friendly -- and brings down room quality a notch, in my view. We didn't try out the room service as we kept the couch pulled out to be a bed the whole time, thus not too much room for a proper meal. Maybe next time. We did try out the Asian-themed bar in the lobby. The drinks were good, but the food was so-so. Service was ok. The pool is indoors, small, but very nice. There are also a fitness area and spa, which are nicely sized considering the size of the hotel (not large). Location is outstanding. You're near the center of the city, Les Tuilleries, Louvre, Vendome, the river, etc. etc. In fact, it's almost too good, because the neighborhood is all about expensive boutiques and tourist-focused high-end restaurants. On the occasions we just wanted a plain brasserie for breakfast or whatever, you need to search a bit. Price is not cheap. Value is ok, if you book well ahead of time, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Vendome”
Reviews.Author: habs07
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and had an excellent stay at the Renaissance Vendome. The room was small but very comfortable. We had an early morning arrival, so we pre-booked the room for the previous night to ensure it would be ready when we arrived. The staff had our flight information and had breakfast waiting for us in the room when we arrived. The attention to detail at this hotel is phenomenal and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: kleiker
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights (July 23-270 in the Paris Renaaissance Vendome. the purpose of the trip was to see the last stage of the Tour de France bicycle race. The location of the hotel, just one block off the Rue de Rivoli proved to be an excellent location to watch the race. Although I am not too crazy about boutique hotels, the Vendome was quite comfortable. At check in they did not have the king size bed room available so I was given a normal size bed but they gave me free breakfast ( for the entire stay) for making the switch. The hotel staff is excellent and friendly. The hotel resturant is rated in the Frommers Paris guide book. Location, Location. One could not ask for a better location, it is near everthing. A metro station is a block away and a block the other direction brongs one to the Rue de Honor, with many stores to flatten your credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and location - with a beautiful pool/sauna/hammam”
Reviews.Author: notfes53
Reviews.Content: I took my wife here for our 25th wedding anniversary. We stayed five nights and had a wonderful time. All the hotel staff who dealt with us were charming - and fluent in English. Marie, Olivier and David on the Concierge staff could not have been more accommodating and helpful. However, we have only singled them out as they were the ones we had the most contact with. We were made to feel welcome by all the staff - and that is as much as anyone can ask. I'd also dealt with Julie, the Director of Rooms Operations and she had been most courteous and helpful. A complementary bottle of champagne awaited us upon arrival in our room. We had a view down on Rue du Mont Thabor. It was quiet. The air conditioning in the room was effective. On one occasion we inadvertently locked our safe without noting the number and the front desk sorted it out quickly and without fuss or charge. Room service was available to bring ice to our room within 3 to 5 minutes of a request The hotel is very well situated for walking to all the major sites, and for the Tuileries Metro station on Line 1. The below-ground indoor pool complex is small but perfectly formed. The pool itself is lovely and sweet smelling. The accompanying sauna and hammam are clean and quiet. The thick white towels are fluffy and warm. We never shared the sauna or hammam with any other guests. There are some good quality aerobic exercise machines as well as a resistance multi-gym. You have to try the complementary nougat in the bowl at reception - it's excellent. In the mornings there is a free tea and coffee station in reception for guests, and later in the day this is replaced by jugs of water flavoured either with a choice of lemon/lime segments or orange segments. You can ask reception staff for complementary chilled bottles of Evian water at any time of the day or night - especially useful to take to bed, or out with you when you go sight-seeing. It's small touches like this that set this hotel apart from its larger more impersonal competitors. I was able to use the PC in the small business centre area adjoining the reception to complete our online check-in and print our boarding cards. We also used the in-room broadband internet connection for a couple of days - at a small extra charge. The Renaissance beds and pillows were really comfortable and the Bulgari toiletries another very nice touch. Our room was equipped with a bedside clock-radio-alarm-iPod dock as well as a good flat- screen TV and discreet CD/DVD player. DVDs are available to rent from reception, but we had brought our own films and music. Across the road, immediately opposite the hotel is Carr's Irish "pub". We could occasionally hear the live piano in the evenings but were never disturbed by it. It too has a friendly atmosphere and welcoming staff and we had one very late evening there meeting and chatting to locals, as well as other visitors. There are so many good restaurants within walking distance, and I would strongly advise any prospective guests to talk to the excellent concierge team at the Renaissance Paris Vendome to get recommendations and make bookings. The most popular restaurants are difficult to book, but don't forget that some of them open for lunch as well and can offer devastatingly good value prix fixe lunch menus!! If you dislike crowds and noisy fellow guests, if you hate queuing to talk to reception and concierge staff, and if you prefer personal service, then stay here; you will find an oasis of calm and quality awaiting you - it really is a hidden gem, and the swimming pool is a real bonus after a day of shopping and sight-seeing, or as a lovely way to start your day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but it's a 4-star if you've stayed at 5-star hotels in the past”
Reviews.Author: TravelgalCathy
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by prefacing this with the fact that I have been to Paris several times and have stayed in St. Germain, Montparnasse, and the Marais in the past. I stayed at this hotel for one night only, after a lengthy journey to Paris and I wanted a luxurious, convenient hotel for our first night. (We rented an apartment for the rest of our stay by Rue Montorguiel and loved it!) I used Marriott points for the room and was able to upgrade to a â€œlargerâ€� room for a reasonable amount of money. While they tout themselves as having a â€œ5-starâ€� rating, I felt this hotel fell short to be deserving of this rating after experiencing 5-star hotels in various countries. Pros: this hotel is conveniently located right by the Tuileries metro stop and close to many of the tourist sites. The room was well-appointed, nice amenities as listed on their website, but it was not as spacious as I expected for having paid an additional 70 euros to upgrade to a larger room. I realize Paris hotels are small, but this was not worth the upgrade. Cons: this hotel is located in a very touristy area, on the higher end of the price tag. For me this is a con because I enjoy soaking up the Parisian culture, and there were not a lot of Parisians dining in the restaurants close to the hotel. In addition, the restaurants close to the hotel were over-priced and we did not find the food or wine particularly good which is typical in very touristy areas. The hotel breakfast was 30E per person and was not as robust as other buffet breakfasts I have had at other hotels in Europe. For 30E, I felt they should have had more offerings. They charged for wifi in the room and the gym was extremely humid since it is right next to the pool, so much that we didn't want to use it. The service at this hotel was good, but not great â€“ it was definitely not the 5-star level of service that I have experienced at hotels with this same rating in Asia, Latin America or the US. They didnâ€™t seem to have the â€œweâ€™re here to serve youâ€� attitude that I have experienced at many hotels, regardless of the â€œstarâ€� rating. When we checked into the hotel, we were told that breakfast was included in our room rate. When we checked out they had charged us for breakfast and we contested it. They took it off the bill, but I had to be insistent. At the end of our stay and departure from the hotel, we were in a hurry to get to our bags out of storage. The bellman was on a â€œbreakâ€� so we were asked to sit down and wait for him as they tried to contact him. We had also asked for a taxi, and while we were waiting for the bellman to show up, they gave 2 cabs away to people who came up after us. It all turned out fine, but I had to be a little more assertive than usual in order to get them to move at a faster pace. If you have never stayed in a 5-star hotel before, this would be fine. However, if I was going to spend money for a 5-star hotel experience in Paris, I would choose another hotel as there are plenty of others to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect start to our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: MrsKeward
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first 3 nights of our honeymoon. It was perfect. The location, service and cleanliness were outstanding. The pool was an added bonus and was a very welcome break from the heat outside! The staff were all very friendly - especially the bar manager, who we spoke to while we were enjoying some pre-dinner drinks! The room, although fairly small (hence the 4 out of 5 - the only reason) was luxurious and the bedding so comfortable. The location (10 minutes from the Louvre) was superb. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to have a luxury break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “TA Reviews Were Spot On--Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Tourist
Reviews.Content: Up-front Disclaimer: Weâ€™re Marriott rewards members (which really only means that weâ€™ve stayed in enough M. hotels of all different categories to have an idea of what to expect). We used points to cover part of our stay, but paid for an upgrade to a larger room/breakfast/internet connection. We felt it was worth it since we used the internet connection to call home (though Paris touts lots of Wi-fi connections, we couldnâ€™t find a hot spot), were happy for the few extra square meters of space, and enjoyed the breakfast buffet on the mornings it was included. Our room was on the first floor, facing an outside courtyard, and was generally very quiet. (The view out the window looked like there was a clothing business/alteration shop facing us.) Since this room was fine, we didnâ€™t ask for anything higher up (and didnâ€™t want to end up facing the noisier street side). The bathroom had a frosted glass pocket door and glass doors for the WC and separate shower (which had only an 18" opening to squeeze through due to the vanity counter), but it was private enough. However, when the bathroom light is on, it also illuminates the bedroom area due to that glass door. Overall this is the cleanest Marriott hotel weâ€™ve ever visited, and the location on a tiny side street (but quite close to main areas for shopping, cafes, and museums) was ideal for this visit. The room and bed were comfortable, and everything--lobby, restaurant, pool/spa area, and our room--was well-maintained by the staff. Turn-down service each evening included a single, large chocolate lollipop for us to fight over (it was extremely hard to eat, but the rest traveled home well for souvenirs). One small, complimentary water bottle was included with the room, but not replenished after the first day despite our inquiries; not sure why this is a touted amenity on their website. The breakfast buffet had a nice choice of fresh fruit, assorted cheeses, fresh boulangerie items, sausage/bacon, cold cereal, yogurt, and eggs (made to order); it is more European in style and so it doesnâ€™t offer exactly the same selections as an American hotel. If you enjoy reading the paper over breakfast or want to brush up on your foreign language skills, there are daily editions of French, German, and Italian newspapers to pick up at the restaurant entrance (and a printed news summary in English was also delivered to our door each day). The breakfast meal carried us through the day, usually supplemented only with something wonderful from a Parisian patisserie, until a late dinner. If it werenâ€™t included as part of a package, Iâ€™m not sure that itâ€™s worth the 29 euros/person unless convenience is more important. Angelinaâ€™s (on Rue de Rivoli) was a nice alternative, not busy for breakfast (only heard a few Parisians there), and the price for two in their beautiful dining room was about 30 euros total (depending on what you order). There are also numerous other dining alternatives easily within walking distance of the hotel. When we arrived everything was as specified in our online reservation, but be sure to take a printout of your reservation with you. Even though all of the details were confirmed at check-in, they still cited an internet charge on the final bill, and so the paper copy was helpful to prove otherwise. We had also requested an early check-in and late check-out. Ended up not needing the early check-in due to volcano delays on our arrival day, but couldnâ€™t get a later checkout of even one hour as they said they were expecting another guest. They did stow the luggage for us on that last day. We ventured everywhere in the area on foot, and via nearby bus, metro, and RER, saving taxis only for nights we were dining someplace farther out. While the doormen are quite happy to call a cab, you may want to consider walking up Rue dâ€™Alger to Rue de Rivoli (just one block) as taxis are numerous and easy to flag there; it will save you several euros since the meter starts from wherever they get the call, not from the pickup point. Overall, it was a lovely stay. We enjoyed the fact that this wasnâ€™t a large hotel, and really was more boutique-like in style, even if part of a corp. chain. The staff were friendly and gracious, the concierge helpful; everyone we spoke with at the hotel was bi-lingual, so we had no problems whether communicating in French or English. This hotel was a good, solid choice that lived up to what other recent TA advisor reviews have said, and I would certainly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: CooperSJCW
Reviews.Content: After spending a few days at the EuroDisney Resort and staying at horrible Disney hotels, the Renaissance Paris Vendome felt like heaven. It is a very nice small hotel right in the center of Paris. Excellent for tourism; 10 minute walk to Place Concorde and Louvre. And a 20 minute walk to Champs Elysees. The rooms are quite small, specially if you travel with children (a crib does not fit in), but they are very cousy and feel quite new. The hotel restauran is very nice but too "snobby". It seems it is one of the hottest restaurants now in Paris. Overall: good hotel to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms for the price (even in Europe), but very nice, comfortable hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: mfgatl
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed for five nights and overall were very happy. Wonderful location basically across from Jardin des Tuileries, but on a low traffic side street. Very close to a metro station. Felt more like a boutique hotel than a Marriott. Only noise issue is there is an Irish pub (naturally) right across the street. Was noisy on Saturday night, but quiet otherwise. Speaking of bars, the bar in the hotel is tiny and extremely expensive - beyond everywhere else we went in Paris. There was very little activity in the bar during our stay. We didn't try the hotel restaurant. It wasn't crowded much either, but was more in the ballpark of prices we found elsewhere. Our room was small, but wasn't a major issue. Was very clean, had a legitimate king bed, and a great little balcony with a table for two. We were on the fifth floor and had drinks on the balcony several times. Rue de Saint Honore is around the corner and had several great bakeries and bistros for grabbing a quick bite on your way out or back in if you didn't have time for a full meal. Staff was friendly and helpful enough - no major positives or negatives. Would definitely stay again due to the location and quality of rooms and hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe location”
Reviews.Author: texas spot
Reviews.Content: After 15 plus trips to Paris, I can recommend both the hotel and the location. The location is perfect as it is not too far from the Roissy Bus at the Opera Garnier and near a versatile metro stop. The hotel is overpriced compared to US prices, but a great value when using Marriott points. Most of the americans that we met were also staying on points. The indoor pool is quite nice and other guests recommended the restaurant. The rooms are deluxe and compact, but normal for central Paris. The rue du Mont Thabor is adjacent to the Rue Cambon and a block from the Tuilleries. There is a Best Western across the street and a Melia hotel down that block that share the location and likely would be much less expensive. There are no small restaurants or food shops nearby, but Pierre Hermes has a location on Rue Cambon and the giant food hall at Galleries Lafayette is a few blocks to the north.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Souris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, a stoneâ€™s throw from the Place VendÃ´me, the Louvre, the Tuileries Garden, Place de la Concorde/Champs-ElysÃ©es and the Madeleine. Although classified as a 5-star hotel by the French Tourism Office, it is more like a small, upscale boutique hotel. It did not seem to have all the services and amenities that one would expect of a typical Marriott. The service, including the very responsive concierge service, was excellent. Reception was very cordial, very helpful, and everyone on front desk duty addressed me by name every time I came & went. I stayed here twice within a two-week stay in France, the first two days in Room 616, a â€œPrivilegeâ€� room, with my spouse (May 13-14); the second, in Room 217, a Junior Suite, alone (May 25-26). I was warmly welcomed back upon my second arrival. We used Marriott points for both stays. Room 616 was quite nice, but rather small for two people. Iâ€™ve had larger rooms in Paris for less than the several hundred Euros Marriott normally charges for this room; and it is definitely not as spacious as the Marriott Courtyard at CDG airport. This being said, however, I was extremely satisfied with my stay, the service, and the wonderful location. The hotel is tastefully decorated in soothing shades of brown & tan. In Room 616, there was a half-moon shaped desk; a round console table that houses a refrigerator/bar. There were 2 closets, one for hanging cloths, one with shelves. The bathroom in 616 has frosted doors; large sink; tub/shower combo with not very good water pressure. In the Junior Suite 217, the bathroom was much larger with a large sink, a tub, a separate, great, shower and a separate WC. Large containers of Bulgari toiletries were provided in both bathrooms. The suite had a nice sitting area with TV, tan suede loveseat, and ottoman; and a second TV sat above the desk in the bedroom. Both of the rooms looked out onto a very quiet courtyard. The hotel has a small lobby with a â€œChineseâ€� bar; a second lobby area off to the side has a computer for guests and seating around a fireplace. This area leads to the restaurant Pinxo. I did not eat at the restaurant, although it gets high ratings. The complimentary breakfast buffet is served in this same restaurant. I found the buffet to be nice, especially since they also offer your choice of eggs made to order. There were different types of breads, cold cuts, cheeses, cereals, yogurt, fresh & dried fruits, scrambled eggs, etc. I would definitely stay here again, especially for its great location, calm, quiet rooms, and extremely competent, yet discrete staff.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with personality”
Reviews.Author: stlanne
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 7 nights. We were upgraded to the bigger room overlooking the courtyard. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. They knew our names after 2 days. They helped us with dinner reservations at some remarkable restaurants. and answered many questions - I do speak some French so it helped. The room was plenty big. I keep hearing about how small the rooms are - but who cares? We just slept there!! the Bathtub was great! The shower was strong. We never heard any noise from outside or in. The breakfast was complimentary since we are Platinum members. It was mediocre at best. Fruit - bad. The dried fruit was good though. Ask for specially prepared eggs as they will be much better than what is on the buffet. My daughter commented on good the hotel smelled - like a perfumed cancle was burning at all times! They decorated the lobby for Easter which was subtle but very cute! There are fresh orchid flower arrangements and they hung delicate easter eggs from the branches! We loved the elevator!! It definitely has an American feel to it but I would stay in this Hotel again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic for some, intimate for others”
Reviews.Author: SummerLightening
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked great from the Marriott website, but the reality was somewhat disappointing. This is quite a small hotel by Marriott standards, which you could view as good or bad! However, this means that the rooms are small - I was a platinum member staying on points, upgraded to a superior room but still quite pokey. The reception area is quite limited as well - and the whole hotel had a very 'dark' feel about it. We did not eat there, but could not fault the front desk/concierge who gave excellent service in terms of helpfulness, friendliness and eating recommendations (as expected in a Marriott, but still appreciated). Our room was on the third floor, facing the street, and my wife was quite disturbed by the noisy Irish bar opposite, where people stand outside until 1-2 am making loads of noise, especially on the Friday night of our stay. Otherwise, can't fault the (daytime!) location, which is terrific, handy for seeing many sights by foot, or with a Metro station a couple of minutes away. Some years ago we stayed at the Marriott on the Champs-Elysee, and we much prefer that - better atmosphere, lovely expansive atrium, bigger rooms, also good location - but more points, and no pool/leisure facilities. We have also stayed at the Marriott Paris Neuilly - OK (basic) hotel but not close to Metro and Marriott La Defense - impressive hotel in amazing business area with awesome buildings - a bit of a way out but close to Metro for access to centre.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: boydnmfn
Reviews.Content: In short, the hotel is very clean and in a great location. The staff is friendly and the room was really nice, especially since we had heard rooms in Europe in general were very small. They seemed to miss on little details that make such big difference. My wife and I were there on our honeymoon and there really wasn't anything special in the room to greet us; nothing to make us feel great about being there, even though they acknowledged our honeymoon at the front desk. Our room had a strange smell for our entire trip and it was never eradicated. Finally, the daily charge of 15 Euros for internet and 29 Euros for a breakfast buffett are unreasonable. We found great locations, top cafe's and restaurants all over Paris to dine at reasonable prices, but thought it was a bit erogant to price their restaurant this way. Though it is nice AND overall clean/new, and the staff is friendly and accomodating, I would have a tough time spending this kind of money at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great service and location”
Reviews.Author: KLovesEurope
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last month for 3 nights with friends using Marriott points and had a great time. The hotel is fairly new and was restored beautifully. The location is great for sights and getting around Paris. And most importantly -- my friends and I loved the staff. They were so wonderful to us catering to our every need -- including champagne, bread and cheese at 2 in the morning in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, faultless stay”
Reviews.Author: Alxon
Reviews.Content: Stayed several times at this (i think 5 stays during the last 3 years). Always been a pleasure to stay here, attentive and friendly staff, nice and cleans rooms, perfect location in the centre of the city. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique-style hotel and worthy of a short stay”
Reviews.Author: benyc
Reviews.Content: Nice enough for a short stay as it has good service, nice decor, a little spa/pool area, and is relatively conveniently located. Breakfast service was disorderly, pool is small. But Paris is a city trip more about the city than the hotel (at least for me), so the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Paris - nice rooms and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: milliegoulet
Reviews.Content: We are so glad we chose this hotel. We chose based on tripadvisor reviews (but we also had some free nights in Marriott reward points to use). The Renaissance Paris Vendome proved to be a perfect base for exploring Paris. Even though it's a Renaissance property, it felt more like a small boutique hotel with good service, very nice clean rooms (sure they are small, but that's Europe), good bathrooms, all with a very a modern European flair. Many of the rooms look out onto beautiful Parisienne buildings with shutters and flowered window boxes. The hotel was such a great, safe location in walking distance to practically anywhere you would want to go (or a RER station). Paris is a great city for walking and this hotel is a central location positioning you right in the middle of the action, but on a nice quiet side street. So close to the Louvre, and just a few blocks further to cross the river over to the left bank. We had dinner on the left bank several evenings and had no problem walking back to the hotel at night. There was a little street noise from one of the neighborhood pubs one evening, but it was Bastille Day so what can you do. We would still definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: xoxx
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with very accommodating staff. The concierge service is excellent. The rooms truly vary in size and you may need to view a few before you find one that suits you. The location is great. A definite recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lynnouss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 2 weeks back, and i must say it really is the perfect location. It is 2 minutes away from the Tuileries Gardens, Louvre, Place Vendome. Rivoli. Maybe 5 minutes away from Place Concorde and a walking distance from Champs Elysee. And if you happen to be there for the shopping you are minutes from St Honore, a great shopping street with all major brands.Not to forget the close by metro stations that take you wherver you need. The Reception staff are great especially the concirege who was very helpful and very friendly and would organize anything you need for your trip.Breakfast is ok, it has whatever you need to start your day, both continental and american. WHat you pay for here is the location and the cozyness of this hotel especially if you happen to be there in winter! They have complimentary hot beverages and refreshments and candies in the lobby. We will definetly recommend this hotel, and wil come back there! our stay was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Terific location.”
Reviews.Author: Bachacookies
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one block from Tuileries Gardens, Tuileries METRO stop, and an easy walk to the Louvre and Notre Dame Cathedral. Our room was on the small side but comfortable. The staff was very friendly. Keep in mind that what you are paying for here is the location; we found everything in Paris to be over priced. Nevertheless, I would definately go back to this hotel if I ever get back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice upscale hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlhaa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, although not cheap. Located in the first district. *very attentive service *excellent location - very close to the Louvre, train stops, the Seine, etc... *Good breakfast buffet - great coffee *reasonable work out facilities. If you are a true work out fanatic, you may have to go else where. There is a treadmill, a bowflex type machine, and some dumb bells up to 25lbs, and an indoor pool. Funcational for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed at the Four Seasons in Paris; but I'll go back to this hotel instead”
Reviews.Author: lb_squared
Reviews.Content: I've seen reviews griping about small rooms; ignore them. Unless you spend three times the price, you'll still have a small room, and probably snotty staff. I've been there, done that. I've stayed at the hotels around the world that get talked about all the time. I travel on my own jet, and have high expectations, and this hotel stacks up very favorably against the best on every continent. We stayed there for two weeks at the end of October, 2009. The location is absolutely perfect -- it's an easy walk to the Garnier for the ballet (don't miss it), the high end shopping on every surrounding street, and the Louvre and Notre Dame and just about everything else. Other districts are a short cab ride away. The rooms are very well appointed and stylishly modern (not that junk that looks like everything is upholstered with a 200 year old curtain). The restaurant is awesome on its own. And the staff is top notch, from bellmen to concierges to waiters and waitresses, and exceptionally friendly. My fiance and I speak very little French but the staff never missed a beat. One service example: We arrived at 6 am on an overnight flight and yet they checked us in immediately, which we did not expect. That nap made all the difference. Speaking of which, the beds and bedding are phenomenal. Enjoy the restaurant (it's excellent -- ask to sit at the bar and watch the chefs at work), but also get out and walk the area and just dive in anywhere on a whim. We ate at different restaurants for every meal for two weeks and never made a reservation, and everything was superb. Then again, it's Paris, so that's expected. But if you've never been, my point is to not over-plan. Go with the flow. At this hotel, everything is within walking distance so it's easy to do so. Avoid the areas south of the hotel (stay north of the main drag) and you get better, less touristy fare. Someone commented that the staff seems indifferent because they think you're using points. I never saw that one time. I did see them have to deal with some idiots, and they handled it perfectly. BTW, enjoy a beer or two at the Irish/English pub across the street as you walk back home at night. Great crowd, friendly young owners, fun nightcap. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't demand a bland "chain hotel" experience. It's more like an Ian Schrager type small boutique than a Hyatt or Ritz Carlton. Yes, it's small, but that's also itys charm. Next time I'm in Paris, I'll stay here. I won't stay at the Four Seasons George V, even though I have before, and money isn't the issue. This hotel is simply more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Pristine and Modern Boutique”
Reviews.Author: DCRE
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with an unbeatable location--1 block off the Rue de Rivoli and a few minutes from Place Vendome. Two older hotels were combined and completely re-done when Marriott took over management. There is a wonderfully clean and attractive lap pool on the lower level. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating--especially the concierge, David, and the rooms manager, Julie. The rooms are quite small (even the premier rooms with king bed). We were upgraded to a junior suite on our second day and, although very attractive, it is also rather small. Overall, we loved the hotel and hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: hgeslin
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in this hotel during a business trip. The decoration is nice but the room are extremely tiny. It is so small that you have to eat your breakfast on the bed. The bathroom was small and the bath tub was only half the standard size. The food serve was industrial and tasteless; the croissants were not even fresh! What a shame when you are in Paris!! The price was ludicrous considering the services offered. Do not waste your money; good location and decoration are not all!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: sjportcity
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel in late October and found it to be perfect. Everything from the location, the rooms, the front desk, the Concierge... The rooms are great, very clean, bed is wonderful. Of course you spend little time in your room when you are so close to everything, yet still in a quiet and charming neighborhood. You can walk to Place Concorde, Place Vendome, The Louvre, Notre Dame, Champs and plenty of shopping and food. So easy to find your way around on your own, or with the excellent advice of the Concierge. I can't say enough about this property and what a great experience it provided. And be sure to check out the Grotto, the pool and spa is fantastic. And it was really nice to sit on the balcony overlooking Rue de Month Thabor. What a great street!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful visit”
Reviews.Author: maroger242
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in Paris using Marriott points (otherwise this 6+ star hotel would have been too expensive for us). This was a very nice hotel with an excellent location. We walked everywhere: it is close to Notre-Dame, Musee D'Orsay, and the Louvre, in particular, but one evening we even walked from L'Arc de Triomphe back to our hotel along the Champs-Elysees. As others have noted, the rooms are very small, with just room enough to get around the bed, and very little room for toiletries in the bathroom. We were offered a 5th floor room with a balcony or a larger 2nd floor room without. We chose the latter, though I can't imaging how the 5th floor room could have been any smaller! The room was very clean and the bed comfortable. The staff at the front desk was very helpful and pleasant, and spoke English well. Internet use costs 7 euros/hr or 15/day and there is an ipod dock in the room. We did not eat there, opting to go out as others have recommended to the many nearby cafes and restaurants. The food, coffee, and wine were excellent, with L'Ardoise restaurant my favorite. Be aware that everything in Paris is expensive, about 50% more once converted to dollars. We flew into Charles DeGaulle Airport and took public transportation, which is much cheaper than a taxi, but was very awkward with a suitcase and bag each. On the way back, we splurged on the taxi and it was worth it. By the way, we were very happy with Air France. We had Rick Steves' book on Paris which was invaluable. The first day we took his walking tour of historic Paris which was a great way to see many sites and much better than if we had tried to navigate ourselves. Another day we managed to cover most of the paintings in the Louvre in 7 hours of walking with no breaks. The Musee D'Orsay was also wonderful and as an artist, I was in heaven. Both museums allow photography without flashes. Sacre Coeurs and Montmartre were breathtaking and took most of a day as we again followed a walking tour of Rick Steves'. Rick Steves recommends buying a SIM card in the country you're visiting which I did. I already had a tri-band international phone. It is cheaper this way but the instructions and voice prompts are in French. Try to buy the card in a specific telephone store where they speak English so they can activate it and give you the cheapest plan. To top up minutes, go to any "Tabac". We had a fabulous first trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & Service”
Reviews.Author: ecarder
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in 3 different hotels in Paris and this was by far the best place I have ever stayed. It was in the middle of everything. My husband and I were able to walk to the Louvre, Tuileries garden, D' Orsay, Concord Place, the royal palace, and so much more. There is a metro station 2 blocks away and a velib station (bikes) right around the corner. We are elite members so they offered us free room service or breakfast in the restaurant every day-which was perfect to get a good start to the day. The staff was exceptional-they were friendly, courteous, and gave great advice as far as places to go certain days and tours they recommended. The room and bathroom were much bigger than your typical European hotel room. Looking at the prices, we may not have stayed there without our miles, but now that we have stayed there, I don't think I would stay anywhere else if we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: OR2010
Reviews.Content: My wife, my 16-month year old daughter and I had a wonderful stay at this property. The location could not be better for soaking in Paris (strolling every morning in the Tuilerie gardens, grabbing lunch at Angelina's, walking to the Louvre and Orangerie, etc). With the exception of the Eiffel tower, everywhere we wanted to go (including outstanding restaurants) was within a 10 minute walk or cab ride. The service at the Renaissance is very good. I also enjoyed the indoor pool, steam and sauna rooms. The concierge was very competent - arranged for all our reservations and tickets. The rooms are a little cramped and it is pricey - but hey, that's Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, not so friendly, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: adampres
Reviews.Content: We did enjoy our stay at this hotel. The location is perfectly located in an area that is very nice, and the city felt very accessible from there. The staff lived up to a disappointing stereotype: curt and not very helpful. The hotel itself is very nice and our room was luxurious. However, as nice as it was, after staying at several other very nice hotels in Paris, we felt that it was overpriced. I believe that you could pay the same price or less for a larger room in an area just as good at a hotel of comparable quality. Our favorite feature of this hotel, though, was the pool and spa. After two weeks in France in July, we were very happy to spend an evening relaxing in steam saunas and in the pool. There seem to be few other hotels in the area with such accommodations. A great place, but you can probably get more for the money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: debbfrog
Reviews.Content: This hotel was super-close to the Louvre and its gardens, and close to a great little square with non-touristy cafe's for lunch and dinner. Service was excellent - as our room wasn't ready when we checked in at 7 AM, they let us into the spa to take showers and freshen up. Great restaurant recommendation from someone at reception, as well. And breakfast in the hotel restaurant was yummy. . good selection, good coffee. . .made for a good start to the day. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “This is not my idea of a superior room”
Reviews.Author: Cooking-teacher
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! Sometimes helpful staff. Actually used the swimming pool and it was lovely! Very clean and nicely furnished. However, we were supposed to have a superior room and had a cell that was almost hard to turn around in -- and we are not large people. When we asked the front desk they said it was a superior room because of its size! All you had to do was look at the floor plan on the back of the door to see that this was not reality. Let's not treat guests like they are naive! I would recommend the hotel as long as folks understand that these are really small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION & Service - Small Room”
Reviews.Author: LucianoSF
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel at the end of August for 5 nights. As mentioned in other reviews, this hotel is in an amazing location in the 1st, right by the Vendome, Louvre, Tulieres gardens. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful and accomodating. We came to Paris primarily to enjoy amazing food ,and had a pretty big list of restaurants we wanted to try. They helped us plan out our entire 6 days and make and adjust restaurant reservations accordingly. Our flight arrived from the US in the early morning, and we were allowed to check-in before noon. The staff even gave us a complimentary "double upgrade" on our room. The rooms are very clean, nice and well appointed. Even with our upgrade however, we found the room to be very small, even when compared to other hotels in France or similar size/category hotels in New York City. While the bed felt comfortable to sleep in, I woke up extremely sore every morning and it took hours to feel normal again. This was probably the biggest downside of the room. Like many other reviewers, we stayed at this hotel using Marriott points. Had I not had points, I definitely don't think the room was worth close to $900/night for the category room we ended up having. There are far better deals at boutique hotels in the same neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Location and concierges make this a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: SheLovesToTravel413
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Vendome for my major birthday (don't ask which). The location is central--close to the Louvre, the Metro, Les Tuilleries, Musee D'Orsay, Place Vendome. But what really distinguished this hotel was the concierges. They were extremely good at helping us set up our days. And they were way more helpful than American Express when my daughter's wallet was pickpocketed at a very fancy bakery at Place de la Concorde. They also helped a friend back home get a special gift to me in my room on the date of my birthday. Rooms were not large, but were elegant. It is located on a quiet side street. I would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and great location - mediocre service and atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: SK8KIM
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Paris Vendome is a beautiful hotel. The lobby/dining areas and guest rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable. (One suggestion about room selection - I wouldn't recommend an interior room with a courtyard balcony. It looked nice but was so loud from the AC unit that we couldn't keep the windows open. A street view would have been better, even though I believe they consider the interior rooms to be superior.) The hotel is also in a great, convienient location. Why only three stars if it was so nice? There are a few reasons... Our problems started at check-in. We were told that it would be an additional 70 euros/ night for the king bed/prestige room we requested. We had not requested this upgrade (I had the paperwork to proove it). The woman at the desk, although she didn't seem to actually believe us that we hadn't requested this, told us she would get us a standard room, but that it wasn't ready yet. This was not a problem, as they held our luggage for us while we went to lunch. When we returned, just after check-in time, our room was still not ready. The same woman at the desk offered us complimentary drinks in the bar to compensate for the delay. This was a nice gesture and kept us satsfied for a little while... but once it was 90 minutes past the hotel check-in time we were becoming impatient. We got our room key just under two hours after check-in time. Our biggest complaint with the hotel was that it is out-of-this-world expensive! Luckily we had Marriott points to book our stay. If we had to pay the regular room rates to stay at this hotel (which we never would) we would be broke. Although it's a nice hotel with lovely rooms, in my opinion it is extremely over-priced, even for Paris... Be prepared to pay a fortune in the lobby bar for a beer/wine/soda/coffee, you name it. The hotel bar was more expensive than any other cafe we came across in the enitre city. Also, the American-Style buffet breakfast was 29 euros/person for bread, fruit, yogurt, cereal, coffee, juice, and cold eggs. We found this to be typical in most hotels in the city (20+ euros/person for a substandard breakfast buffet), but was not worth the money. This hotel is geared 100% towards Americans, or at least it felt like it. Although eveyone spoke English, which was great, it almost didn't even feel like we were in Paris! We went to breakfast one morning and were greeted, "Good morning! Two for breakfast?" Since we were on vacation in Paris this was a bit of a disappointment for us, as we didn't want to feel like we were home in the U.S.! Lastly, upon check-out the 70 euro/night charge for our prestige room appeared on our bill. I can't say that I was surprised, but as you can imagine, was not pleased. We told the woman at the desk that we did not request an upgrade when booking, declined the upgrade/charges at check-in, and would not pay for the charges on the bill. She was annoyed, threw her hands in the air and told us, with an attitude, that she guessed we didn't have any charges. We left on that note. I will say that most of the front desk staff, including the concierge and doormen, were very nice and accomodating. As for the actual hotel - quality of rooms and good location - it really is very nice. However, we would absolutely not return or recommend this hotel due to the ridiculous price and hidden charges, mediocre service (not from all), and American atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect anniversary in Paris”
Reviews.Author: natgoduk
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend choose to stay here for our 5 year anniversary. We were not disappointed one bit. I had called the hotel prior to our arrival to advise it was our 5 year anniversary and if there was anything extra they could do it would be much appreciated. On arrival we were greeted by a lovely man on reception who firstly congratulated us and advised he had giving us a free room upgrade! BINGO! (I assume we only got the free upgrade because it was January and low season for Paris) We were placed on floor 5 with a view of the street below which runs out to the Tuileries Gardens. We went off to explore the area and when we came back there was a book of Top Places to Kiss in Paris left on our bed with a box of chocolates. This hotel just gets better! We tried out the swimming pool, it is only small but adequate. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family as we all know how hard it can be to find a decent hotel in Paris which isn't over priced. And don't forget to check out Godiva around the corner, it offers the best hot chocolates you can find. Yum.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Nub2travel
Reviews.Content: This stay was my second at this property and it deserves high marks for style and location. I have had the opportunity to stay at this property a total of 10 days and the location made it ideal. Unfortunately on both visits I found the staff ineffective on some very important issues like my bill. To be balanced we did encounter some very helpful and pleasant staff members. I am addicted to the free candies at the check in area. And my mom & sister loved the bath amenities that I brought home from my first visit. I did not care for them so much. I was not as warm and fuzzy about this last visit. 1. bedding with a giant (can't miss it) hole 2. locked out of room a day before checkout 3. staff misplace reward documents (stay covered by loyalty pts) them insisted we pay $$$$ or sign doc giving them access to our reward account to deduct more points. It took me weeks to straighten this out when I arrived back in the states. 4. Staff member was suspicious about the great rate were booked on. Questioned us about it and checked with upper management. This took only a few minutes but still what is up with that????? I was puzzled because the reservation was made directly from marriott.com only about 45 days prior. All of this she confirmed she could see on the screen but for some reason she wanted to waste our time. BTW this hotel is reason I always settle my accounts the night before departing a foreign country and or an early morning travel plans. I would not discourage anyone from staying at this property if the price is right. I have been very lucky great Marriott promotions for both visits one included breakfast. (taste fine but the only special part was it did not cost us extra $$$) and one was a buy two get one free. Great deal any day. I will try one of the many fine hotels in Paris on my next visit. Happy & safe travels nub

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: sayaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location near place VendÃ´me and jardins des tuileries. Ideal place to base yourself for a long week-end if you want to stay in the center and west of Paris. The hotel is really agreeable and has a great restaurant, which I believe had a Michelin star at the time we visited. Our room was spacious and very comfortable. It was slightly noisy though, despite the double-glazing, ie we could sometimes hear noises from the outside at night. Great service too. The decoration is contemporary and sober, nothing trendy or boutique-like but not impersonal as hotel chains can be. And not fussy as hotels of this category can be too. Would and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: PollyFinders
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for 4 nights as part of a 3-wk. European trip using hotel points. Thus, we did not pay for the Renaissance Paris Vendome, so can't judge the value in money, only with relation to other Marriott properties for the same number of points. This was a nice hotel but the room was appreciably smaller than other Marriott properties where we've stayed in Europe (or the US). We chose the hotel from among Parisian Marriotts based on location and were not disappointed. Just off the Tuilleries, a short walk to the Louvre, a longer but do-able walk to Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower. The metro was convenient but we didn't need it this trip. Excellent location for a return visit after 35 years, just hitting the high spots again. The hotel was attractive, clean and well-maintained. Our room (and a couple others I saw into) was fairly small and it was weirdly configured - a small room with toilet and basin just inside the door, a larger room with a vanity and shower at the other end of the room. Room in between for two twin beds pushed together, small night stands, a small desk; there was a small table and upholstered chair at the foot of the bed, with a bit of a squeeze between them; probably 2/3s the size of our Renaissance room in London, if that. Attractive furnishings and all looked fairly recently redone, including baths. No executive lounge but breakfast was included (at least for Platinum Marriott guests - I gather there is some variation with Silver or Gold guests) and it was quite extensive for Europe, including custom omelets. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This was one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: PMcQueen
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Vendome in Paris has it all: excellent front desk staff and concierge services, good coffee in the lobby, beautiful, spacious rooms with French doors that open to the quiet street, great little chocolate lollipops before bed, wonderful Bulgari soaps and shower gel, the "feel" of a big hotel without it being big and impersonal, and a location that allows for walking to all the parts of Paris a visitor might want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you have sheets on your bed! Check first!”
Reviews.Author: Seannie_8
Reviews.Content: Mom, Dad and child stayed here. Paid extra for a family suite, which sleeps 3. Checked in, then went sightseeing. Returned, exhausted, after 10 pm to find no sheets on the sofa sleeper when we opened it. No sheets anywhere for us to make up the bed! Can't understand when housekeeping does turn-down service about 7 pm that they don't check for something this basic. But its in a wonderful neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: cubs1908
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from France for our honeymoon, which included three nights at this Renaissance. I used my Marriott points + 70 Euro/night to guarantee a "Prestige" room. We were very happy with the room, but not overwhelmed. I like to use 5 "stars" for places that knock me off my feet. Highlights: - Neither of us speak French, and we found the hotel staff able to accommodate us perfectly in English. I guess I would expect that for a Marriott property, though. - The room was spotless and we had a comfortable king-size bed. We also had a free breakfast buffet every morning. These may be the "prestige" room benefits. - Very quiet room with a couple of windows that opened over a courtyard, which was nice for fresh air now and then. The highs in Paris were in the low 70s, so we were able to enjoy the open windows, even if that meant our "friends" from across the courtyard were able to see in. - Central location (1 block from Tuileries Garden and Metro stop). It is on a small street, but contrary to other reviews, we had no problems with taxi drivers knowing the street. - Small but functional fitness center. Definitely an advantage over many European hotels. Not-so-highlights: - The room temperature was a bit hard to control, even though the thermostat was digital and new. It really felt like at 23C the room was freezing and at 24C it was burning. - Maybe because we had a king-size bed it felt like there wasn't quite enough room for our luggage. But this is a pretty minor problem, in my opinion. Ultimately, we very much liked the hotel. We would stay there again (at the right price, of course) and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: akkefamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small and tucked away in a most conspicuous spot! We had a room only on the first level (1 level up) and it was on the street with the big large windows that are like doors so we could watch the city, or close them for privacy. The room was quite adequate and larger than we expected, but Euro rooms are simply to be what you need and not much more. The built-ins are wonderful and provide a great area to dress. The bathroom was quite large and again, more than adequate. We had a queen size bed, but finding a king may run you into another class of hotel in this city, so as we did you may wish to suck up a queen. You are only 3 blocks from the tuileries metro spot and only 5 blocks from the Louvre, itself! The other direction is the Vendome, with all the beautiful shopping! The metro is the way to travel through the city, so you are in a wonderful area in a beautiful hotel that has very nice service. The doormen were fabulous and the pool in this place is beautiful, we only wished it was open through the night! We got back very late (into the morning) each night we were there and one night we were out of water, we called to get some room service. They graciously brought us 3 bottles of water and did not charge us (we were very willing to pay)! They were always helpful with directions and the ambiance of the little hotel was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Paris - Close Walking Distance to Everything!”
Reviews.Author: RAINKIR
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel is located 1 block off of Rue de Rivoli on a relatively quiet street. It has a classic French architecture with a modern interior design. Staying here allows for easy walking distance to many Paris attractions (the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Notre Dame, Jardin des Tuileries, Champs Elysees, Arc de Triomphe, Place de la Concorde). There is convenient shopping for souvenirs along the Rue de Rivoli and there are several nice cafes and bistros in the neighborhood. You can walk through the beautiful Jardin des Tuileries to stroll along the Seine or hop on the Metro, but we never used it since we pretty much walked everywhere (except to the Eiffel Tower). There is a nice restaurant and a large lobby with a very friendly English speaking staff. Our room was decent sized with a large comfortable bed and the most beautiful bathroom I've ever had in any European hotel. There is a wonderful turn down service with chocolates and fresh bathrobes each day. My wife particularly loved the Bulgari products (lotions, shampoo, etc.) that were replenished daily and she had to buy more when we got home because they reminded her of our wonderful stay in Paris. On a different note: If you have a sweet tooth, make sure you visit LadurÃ©e (closest location is on the Champs Elysees) for pastry heaven! We will always have fond memories of the Renaissance Paris Vendome - especially since we got engaged during our stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel in a Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: VEGO
Reviews.Content: Our driver brought us right to the door of this small hotel away from the thundering crowds of Paris...we had previously stayed on the Left Bank and once way out in LaDefense, so I was especially pleased to be walking distance from almost EVERYTHING!!! The front desk staff was obliging, courteous and even though we were paying with Marriott points offered us a "free" breakfast (normal price 29 Euros each) when we arrived and our room was not ready....I enjoyed the small things: the coffee in the lobby, the sweets to take with you as you started your day...and the smiles of the staff. Our room was immaculate and even though small, the bathroom was more spacious than most...it was more than wonderful, can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RACLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at in Paris...and we loved the Renaissance. Our room was beautiful and very comfortable. I loved the high celings and tall windows. The bathtub was great. Everyone at the front desk was very friendly and helpful, and especially sweet to my eleven year old daughter. People have complained that it is on a little street, but I preferred that-just a short walk from a major street and metro station-yet much quieter. I did take a print out with the address and little map of the hotel's location in my purse which I would just hand to the taxi drivers as a few didn't know the location right away. We did stay with Marriott points, and the room would have been on the pricey side otherwise, but let's face it-Paris is an expensive place to visit these days no matter what you do. But to be in walking distance to so many key areas was wonderful. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especially if using Marriott points”
Reviews.Author: 1972j
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Vendome last month on a 6 day trip to Paris. We cashed in Marriott points, so the stay was free. Although you burn through a lot of points staying at this hotel, it was worth the points (whether it is worth $500 a night is a different matter all together, however). The staff at the hotel was wonderful, they treated us really well and were always exceptionally friendly and helpful. The concierge went out of his way to get good restaurant reservations and provide any and all advice. And, the front desk staff really above and beyond the call of duty for us. For our room, we initially were going to upgrade, but many of the larger rooms (including the one we would have been in) face an interneal courtyard and we preferred a street view with a balcony. And, while our room was small, we had a really nice balcony on the street in front of the hotel that we spent a lot of time on looking out over Paris. And, even in the compact quarters, the room was very well appointed, with a nice bathroom. The hotel is in a perfect spot for exploring Paris, right by the Tuilieres (and the Metro) and close enough to walk to the Marais, the Eifel Tower, etc. You can't beat the location. All in all, it is a wonderful hotel and I very much enjoyed our stay. As I said before, I'm not sure it is worth the $500 a night they get for some of the rooms, but if you get a reasonable rate, or use points, it is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jenglar
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at the Renaissance Vendome twice and I will always stay here in the future. The stay if superb and the location can not be beat. I was celebrating my 40th birthday there recently and my partner had arranged for flowers to be delivered to the room. They were well done and the staff could not have been more accomodating. I even received a birthday card and small gift from the manager and staff. The is a wonderful place and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TripAdvisermember37
Reviews.Content: My wife and I Spent 7 nights at the Renaissance to celebrate our 10th year Wedding Anniversary. The hotel had a very good location and was very near the Jardin de Tuilleries, The Louvre, The Orsay , the Tuilleries Metro station and shopping places like Printemps and Gallerie Lafayette. The room that we stayed in was over looking a courtyard and was cozy and quiet enough for couples. The hotel's concierge, David, was very helpful in giving directions to really good French restaurants that featured very good French cuisine (modern, traditional, south western . cuisine. The bed pillows were a little high and takes getting used to. The bath was a little cramp and one would need to adjust the shower carefully to avoid getting the whole bathroom wet. Other than these two minor issues, This hotel is a great place to stay when in Paris. Highly recommended and I will probably plan another stay here in 2 years time.

Reviews.Title: “Small Property in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: caymanfvr
Reviews.Content: Great small property in the center of paris. Conviniently located next to museums, restaurants and shopping. There is a subway, 5 minutes walk away that will connect you to everything else. There is a HUGE open park near by that is nice to explore. Didnt see any parking near by and the staff was not overly helpful but got things done. Rooms are generally pretty small, however if you can, get the corner rooms which are larger and definitely more comforateble. King bed was comfortable butactually two twins pushed together which must be the standard for Europe. Room was modern, flat screen tv on the wall, lounge area and an amazing shower with seperate tub were all features that I appreciated. There is also a nice restaurant on property and a lounge with bar at the entrance. Heated indoor pool in basement was different for sure. Overall, a wonderful property, conviniently located, would stay again if I was in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: HoldenGreen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights on our honeymoon. The location of this hotel is un-beatable. Walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame, and Jardin des Tuileries. We took the RER B train from the airport and got off at the Carousel station and took a cab to the hotel saving us about 30-40 euro and giving us the chance to see the suburbs of Paris. When we checked in, the staff was great and sent us to the bar for free drinks until our room was ready. We didn't eat in the hotel because we wanted to try the other restaurants in the Rivoli area. For breakfast, there is a small cafe right around the corner (walk out the hotel door, turn left, then take your first left, and then take your first right...the cafe will be on your right). The rooms were spotless, the pool was great, staff was friendly. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms, and service”
Reviews.Author: kdphifizz
Reviews.Content: Location: walking distance to the Louvre, shops, and Metro. Very convenient Rooms: very comfortable, and very thing felt like new. The rooms are small, but a good size for European standards. The hotel is small (less than 100 rooms), so you rarely hear any of the other guests. We had a very comfortable night's rest. Service: exceptional: everyone spoke English and were very accomodating. I would highly recommend- this hotel is pricier than some of the others, but you really get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location, but not very French.”
Reviews.Author: shamrock08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I normally stay in small, 3 star hotels when in Paris, but we decided to use our Marriott points to stay here. We took the Roissybus from the airport, which dropped us about 3 blocks away. The location was very central. Most of the major sites were within walking distance. Most of the staff, especially the front desk clerks, were very friendly and polite. Our room was small but manageable, with a small half moon shaped desk and chair, and a very small table and additional chair. The wardrobe only had about a dozen hangers, not enough for two people for a week, but more wouldn't have fit anyway. Everything in the room was in good shape. Housekeeping was good, although they only left us one chocolate some nights at turn down service, and the replenishment of toiletries was a little uneven. Our room was extremely quiet, and overlooked a small courtyard. I'm a gold member so breakfast was included. It was fine, but the service was uneven. They never brought us coffee at all one morning, and didn't bring it until we were almost through on another. One disturbing incident: we saw the waiter piling a few items for someone on a plate, as you could have breakfast sent to your room. He dropped a croissant on the floor, then picked it up and put it back on the plate. There's a handy Monoprix down the street, and the metro isn't far. Overall, this is a nice hotel in an extremely convenient location. You'll be surrounded by other Americans, which is odd, but not really a big deal since you probably won't spend much time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeff800
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in connecting rooms with our son. Both rooms were on the small side, but adequate and well kept. Beds were comfortable and rooms had flat panel tv and high-speed (sort of) internet connection. One small annoyance is 15 euro per day charge for internet access. In this day and age, charging for internet access is like charging for tv. Seems like nickel and dime stuff. Hotel is one block off the main street, so nice and quite. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely SUPERB hotel, fabulous location, near perfect!”
Reviews.Author: coopuk
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Renaissance Paris Vendome in Paris for a 4 day city break in April. I have previously stayed at Marriott Hotels on business and always enjoyed great service and facilities.
