We flew in to Charles De Gaulle airport (terminal 2), and bought a one day tourist ticket for 8 euros. There are frequent trains from terminal 2 into the centre of Paris, and from there we used the RER to get to the Tuileries underground station. The hotel is right in the centre of Paris - it is literally 5 minutes walk from the RER underground station at Tuileries. This was the primary reason we chose the hotel, as we wanted to do a lot of sight seeing ;) Walking to the hotel from the RER station allows you to see just how close you are to the fabulous gardens at Tuileries, and to take in the incredible architecture of Paris. There are also several good quality restaurants and cafes in the immediate area, including the ever present MacDonalds if you really must have fast food! The hotel itself is a fairly anonymous looking building, just down the road from an Irish theme bar. Appearances can be deceiving though... once inside, the hotel has a well present, luxurious interior, with a bar off to one side, and a dining area off to the other. Check-in was fast with no problems - staff were friendly, efficient, and they all spoke EXCELLENT English. The quality of staff throughout the stay was OUTSTANDING! We had two rooms next to each other - one standard, one deluxe. The rooms were of a decent size - certainly not as big as American Marriot rooms - but were well presented, clean, and with large comfortable beds. All bathroom fittings worked - plenty of towels and toiletries! The TVs were excellent, and offered a wide selection of channels, plus the option to purchase movies and/or access the internet. In addition, the rooms had integrated DVD players and docks for i-pods! However - no tea or coffee making facilities - points would have been deducted, but apparently this is the norm for Paris hotels. The deluxe room also offered complimentary toweling dressing gowns and slippers! On a downside, the view isn't great - basically, you look out onto more buildings. You need to go out of the hotel and along the Seine to get the view. The hotel has a fitness centre and indoor pool in the basement. The fitness centre has a small range of machines and weights, but also has a sauna and steam room, which were excellent.. The pool is a good size - suitable for adults to relax, and for kids to play in. It is open until 11pm at night! Superb! We got complimentary breakfasts for our stay, and whilst the choice of food wasn't great - cereals, various breads, cold meats, a limited cooked range - service was friendly and helpful. As it was complimentary, no points deducted - however, I certainly would NOT have paid the ridiculous prices Marriot charge. 18 euros for a basic breakfast? No way! My advice would be to take a 2 minute walk from the hotel towards the Tuilieries gardens, and have coffee and breakfast at the excellent cafe on the corner for approx.6 euros per person. Much better value, and you get to sit at the pavement cafes and see Paris! There are plenty of restaurants and cafes in the immediate area - nearly all of the staff in them speak English, but they appreciate it if you at least make an effort to speak French. Food in the area is good, but watch out for the prices of drinks - the standard price for a coffee is 4 euros. As for things to do - wow! Where to start! The hotel is SUPERBLY placed to visit Paris. The Tuillerie Gardens are a lovely park walk, and are approx.5 mins walk. The Louvre is approx.7 minutes walk away. The Seine is approx.5 mins walk away. The nearest bridge (approx 7 mins walk away) allows you to get a view of the Eiffel Tower. The nearest river boat station (which is the best way to visit Paris) is approx 10 mins walk away. Taxis from the hotel to the Eiffel Tower are plentiful and cost approx.10 euros. In short this hotel is EXCELLENT for service, quality of rooms, facilities, and for its location. If you are visiting Paris, STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoshInChicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located, within walking distance of numerous sights (including the Louvre, Orsay), the metro, and many restaurants. Despite the room being a bit small, which is probably to be expected, the hotel was well appointed, very clean, and nicely done. The staff was very friendly and helpful in providing directions and suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for free (or even more)”
Reviews.Author: MYCSeattle
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel was paid for with Marriott points. Going rate was about $350-400 a night. That said, it was a wonderful place to be based in Paris. The hotel was a half-block from the Tuileries stop on the #1 Metro line (which made it amazingly easy to get anywhere in the city), 1/2 block to the Gardens, a 10 minute walk to the Louvre. Shopping on Place Vendome and Rue du Honore were just minutes away, walking. Great location. The room was, by Europe standards, quite big and nice. Being a chain hotel, everything was consistent and reasonable. The bed was very comfortable, and the room had TV, iPod dock, internet, minibar, good bathroom (no bidet). Not much in the way of closet space. I think the hotel opened in 2003, but everything has been maintained. The staff was wonderful, especially the concierge, David. Took care of everything we needed, including several dinners and lunches, a doctor, and tracking down a very hard to find T-shirt for a friend (which he found 4 hours away). The breakfast was good (and included). Standard European breakfast foods, and again, charming hostess who was quick to learn our coffee order and room number. The exercise room and pool were both modern and clean. The steam room and sauna were basic, but clean and functional. We very much enjoyed our stay here, and would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect staff, perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandyr5
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! The staff was terrific and delightful. We e-mailed the concierge before we left and he ordered our 4 day museum passes which were waiting for us at check-in. Everyone had smiles on their faces and always asked if we needed anything. The location couldn't be better. One day you just walk to the right for the Champs Elysees, Arc, Eiffel etc., and the next walk to the right to the Louvre, Ile de Citi etc. It's really steps from Tuilleries gardens, Place Vendome and a very short walk to Opera Garnier and Galleries Lafayette. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, best location in Paris, wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lorenita2005
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here at this hotel and it was amazing, this is the perfect location to walk to all the tourist spots, and when you get tired of walking, it is even closer to the metro station, Tuleries. Super clean hotel, Room 614, where we stayed is the only room in the hotel where you can catch a small glimpse of the Eiffel tower from the window. Amazing staff, we checked in with Ali and Jonas, who were more than accommodating. The breakfast buffet in the morning is amazing, but a little pricey at 30 Euro per person. Overall wonderful experience, beautiful hotel, will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Croback
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for four nights in January and thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The location is excellent with a Tuilleries metro stop a few minutes away and other Metro lines a few minutes further. Less than 5 minutes walking to the Louvre, Tuilleries Garden, L'Orangerie and the Place De La Concorde. The room was well furnished with Bulgari accessories in the bath and a smartly placed desk/shelf below the wall-mounted flat screen TV., Breakfast was average but included in the price. Never made it to the fitness room or pool - we were getting enough exercise pounding the pavement in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for Paris sightseeing, however, rooms are tiny!”
Reviews.Author: 4boys4me
Reviews.Content: Definitely a trendy, modern hotel for those visiting Paris, the Renaissance is hidden away just a street over from the Tuileries. It's in a great location, off of the busy streets and yet close enough to be just steps away from the Louvre and the Tuileries. The staff is great - very friendly and helpful. As a modern boutique hotel, the decor is trendy yet not too overdone. We had breakfast (which was included in our room fee) and it was better than average. Our room was a deluxe room and quite frankly, it was just too small. In fact, we cut our stay in half because there was just NO room to move! The closet was too small for two people, the bed (which I have to say was supremely comfortable) took up the entire room, and there were NO drawers at all. To use the "desk" you had to almost sit on the edge of the bed. There was little space for suitcases, no chair, no hooks in the bathroom for anything, and one had to crawl over the bed to get to the balcony. If you are at all claustrophobic, do not stay here. However, if you pack light and don't mind the tight quarters, the location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding location and service!”
Reviews.Author: FrankMarton
Reviews.Content: Stayed with wife and child last spring and I can truly recommend this hotel as one of the best values in Paris. We've stayed at the â€œGeorge Vâ€� and, yes, its more posh but the Vendome was right on the mark in every category. Both suite and adjoining room options are available for families. Very centrally located, terrific multilingual (and multicultural) staff, child friendly (the babysitter they booked for us was one of the best we've had anywhere) and even the recommendations of the concierge were right on. The food at the attached restaurant on the ground floor was bit â€œoddâ€� but the lounge in the lobby of the hotel itself was first rate. Ask for one of the upper rooms since many of these have quaint balconies that give a lovely view of the city. Thereâ€™s more shopping within walking distance than even the most seasoned spender could possibly need and the metro is nearby of you want to explore the city or get to Euro Disney. Considering the jaw-dropping cost of most lodging in Paris, the value for money was excellent and the property is far better than its sister â€œMarriottâ€� on the Champs Elise. It just seemed, classier, quieter and with a better overall feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: swisstraveler63
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed a few days at this hotel around new year's eve and had a great time there. It is situated in a rather quiet street between the Louvre and Place VendÃ´me and is perfectly suited for exploring all the important sights in Paris. We had a junior suite with two small rooms for our family (tho adults and a teen). The tiny (seperated) living room had a sofabed and a second flat screen tv. The rooms were tastefully decorated (cool, modern) and everything was well maintained and perfectly clean. The bathroom had a tub, a shower, a seperated toilet and - the only disadvantage - only one sink. Altogether a very nice accommodation with just enough space for the three of us! The (not included) breakfast was in the fancy restaurant Pinxo. There was a buffet with all the usual breakfast items (eggs to be ordered with additional costs). We also had dinner at this stylish local and there the new year's eve dinner. Food was very good (13 points at Gault Millau) and reasonably priced, service was kind and professional. We also visited the tiny bar where a glass of champagne was offered at new year's eve by the management. The whole staff was always very nice and helpful. We would return to this hotel for another stay. The hotel is of course not as luxurious as the Meurice next door (where we stayed five years ago) but it offers (also for the spoiled public) a good experience to a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pinkpeche
Reviews.Content: I used points to stay here and was only charged a minimal upgrade fee per night. The rooms are on the small side like every other place in Europe... but we were upgraded to a decent size room in order to fit a rollaway bed (for my boyfriend's daughter). The hotel staff is quite friendly and English skills were impressive. Paris has come a long way accomodating English speaking patrons. I'm not sure if this is for everyone, but we received complimentary breakfast every morning in the dining area which ends at 10:30 am. The food was plentiful with a lot of options. The hotel is conveniently located near the Louvre and Musee d'Orsay and near three different subway stops. I find Paris's subway system very easy to navigate... so definitely take advantage of the subway system.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, great location, weird picture in lift”
Reviews.Author: catherinemunro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night to see the Rodrigo and Gabriela concert at Bataclan. He is a regular Marriott traveller and raves about their beds, sheets and service - and he is right. You could have fitted an entire country into the bed - and it was marvelous. The room was lovely and the staff were without exception very welcoming. The location is great - right next to the Louvre, the Metro and within panting distance of the Arc de Triomphe. Downsides - the room was cold, the Irish pub opposite was "lively" the bins get emptied at an unGodly hour and the picture in the lift would send children off to psychiatrists. Putting unsealed pictures in the bathroom means that they soak up moisture - not a good idea when your rates are so high. Oh and allowing smokers in the rooms - the smell permeates......... But for me it is the location and the staff that make a place - not the little itty bitty irritations that people can dwell on and it was fab. Concert was brill too!

Reviews.Title: “Second time just as nice”
Reviews.Author: BostonRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this hotel in the past year. I stayed the week of October 20 and was in room 003. As far as I can tell there is no downside to this hotel. The rooms are very nice - and large by European standards. The staff are extremely helpful and professional and all seem to speak perfect English. The location is very convenient while also being just off the main road to reduce traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: cmsvt97
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Europe in October for our honeymoon. We were traveling for a month in France and Italy and since he is a Marriott Platinum member we tried to stay at as many Marriott's as possible. Paris was our first stop and this hotel definitely set the bar high. They were very accomodating for our early arrival and being that it was our honeymoon they upgraded us to a junior suite and every night had a special amenity for us (including champagne, chocolates and the places to kiss in paris). It is in a great location - -we were able to walk to everything we wanted to see (Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Arc de Triomph). The staff is very courteous and helpful --they booked our train tickets to Milan and shipped stuff back to the States for us. We received complimentary breakfast with our stay which was average for Europe standards. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to Paris for this first time since it is centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Size, Great Staff, A plus”
Reviews.Author: RobBflo
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to state about this hotel, my wife and I stayed 4 nights in early Sept. We booked a Prestige Room, which was large by Paris standards, the price at the time was around 350 Euros, did not do any packages. Overall the room was well appointed, had a modern feel, but not over the top. There were large French Doors that opened to overlook a courtyard that was actually the glass ceiling of the reception area, different, but made the room more open. One thing I liked about this hotel was the size related to amenities. It is a relatively small hotel, but had everything you may want onsite, Restaurant, Room Service, Lobby Bar, Concierge, and a great Pool and Gym. We used the Concierge extensively before we arrived and during the stay, I cannot say enough about them, all we spoke to were knowledgeable and helpful. In general, all the staff was very nice. Regarding location, the hotel is very close to the Louve, Tuileries, Place Vendome and Musee D'Orsay. All within a short walk. So if this is a first trip to Paris, I cannot think of a much better location. All in all, a great place, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--Beware Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: margo1116
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent four days in Paris and chose to stay on the Right Bank. We loved the location of the Renaissance Vendome -- an easy walk to the Left Bank and lots of great restaurants and museums within walking distance or easy Metro ride. We originally opted for the most economical room but realized after one night that the cramped quarters just didn't work for us. We found another hotel nearby that was less expensive and had larger rooms. We called management to advise them of our upcoming departure and explained the reason for our departure. We were immediately upgraded to the next size room which worked perfectly for us. We've learned to speak up and be "polite complainers". Breakfasts were included in our American Express package. They were certainly adequate, but definitely not worth the price in Euros. Lots of nearby cafes and restaurants would have worked just as well. The staff was accommodating and pleasant and we would not hesitate to stay there again; it didn't have a real Parisian feel to it --very contemporary rooms, etc. but everything worked -- great shower and modern bathtub, nice plasma TV and Bulgari amenities. Our Amex package also included free wireless. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Almost all Americans and touristy location, but nice rooms and pool.”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTrvlr
Reviews.Content: 1) About 80% of the people there at least were Americans, most in their 50's. In my opinion that's an ambiance-reducer when you're in Paris, but may not be a big deal to you. 2) Breakfast is 29Euros per person, find a rate with breakfast included or be prepared to walk somewhere else. Free wifi in the lobby. 3) Nice relaxing pool, not a lap pool, but good for big kids. Nice lounges next to the pool. 4) Workout room is pretty small but has a good amount of TVs. 5) Location is near pricey boutiques and the touristy Rue de Rivoli. Also nicely close to the Louvre (5 min walk) and the Tuilleries which I love. So a push in this regard in my opinion. 6) Room was small but nice, great comfortable bed, fantastic bathroom with separate shower and tub (I had a Superior room, 1 level above the base Deluxe room). Frankly I can't imagine how small a Deluxe room would be so I'd at least spring for the Superior. 7) Room had a DVD player, so bring your movies if you like (no PPV). About 6 English TV stations including CNBC, CNN, BBC1&2, Eurosport, and France 24 of course. 8) Lobby has a very nice, intimate wood-buring fireplace. 9) Takes them about 10-15 minutes to get you a taxi. If you like seafood I went to Gaya in the Left Bank (across the street from L'Atelier Joel Rubechon for those who know). Fantastic seafood, but not cheap. If you're a sea-foodie then you should try it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Great location for Family of 5”
Reviews.Author: 050710d
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel w/our 3 sons ages 14, 11 & 7. We had connecting rooms which was very convenient. The rooms large, as many people have commented on this site, but I didn't find them to be much smaller than any other big city hotel, esp. for Europe, similar to what you might expect in NYC. The rooms were nicely done. The beds were excellent, which is always so easy to find in France. The bathrooms are good. The hotel itself is a very nice renovated building - nice French doors & windows. It is however beginning to show the first signs of some wear - mainly the carpet & the bathrooms did have some mildew that should probably be taken care of. It is a courtyard building with the lobby in the center under a skylight. My kids enjoyed using the pool - which really is more of an adult spa kind of setting. The location could not be beat. It's on a quiet side street located very close to the Place Vendome. It is a couple minute walk to the Jardin Tuliere & maybe 5 minutes or so to the Louvre. You can also walk to the shopping area around the department store Printemps. We walked to the Eiffel Tower - about a 20-30 minute walk - but pleasant. You can easily walk to the Batobus (water taxi) stop at Musee d'Orsay & get around that way up & down the Seine. The hotel staff all speaks excellent English. The concierge recommended a brasserie called Cafe Flottes (sp?) which is about a 5 min walk or so. We ate lunch there twice & dinner once. The food is very good & w/in reason. We were able to book our rooms using Marriott points. Not sure what prices are like for similar hotels in the same location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TKJA
Reviews.Content: Took my six year old daughter to the hotel for her first visit to Paris. First rate hotel...great location for all the tourist sites and friendly and competent staff. I have been to Paris on countless occasions over the last few years but I wanted this trip to be special given it was my daughter's first trip. I spend around 300 days per annum in hotels worldwide and can be a bit fussy but I have no complaints re the Renassaince Vendome. The room was modern, clean and spacious and the staff did all they could to make sure my little girl had a great time. Special commendation to Monica on the front desk who not only provided coloured pens and a colouring book on arrival but had chocolate lollipops delivered to the room :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Oasis in the big city”
Reviews.Author: trvlbker
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here July 13 for 5 nights. I loved the hotel. It is contemporary, hip and comfortable. Off the beaten track of pedestrian and vehicular traffic yet easily accessible to all the popular spots. Our room was quiet, clean and comfortable. I found the hotel to be a nice oasis from the bustle of Paris. The room was a bit small, but we didn't need anymore room for just the two of us. We hardly were in the room. The hotel staff, I found to be very friendly and accommodating. The internet is expensive, but c'est la vie in France. There is an internet cafe not too far from the hotel if you really need to use the internet for a period of time. Great location to fantastic shopping and restaurants galore, not to mention just a stones throw from the Louvre and Tuilleries. Plus, two of my favorite chocolatiers are right around the corner. Jean Paul Haven and Michel Cuizel. In fact, at turn down the hotel puts a chocolate sucker on your pillow. We didn't get it every night and most nights they only left one, but WOW the chocoate is to die for. I knew I should have asked for more! Would stay here again and I do recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but small rooms, even the suites”
Reviews.Author: tsjakka
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel at excellent location near the louvre and Tuillerien (metro, exit Tuillerien) We stayed in suite 603 with our daughter of 13. She slept on the couch. Rooms are beautiful decorated, clean and well equiped. Room 603 has two tiny tiny bathrooms, 2 washbins, a toilet, small bath, shower. There was not enough pressure on the shower... The airco was working very well, freezing cold! The suite has two sony flatscreens with a sony stick port, handy! Breakfast is not cheap (29 euros pp!!) but very very good. There is also a nice small swimmingpool and a well equipped gym and sauna/steamingroom. Staff was very helpfull and polite.

Reviews.Title: “The Renaissance Paris Vendome put the "happy" in our birthdays!”
Reviews.Author: ColonialKay
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a three-night stay at the Renaissance Vendome, and we hope to return some day. After we completed business elsewhere in Europe, we went to Paris to make our 60th birthdays more palatable! The ambiance is serenely upscale, the employees are extremely helpful and polite, and the location cannot be beat. It is pricey, but luckily, we used Marriott points for "free" nights and spent less than $300 to upgrade to a king-size room which included breakfast. There were a couple, minor negatives. The bed was a little large for the width of the room, so we had to be careful not to stub our toes going into the bathroom. Also, we had to learn to shut the shower door without pinching our fingers. Saying that, the huge vases of orchids, the bowls of candy and fruit, and the pitchers of citrus-infused water in the lobby were welcoming sights. Our room was very comfortable and stylish with luxury fabrics, a flat screen TV, and a back-friendly mattress. A box of luscious chocolate-covered nuts, a free bottle of "good" water, and a vase with real flowers greeted us when we checked into the room; chocolate lollipops nestled on our pillows at night. The bathroom was large with a warming rack, a shower, and a tub, plus there was ample closet and storage space. The view was of a small, interior courtyard, which was just fine, because the room was very quiet. We did not have to contend with traffic noise. The restaurant was very good; in fact, Frommer recommends La Pinxo in his guidebook. It is the moderate-priced restaurant of a two-star Michlelin-rated chef. We celebrated our birthdays there one night, enjoying a bottle of champagne and entrees of tuna and lamb, both excellent. Breakfast was a buffet with a hot dish station, a cereal station, a cheese, salmon, and meats station, and a bread and pastry station. We did order poached eggs one day and surprisingly found them to be tough, but we didn't mind because we had so many other good choices to eat instead. The next day, we noticed another couple commenting on the "tough" poached eggs! The scrambled eggs, part of the hot dish station, were excellent in comparison. The wait staff, the front desk help, and the concierges were all top rate, so friendly and helpful. At the hotel, we were able to buy museum passes and our tickets for a night time Seine tour--both time savers. The hotel also recommended Au Pied De Cochan, which filled my desire to eat at an old, traditional French restaurant. It has been around since 1946 and touts that it is the creator of the original recipe for French onion soup. The soup was yummy--the best French onion soup we ever ate! As I stated above, the location is convenient to most of Paris's major attractions. We walked almost everywhere we went, so we could soak up the city's ambience. We saved a lot of money by not having to take taxis and trains in most cases. Even though there were a couple things that were not "perfect," I am still giving the hotel a perfect rating. I have never been in a hotel yet that didn't have at least a couple minor glitches. Overall, this was a great hotel which did, indeed, help make our birthdays happy ones!

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattrLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in late June 2008. We stayed in a "deluxe" room which was pretty typical for Paris - really expensive (450 euros per night) and less than half the size of a similar priced room in any other city in the world. But this is to be expected in Paris. The room (notwithstanding the size) was nice - well appointed and clean, although I was a little disappointed as we had requested a non-smoking room and it definitely smelled of smoke. Our room had a small balcony overlooking the street which was very pretty. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast in the hotel was very good. The hotel is very centrally located, 2 minutes from the Lourve and within an easy walk of most of the things that people like to do when in Paris. By way of comparison I have stayed at the Hilton Arc de Triomphe before (about the same price) and this hotel is better if you are a tourist while the Hilton is better if you are travelling for business. Overall I thought that this was a good hotel and I would go back or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of your belongings”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvl54
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at the Renaissance based on the reviews I had read on this site, but I really regret my decision. First, the room was very small, and, although I had used Marriott points, I still had to pay an extra 70 euros/night for an upgrade(?). Next, although it was very clear that there were 2 of us staying in the room, housekeeping continually left only 1 chocolate & when asked for another, said "they didn't have any more". I realize the chocolate thing is not that big of a deal, but it was a disappointment. Also, one reviewer had raved about the shower, which I thought was awful. It was a small square stall that smelled of mold/mildew, and the water pressure & temperature both varied throughout a shower. The worst thing, though, was when we were packing to leave, my daughter realized her stuffed dog was missing! She is 18 now, but has had that dog since she was about 3 & has taken him on every trip we have ever taken. The front desk assured us that it must have been taken with the sheets, they would contact the laundry service, and we would "of course" get the dog back. Since returning home, we are now told by phone that "chances are very bad" that he'll be returned. Ironically, part of the reason I chose this hotel vs. the Marriott Champs Elysses was that, 4 years ago, when we stayed at the Marriott, my sunglasses were taken. I will admit that the hotel is in a good (but quiet)location and the staff (other than at least one housekeeper) is pleasant, but watch out for extra charges and keep all of your belongings locked up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel... Average for Vacationers”
Reviews.Author: BiscottiCalifornia
Reviews.Content: After much research I booked this hotel for a multi-night stay several weeks ago. It's a beautiful hotel in many respects but as with most Paris hotels the rooms are small and the prices are stratospheric... in our case even in an upgraded prestige room we felt a little claustrophobic at over $600 US a night. What's great... recently renovated, fast internet access, clean rooms, comfortable bed, stylish interiors, nice bathrooms... had both tub and shower in our prestige room, great english speaking staff, and location (in some respects... more on that in the next section.) What's not so great... hotel ambiance is a bit on the quiet side which is great if you're traveling on business and are just looking for a place to crash but not a good if you're looking to have a drink in the lobby bar and soak up the atmosphere of Paris. The rooms are small... very small. The prices in June were pretty crazy for what you received. The location IS within walking distance of the Louvre, the D'Orsay (a bit longer) and the subway, but the biggest downside of all is that hotel itself is on a bit of a back street with service entrances for other hotels facing Tuileries Gardens and Rue de Rivoli generally occupying one side of the street. For the price I pictured walking out of the hotel onto a tree lined street with cafes, just know that's not what you'll find. Last thing is that we found the area to be devoid of good restaurants (could have missed them obviously)... it's pretty much tourist fare in sidewalk cafes. For the price, ambiance (pretty generic to any hotel in the world) and location I would not stay here again on a pleasure trip... it just doesn't feel enough like Paris. On business I would think about it.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary in Pairs”
Reviews.Author: Shardlake
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our wedding anniversary. Decided to go for 2 nights in a top hotel as opposed to 3 nights in a medium hotel. Very glad we did although have to say that the hotel only got an "above average" rating as opposed to an "Excellent" rating as it is expensive for what it is. But thats probably more to do with Paris than the hotel itself Room was very modern but "compact and bijou" (as the advert used to say). Very comfortable bed and quiet - we had a room facing the courtyard and were glad to be off the street. One of the best things about the hotel is its location - less than a minute to the Jardin Des Tuileries. A really nice touch was that I had mentioned on booking that it was our wedding anniversary and 5 minutes after we had checked a complementary bottle of champagne arrived. Great turn down service with chocolates and a little book was most welcome although a little early at 7pm. However the choccys were great! We didnt have breakfast in the hotel as it seemed very expensive - we went round the corner to Le Pain Quotidien in the Place St Honore - a great little find. Loved the Bulgari toiletries and a great shower - bath was only a 3/4 bath. All in all a superbly located comfortable, clean top modern hotel. We'd go back like a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Vendome - fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: pignacious
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at this hotel & it was fantastic. The first 2 nights we stayed in the deluxe room. This is a very small room so be prepared for it. We had 2 medium sized & one small piece of luggage. There was hardly any room to store them. We also were on the 2nd floor and found it fairly noisy late at night for about an hour or so because of the bar across the street. I guess they drag out the garbage bins & stuff at closing. We were able to switch rooms for the next 4 nights, still on the 2nd floor but room overlooked the courtyard of hotel. Very quiet. This room was a Prestige room & it was spectacular. Very large, bathroom has separate WC, tub & shower with ample storage space. Loved this room. Both rooms had very comfortable beds. Breakfast was included with our stay and it was really nice but I would not pay the 29 Euros or so that they charge for it. The location is fantastic. Only a couple of minutes walk to subway stop. Subway is very easy to use & 2 euro for each ride or less if you buy a carnat of 10 tickets. There are a number of reasonably priced restaurants on Place du Marche Saint-Honore which is only a couple of short blocks from the hotel. There is also a laundromat on this street. We even did laundry while we ate one night at one of the sidewalk cafes. The staff are very professional, friendly & extremely helpful. One of the best trained staff we have experienced in our travels. They really try to make your stay the best it can be and then some. The concierge will purchase the museum pass as well as other things (Laduree macaroons being one) before your stay for a minimal charge. The Renaissance Vendome is a very good hotel in a great location. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All I could have asked for.....................”
Reviews.Author: jimblack
Reviews.Content: Just completed our 15th anniversary trip from Anchorage to Paris and Rome. In Paris after much research and advise from a friend, we booked the Renaissance Vendome. I was prepared for the small rooms and the lack of personal touch that Europe usally offers, however, I was and still am very much amazed at this property. About 2 weeks out, I emailed the Concierge and informed him we were coming to Paris for our 15th and asked for a possible king room. I booked the least expensive room and just hoped for the best. The concierge emailed me back several times and I was continued to be amazed. Upon checkin we were upgraded to a suite and given complementary breakfast each morning, which is a 40.00 per person bonus. The room was spectacular, even for US standards. I was expecting a small room and bed, however, was completely amazed at the size and quality of this room. Everything about this hotel was first class. I am a platinum traveler and am on the road a lot and usually am very picky. This place made our stay in Paris a GREAT expierance.

Reviews.Title: “A very good location”
Reviews.Author: oliveerpent
Reviews.Content: A very good location and a lovely room with a king bed. Despite the situation in the heart of Paris, the hotel is very quiet (small street behind la rue de Rivoli) No problem to park your car, there is a valet parking and champagne was in my room for my wedding birthday Very good breakfast and certainly a place to come back Olivier Villers Belgium

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for the solo traveler!”
Reviews.Author: NoLaDawlin
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights at the Renaissance Paris Vendome in April 2008. I booked the hotel with points - and all of my future point earnings will be saved for another stay at this hotel! The front desk allowed me to check in early and was very accomodating. The staff all addressed me by name by the end of my stay. The concierge desk took very good care of me. They provided great recommendations (and reservations) for dining in any neigborhood I was visiting. The desk provided maps, directions and instructions on just about anything I wished to do in Paris. The queen room was perfect for one. It might be a bit tight for two - just make sure you really like your fellow traveler! Of course the ammenities provided (fancy soaps and chocolates) were very nice. The staff and location are what really makes this hotel wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff...and great location”
Reviews.Author: riabla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vendome May 5 through 9. The location and staff could not be beat. We walked everywhere...and after a long day of sightseeing it was great to be able to come home to the hotel. The concierge staff, especially David, were very helpful in securing hard-to-get reservations and suggesting unforgettable bistros, brasseries, cafes. The front desk staff were all very helpful and indulged my attempts at speaking French. The room was a good size, we didn't find it small, it was just right. We didn't really spend much time in the room since Paris was just out the door. We love the JP Hevin chocolate lollipops put on our beds during turndown service. My parents were staying at another hotel, and we were so impressed with the Vendome that we moved them to our hotel so they could enjoy the amenities, take advantage of knowledgeable and courteous staff, and of course the great location. Also - the pool was a great treat at the end of a long day. My husband and I would stay here again, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jakesmum
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews on this site and we were not disappointed, this is a great hotel. The hotel is on Rue du Mont Thabor a little side street parallel (one down) with Rue Saint Honore which has some lovely designer shops and also useful shops like a chemist, an off licence ,etc. If you are looking for jewellery go to Place Vendome, off Rue Saint Honore. As others have said the location is excellent, about 5 minutes walk from the Louvre. After much consideration we decided to take a taxi from the airport rather than brave public transport with large suitcases. It was definitely the stress free way to travel, although obviously more expensive at around 40 - 50 euros for the trip. We were given a lovely room on the 5th floor facing the front of the hotel with a small balcony. It was heaven sitting out on the balcony sipping french wine in the sunshine after a long day walking round Paris. We had superb weather the entire time which helped! The room was not particularly large and neither was the bathroom but both were clean, well laid out and well decorated and had everything you needed, eg safe, mini bar, desk and chair, internet connection, easy chair, etc. Comfy big bed with comfy pillows. My only issue would be with the shower which was a mixer taps over the bath type one. The temperature and water pressure were variable, presumably depending on who else was using their shower at the same time! The air con was great so at night the room was cool, dark and also quiet - perfect! Dont eat breakfast in the hotel unless its part of your package. If its not it costs 58 euros for two and although its a good spread its just not worth that much. Go to Rue Rivoli where there are loads of cafes (out of the hotel, turn left then first right and its the first street you come to, with the Jardin des Tuileries opposite). We liked The Carrousel which is on Rue Rivoli almost opposite Les Arts Decoratif. We didnt eat dinner in the hotel so cant comment on that. We went to the restaurant Les Flottes the first night (the concierges are really helpful re restaurants) and had a great steak. Not cheap but then this is Paris! In fact our only real gripe about the whole holiday would be the price of food and drink - I didnt think it could be that bad compared to Edinburgh or London, but I was wrong! Although we speak some french, all the staff we met spoke excellent english and were really helpful. All in all we had a fantastic time in this hotel and will definitely be going back. I will be detailing hints and tips on the Paris Forum so if you are going soon, check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel, not great experience”
Reviews.Author: londontravellista
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue and almost have forgotten to write it. The hotel is greatly located, with trendy reception and modern rooms. We were given a room on the top floor overlooking the courtyard, so at least had some sun as the lower floors did not have any. Although the price was quite high the room was small (less than 1 meter from the bed to the wall) and was wondering why we were given this room as the hotel seemed to be emply. Overflowing shower, small bathroom, you get the picture. If the hotel wasn't so modern, would have gotten a worse review. Staff was nice and polite and there are lots of amenities nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pmr33
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue. I took my wife to Paris for her 40th birthday. This hotel was just perfect. It is in a great location in Paris. The rooms were decent size and very clean. The front desk was very helpful and always gave us directions and recommendations on what to see, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who will be visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Paris - A place to be in the center of things”
Reviews.Author: Local-Beer
Reviews.Content: This was a very interesting hotel, as it resides on a small side street just around the corner from The Hotel Ritz and the Tulleries. The front desk personnel were fabulous, knowledgable of the area and exstemely professional. From here a must to visit - a short walk to The New York Harry's Bar whare for bourbon drinkers, they have Knob Creek Bourbon and good hot dogs. For a higher time there is the Hemingway Bar at the Ritz, be sure to get Collin the make you a special drink and empress the ladies. He is one of the top ten mixologists and his mixes will astound you. Besides that you will meet both tourists and locals. They will make your evening interesting at the least. At the holel ask about the little bistros down the street for breakfast and dinner, they are more that happy to introduce you to the neighborhood. That what makes this special along with the Irish Pud just across the street - food and drink is great. The turn down service was perfect, the room had a great bath with lots of HOT water, plenty of towels, a robe and slippers. The best of all worlds was that this property actually takes care of anything you might leave in the room at checkout. I happened to leave my drivers license in the safe when I left. When I arrived in Brussels I realised this and had my hotel call for me. The hotel had the item and forwarded it to me at my next stop in Amsterdam, it was there when I arrived. WHAT A RELIEF!!!!!!!! That makes this my number ONE hotel in Paris from now on, as well as there being this Iris Pub across the street run by Chicagoians. Stay and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate, elegant”
Reviews.Author: NCdoc1
Reviews.Content: Have been to Paris twice before, this was the best hotel / best visit... Location initially slightly daunting, a small one-way street one block north of the Jardins du Tuileries, looked "deserted" the first day, felt "cozy" by the end of the week . Between rue de Rivoli and Rue St. Honore, 2 blocks from the Metro, about 4 from the Louvre and Place Concorde. Many fine shops, cafes, brasseries nearby. ALL staff (desk, housekeeping, bellmen) friendly, efficient, accomodating, with most needs anticipated, any others addressed as soon as possible. Concierges knowledgeable and very helpful. Room typically small, as is usual in Paris, but with tall windows, so plenty of natural light, as well as much better average room lighting, in number, location, and brightness of lighting (including moveable halogen lights mounted on the headboard for reading). Restaurant prices high, but so many nearby choices, not a problem. Highly recommend, will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “There is a reason it is ranked so high!”
Reviews.Author: shannpann
Reviews.Content: We were going to Paris for both business and pleasure - I had originally booked us at the Westin Paris as I work for the federal government and can get special rates. After reading all of the negative comments, I switched to this hotel and it was one of the best decisions I have ever made! About a week prior to arrival, we received an email from the concierge letting us know about current events in Paris. This ranged from art exhibits to concerts to shows. There was information on all of the transportation options from both airports as well as travel time, expense, detailed directions. As we were travelling from the west coast on an overnite flight, we opted to get the private driver from the airport. As soon as we cleared customs, there was an english speaking driver with a sign waiting for us. He had a S500 mercedes parked directly outside and we were on our way. We arrived at 11am and a room was ready for us! The location is absolutely perfect. You are right down the street from the Tuillerie Gardens, Louvre and Tuillerie metro station which is a very convenient line. I highly recommend learning how to use the metro - it saved us with rainly windy days. The concierge desk has museum passes, l'open tour passes, and can arrange tours for you as well as the usual dinner reservations, suggestions, etc. I am very serious in saying that these are some of the best hotel people that I have ever confronted. I actually ran into the general manager one afternoon and told her that whatever she is doing, it is working! The room was a little small but we had a very good rate so expected... very tastefully done, bed was comfortable, lots of shelf space in the closet, a large safe, flat screen tv, high-speed internet (expensive at 15 euros/day), well appointed bathroom with shower and separate tub. The double pain windows and a room not facing the street, very nice light blocking curtains made for a quick recovery from jetlag and great sleep. Only complaint that I can think of is that even with all of the lights on, it is still a little dark - especially on a rainy day. Breakfast was a little bit high-priced - 23 euro for cold buffet and 29 for hot. There were all kinds of breads, croissants, cheeses, fruit juices, cereals, yogurts, cut up fruits and tea or coffee so very convenient and filling. There were eggs dishes and bacon if you chose the hot menu. We ate there most days for the convenience and tried a few other places that were not any better with slower service. There is a pool in the basement of the hotel - the water is a little cool but I agree with others that it was a nice break after a day of walking! I am a little bit of a hotel snob and I can say nothing negative about this hotel. The people who work there were some of the nicest staff that I have ever dealt with anywhere - I will certainly stay there again when I go to Paris. Feel free to email me if you have other questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jdr1000
Reviews.Content: 'Stayed at this hotel because of location and service combination. Rooms are well kept, clean, modern, and comfortable. Location is perfect, close to food, culture, transportation and services. Staff is always helpfull and try their best to satisfy any request, from sending me to an English speaking pharmacy to translating in paper food requests. My only complaint is the showers, as with many european hotels, apparently installing full shower curtains or doors is not their thing. Bathroom will get wet, no matter how carefull you are. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBRussell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April of 2007 and absolutely loved it. Rooms are a little small HOWEVER you should rarely be in your room, right? Beds are heavenly, we did sleep in a lot because of this. I still use the Bulgari lotion they had in the room (reminds me of Paris now). This hotel is close to the Louvre and other great attractions. PLEASE visit the fun Irish bar across the street, we made some great friends in there ~ Bon Voyage! P.S. Don't forget to check out the pool and fitness ctr. in the basement, it was wonderful to be able to take a little swim in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Very average, possibly overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: kq501
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of reading on TA to find perfect hotel, but think I might have got better value for money elsewhere I'm afraid. The hotel is very modern and trendy and the service very friendly, but sadly the room size and a few other drawbacks, meant that I couldn't give a better review. We were given an upgrade on arrival, but I'll be honest, unless the upgrade meant we got a mini bar... I really can't believe it was a proper upgrade. The room was very small and compact, and if we were rightly upgraded to a suite then I'd hate to have spent even more money (which I nearly did prebooking) on such a small suite. I have been to Paris before and I am aware that rooms are small most places, but fo rthe money I spent I'd have expected better. We were unfortunately right across a small street from an Irish bar.... which at the weekend allows it patrons to drink outside while smoking.... EXTREMELY LOUD... to the point you can't possibly ignore it. Adults with suits acting like kids... both fri and sat nights. We also ordered room service. My partner tried to order just a plain baguette with cheese, which they said they couldn't do as it's not on the menu!!! The food was very poor too for the money. A club sandwhich, drenched in dressing that it turned to mush. Chips were cold and merely batter. We just popped it back outside hardly touched... but were still charged full price obviously. I'm really sorry I can't give it a better review. The location was excellent, but to be honest you could stay anywhere in Paris cos the metro is that good. I feel bad as the staff were lovely. Sadly, I'm not the type to exaggerate in a review. I wouldn't tell people not to book, but look around first. Sorry Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Amazing service.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingRaider
Reviews.Content: Close to everything you could want to see. Amazing property. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Travelminx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon and were very pleased. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and full of small things that really make a huge difference. We ate breakfast there on several occasions (good) and had cocktails most evenings in the little bar (excellent!). The location is great and the bathroom toiletries are also of good quality. We have to thank the hotel for the gestures which made our honeymoon stay with them exceptional. We very much enjoyed our stay there and can highly recommend this Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bubbasrb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in November 2007. We decided to stay here because we could stay using Marriott Reward points. Our reservation was for a "Prestige Room" and we were going to pay an extra 60 Euros a night for our seven day stay. Check in was a little slow. We arrived at about 10:30 am hoping to get into our room but we were told it would only be a short wait. We hung around, then decided to go for lunch and a walk around the area. I think we were finally taken to our room at 2pm. Everyone was really nice about it and we were happy with our room. The rooms are small. Even the "prestige" room is smaller than an average US hotel room, so be prepared. The hotel was really beautiful, but smaller overall than I expected. There is a great indoor pool near the spa that my husband and I took advantage of one evening. Nice way to relax after a day of walking the city. There is also a steam room and sauna available. The hotel location could not be beat. We talked about cancelling our trip due to the transportation strike, but decided to go because we had such a great location. The strike lasted our entire visit, but we walked everywhere. This location is very close to the Louvre and one block off the Jardin de Tuilleries.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Paris Pleasure Jan 14, 2008”
Reviews.Author: SeatravelerWA
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris and two nights at the Vendome. This is a friendly, charmimg small hotel that we all enjoyed very much. IWe had two rooms, one on a reward, larger room quaranted with a 60 euro fee per day, and one standard room. We wound up in two interconnecting rooms, one with a cal king, one with a standard king, connection was behind a joint hall door. lots of priviacy. Rooms were beautiful, large sized, but one had a smaller bathroom but still very nice. We had a total of three balconies with a pleasant view of the stylish Paris nighborhood, and if we leaned out we could see the Orsay. Breakfast was comped, with my gold Marriott status and very nice. Every staff member we came into contact with was friendly and helpful and all spoke English pretty well. They even arranged for us a larger cab, for the 4 of us and our luggage when we departed tp the airport. The only complaint I had was the euro half shower door, just can't help getting the bathroom soaked. Bath ammenites was wonderful. I will be back soon, I can't wait

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel + location”
Reviews.Author: Lawz333
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Cannot really fault this hotel in any major way. GREAT (with emphasis) location. 2 min to the metro and 5 min to the Louvre gardens. A bit hard to find the hotel for taxis and drivers given that it is located in one of the backstreets - but don't let that deter you. The rooms are not massive. However, as you can see in the photos posted on here - it's very modern and comfortable. If you are not into the old classicial french style and prefer to modern touch, then this is the place to be. Great bathroom with separate shower and tub, and bulgari toilettries add an extra touch. Extra chocolate is provided with the turndown service - YUM. There are two lifts in the hotel - can only fit around 5 or 6 ppl at a time, but shouldn't be an issue. I recalled from other reviews that there maybe some issues with the rooms located at the higher floors (with the height of the ceilings). However, as I stayed in level 1 (facing the courtyard), there were no issues. Have recommended this hotel to my friends for their honeymoon and they loved it as well. It is definitely more reasonably priced compared to others in the same area (eg. Westin, Park Hyatt) and provides the same benefits in terms of convenience. Oh, if you have a chance, visit Angelina for brekkie or afternnoon tea. They are the best for hot chocolates and its also 2 min from the hotel on the main road!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location!”
Reviews.Author: imwmn913
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Vendome the second week of November 2007. We chose it primarily because it is in the family of Marriott Hotels - and we were using points. The hotel is very modern in decor -so if you are looking for quaint...this is not the place. The staff were great and the Concierge (especially Xavier) gave us great restaurant recommendations and sightseeing advice. The location is wonderful...just a block from great shopping, restaurants, bistros...... everything within a few minutes walking time. Perhaps 10 minutes or so to the Louvre and the Gardens. We will definitely stay here on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - one of my favourite hotels!”
Reviews.Author: JonathanBateman
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel......great service and location. The pool is very stylish and functional. Rooms are exteremely comofortable. Suites are fantastic ! Have stayed 4 times now and wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris. Staff are superb and friendly. I can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid room!”
Reviews.Author: lesmil
Reviews.Content: I used my Marriott Reward Points and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the room and friendly staff. I did pay the 60 Euro per night upgrade--but it was well worth it. The bed, towels, accessories, etc were all excellent. The location and the ability to use points made this hotel a real delight. I would returning here because of the pleasant experience. We did not eat the breakfast since it was 29 Euros so I cannot comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Nath&Sian
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Renaissance hotel. It has a superb location in the centre of Paris, close to virtually all of the major sights and close enough to walk to the metro for those distances too far for walking. Breakfast was very well presented, lots of choice and very fresh. Xavier the concierge was extremely helpful in recommending restaurants and bars, in addition to his extensive knowledge on the shopping haunts of St Germain. 2 restaurants we would recommend our L'ardoise (2-3 min walk from the hotel on Rue Mont Thabor) very authentic French bistro, brush up on your French skills before you go there, the steak was fantastic. The 2nd night we went for a Thai restaurant called Thior on Place D'Orsay which was out of this world. Would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping was the only weak link”
Reviews.Author: HVB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for almost a week in November during the transit strike. We were extremely grateful the hotel was in a perfect location as we could not use the metro. The hotel staff was great, arranging a driver (with awesome car) to meet us at the airport to avoid long taxi lines. My husband also arranged with the concierge Xavier for us to have a couples massage upon landing. It was probably the best massage I've had. The steam room was a delightful treat and a great way to end a long day of walking. Xavier recommended several excellent restaurants. We ate at L'Ardoise down the block once. Our favorite meal of the trip was at Le Saut du Loup. We had room 201 and I thought the size was plenty. Yes the shower door is typical European and water gets on the floor. Just don't leave anything that can't get wet on the floor. My only gripe with the hotel was housekeeping did not clean our room one day and we had to call for more toilet paper as it was not replenished. The staff were all very nice and helpful. As with many others, we used Marriott points for the stay and paid the extra supplement.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: HoustonLawyer
Reviews.Content: The Good: the rooms are nice, trendy and upscale, but small. The location is close to Place Vendome, and in a quiet side street so noise is limited. Price for the rooms tend to be very good for what you get - in the 300 Euro range. The Bad: no hot water in the shower at 1pm on a Saturday afternoon. Sudden hot and cold water surges in the shower at 5am on a Sunday morning. The Ugly: the hotel accidentally gave away our reserved taxi to another guest during the strike, and so my wife and I missed our train to London. That said, they acknowledged their mistake, and put us up for free that night so we could take the first train in the morning. Overall, lots of plus points, with a few negatives.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely City Hotel in a Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: bagsalwayspacked
Reviews.Content: Intro We decided to spend a relaxing week within walking distance of the Louvre, dâ€™Orsay, the Orangerie and the Rodin museums, and this hotel has the perfect location. We would like to thank the manager, Mr. Perrin, and his fine staff for a memorable stay. The concierges, Olivier, David and Xavier, made our stay even better. Size and quality of the rooms Many reviews have mentioned the size of the rooms; we found them to be typical of other large city hotels. Our first three nights were spent in Room 504 with a small balcony facing Rue Mont Thabor, a quiet street one short block from the Rue di Rivoli and the Tuillierres Gardens. The queen bed was luxurious, and the speedy Internet service was worth 15 E a day to stay in touch with the office. It is a good idea to upgrade to a large room if you can not handle small spaces or if you are accustomed to large spaces and spend a lot of time in the room. Our last four nights were in a larger Room 508, which had a king bed and two double balcony doors facing Rue Alger. My husband had a cold, and it was a great place to spend a good part of the day resting. The selection of TV channels was superb; we enjoyed listening to shows from Dubai and in so many languages. We slipped our iPod into the radio and listened to music each day and read the Wall Street Journal, Herald Tribune and USA Today provided free in the lobby. Many guests have mentioned the fine Bulgari toiletries; we also liked the large, comfortable bath towels and friendly housekeepers who did not knock when we chose to sleep during the day. The room fridges were great for storing jars of yogurt and drinks we purchased at a convenience store about two blocks away on Rue Honore, which was a great place to stroll. Our laptop just fit in the closet safe, where we stored our other valuables when we were out of the room. Hotel facilities The health club/spa downstairs looked wonderful, but we were too tired to use it after so much walking. The After the Rain spa services were inviting but too expensive for our budget at 120E for a one-hour massage. There were free beverages in the lobby and a nice living and reading room for lounging on sofas. The lobby bar was inviting and a good source of glasses of ice for our room. Hotel restaurant Each morning we had breakfast in Pinxo off the lobby; the omelets were tasty, and the selection was wonderful. The fresh sliced kiwi and French yogurt in glass jars were first class. We were spoiled by the fine breakfasts, which were included in our room package. We did not have other meals at the hotel because there are so many highly rated restaurants in the neighborhood. Where to eat nearby We relied on the paperback â€œGreat Eats in Paris,â€� and found superb food and service for about 30E per person or less without wine, which usually ran about 15E for a half bottle. Two of our favorites were a block from the hotel, Lâ€™Ardoise and Le Souffle. With a large, late breakfast, we found that one other meal a day was more than enough. It was a pleasant way to celebrate our tenth anniversary and my husbandâ€™s first trip to Paris. Museums, museums and more museums This location was perfect for walking to museums each day. We did not bother with the Metro or buses, and only took taxis when we had walked too far. We recommend the Teaching Companyâ€™s lecture courses on the Louvre and the Impressionists before you visit Paris. They suggest spending only an hour or two looking at a few works of art in each museum in order to avoid burnout. This was a totally different approach from our previous European trips, and it worked superbly. There is too much to see in a week in Paris, so just select a few places and enjoy a small part of them at a relaxed pace. Other sights We enjoyed a day walking to St. Chapelle and Notre Dame and touring the two islands in the Seine. Another day we visited the Arc de Triumphe and walked along the Champs and to the Eiffel Tower. The Peugeot store on the Champs had the latest concept cars and cool tee shirts from the rugby championships the company was sponsoring in Paris this year. The restaurants and shops along Rue Marbeuf are first class. La Fermette de Marbeuf is a jewel not to be missed. Rick Steveâ€™s â€œParis 2008â€� came in handy for guiding us through the sights. There is so much to see that we could spend at least another year in Paris and not return to any place twice. We had no problem communicating with our meager 100 word French vocabularies. The neighborhood Welcome to heaven! Besides the unbelievable museums a few minutes away, the Westin, the Ritz, the Meurice and many upscale shops are within a block or two of the Renaissance. W.H. Smith offers English books, and Angelinaâ€™s has the world famous hot chocolate. The Tuilleries Gardens are delightful for people watching. Summary If you are looking for a quiet, relaxing vacation in central Paris, this hotel is the best. The room sizes and prices are appropriate for this neighborhood. Marriott has done a fine job decorating and staffing this Renaissance, and we truly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it , Excellent service and rooms !!!”
Reviews.Author: KJLMexico
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very very nice (clean and great looking) and the service was incredible. Excellent locations, 2-3 blocks from place concorde and very near from the Champs Elysees !!! Loved it =)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: campbejuSacramento
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent a week at the Renaissance Paris Vendome. The service was exceptional, the staff spoke very good English and the hotel staff remembered a lot of detail about our stay (room #, drinks, etc). You can't beat the location. Safe, near the Tulieries, Louvre, metro and wonderful restaurants. The rooms were small but were clean and very comfortable. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler8910
Reviews.Content: I don't speak any French at all, and I was very worried about having a good experience during my visit to Paris. This hotel was perfect - the staff all spoke excellent English, and were very kind about it. The concierge was first-class; she even helped me hunt down a specific Babar book on a Sunday afternoon. The location is honestly perfect - so close to everything. And the room size was decent for a European hotel - would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “renaissance best location”
Reviews.Author: PikesvilleTraveler
Reviews.Content: although the rooms were somewhat small (not really for europe) this hotel had outstanding service and a fantastic location the people at the front desk, including the concierge and even the doormen, were so nice and helpful i would recommend it to anyone---one block from Tuileries, 2 blocks from Place de la Concorde---couldnt be better---walk to the Louvre---

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, but snooty service”
Reviews.Author: Muscae
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Vendome is beautifully decorated, with very plush rooms: marble bathroom outfitted with Bulgari Green Tea toiletries; flat-screen TV, high thread count sheets. The location is lovely, too: just off the Place Vendome in the rue St Honore shopping district, and five minutes to metro Tuileries or walking distance to the Louvre if you're wearing flats. It's tucked away on a side street, so it's quiet and feels very intimate. The only downside is that the service doesn't feel very caring. I'm a Platinum member at the Marriott hotels, but received only a free breakfast: no cocktails, no internet access, no welcome drink. At breakfast, we were ignored by the staff until we literally had to peek into the kitchen to seek service. There was a false fire alarm at 10am on Sunday, and the staff didn't even bother to explain what was happening although guests were trooping down to the lobby in their bathrobes. Likewise, the concierge was not at his desk when I inquired about restaurant reservations. The receptionist literally said, "It's not my job," before reluctantly helping me to call the restaurant. In the end, the concierge did return and did his job well, securing the booking and dialing my overseas mobile phone to confirm the booking with me; but it felt rather flat by that point.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mullettlk
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family from Aug1-5 in a suite. While rooms are "compact" they have all the necessary items. The location is very convenient and the staff is some of the best at any hotel I have stayed in Europe. Concerige was the best. I would repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cubfanincs
Reviews.Content: I spend 180 nights a year at different Marriott properties, so I had a lot of points to use. I took my family to Paris and I looked at every Marriott property in Paris. This is by far the best combination of atmosphere and location. It is not a large "corporate" hotel and you could not ask for a better location for seeing Paris by foot. The hotel room was nice. When you spend as many nights as I do in hotels, clean and comfortable is all that matters. One of our rooms was the upgrade to a king. The bathroom is much larger and nicer having both a tub and shower. Because of how many nights I stay, they upgraded me for free, I personally would not have paid the extra, but if atmosphere and a nicer room are important to you, it would be well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Kuty
Reviews.Content: Using Marriott Reward Points, my wife and I stayed the last week of June. It was a clean, well appointed and had impeccable service. The location can't be beat. While the room was small by American standards, it was sufficient for us. However, I do have two pieces of advice: If you're sensitive to loud noises late at night, request a room away from the front of the hotel. The patrons at the Irish bar across the street can be very loud and annoying. Also, if you can't find the remote control for the television, the maid probably put it into that small box on your bedside table. I plan on returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Lovely Staff, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jsoxy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ranaissance Vendome June 16-18. We used Marriott points for our stay, and were allowed to upgrade to a nicer room for a small fee. The staff was very helpful, including letting us check in around 11:00 in the morning when we arrived from the U.S. Our room was very small, as usual in Paris, but quite comfortable. There is wired high-speed internet in the rooms (for a fee), which was great. There's a great Irish bar across the street. The location is spectacular for sightseeing in Paris. Although the street is quite quiet, you are only steps away from the Tuileries garden. I had been reluctant to go the "Marriott" route, but I can enthusiastically recommend this hotel after staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -”
Reviews.Author: JCLON
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel as often as I can when I travel to Paris on business. It is good value for money in Paris. Some of the rooms are small but if you manage to get one of the suites on the ground floor you will want to go for the â‚¬29/per Room Service Breakfast. They come with a very intimate terrace. The staff is always very courteous (this does not apply to the doormen who almost never greet you when you arrive) and helpful. You may want to make reservations at PinXo their restaurants. It is a well known restaurant in Paris and tends to be booked up. Very central location, near very good restaurant on Place du Marche St Honore. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “get what you book?...”
Reviews.Author: Baldie1
Reviews.Content: This trip was a surprise for my partners 40th birthday and unbeknown to her were I was going to ask for her hand in marriage (so I had to have everything just right!!) , But on arrival we were surprised to find that the room that I had paid 1200 euro for a two night stay, had'nt materialised, after waiting nearly 2hrs, several bowls of spicey nuts and two or maybe three drinks we were eventually given a room, not the "Corner Junior Loft suite" but one on the 2nd floor which was for another customer, I went back to reception and rec'd a room on the 4th floor, again not the one I had booked, back to reception again, after a good 20 minute conversation, my partner (who's special weekend this was) managed to get them to transfer us to room no 3, which was again not what i had paid for but by this time I had lost the will to live, I just wanted to get out, see the sight and relax. Upon my return I contacted "Marriott Customer Services" regarding my reservation, outlining the fact that I had paid a lot of money for a room that I never received and the double importance of my visit, the reply from Marriott seemed that they did not value 1) my custom + 2) were unable to provide an explanation or an appology as to why I did'nt receive what I had paid for. For a company of Marriott's standing I would have expected a higher level of professionalism and competent customer services.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Paris Vendome, tres bon!”
Reviews.Author: chrisjo06
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Renaissance Paris Vendome for 3 nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Having used some of our Marriott Rewards points to pay for the room (we did pay a 60Euros per night surcharge to upgrade to a prestige room, which was worthwhile doing) it is difficult to comment on value for money. That said the staff, especially reception/concierge were welcoming and knowledgeable. Breakfast (included in the rate) was good enough although we chose to eat other meals in restaurants other than the hotel (Bistrot du Paris, Rue de Lille, was excellent and walkable!). Items in the mini bar were way over priced and, like everywhere in Paris, drinks in the bar were very expensive. The room was spacious enough, quiet and relaxing, very comfortable, LCD TV/DVD player, great bed and a perfectly acceptable bathroom. The location of the hotel is fantastic - we walked to e.g. the shopping area(s), Le Louvre, the Eiffel Tower, Tuiliants, St.Germain, etc. Would we stay there again? Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: maksis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and no regrets at all! If to start with downsides then the only one I can name is the size of room. We had double queen and it's really the smallest room we stayed in for years. But thanks to Tripadvisor's reviews we came prepared to see small room (yet hoping that reviews of room size is exaggerated a bit). So, no surprises - good or bad. Bathroom which is half of the living room's size has powerful shower and nice smelling Bvlgari toiletries (I believe green tea aroma is acceptable for both women and men). Lobby, bar and restaurant gives you the prefect feeling of charming boutique hotel. Location of the hotel is perfect - you've got the same as for the Ritz and Le Meurice. 5 to 15 min walking distance to many attractions, 2 min to metro stop. But the staff is the one which deserves the highest marks possible. You feel truly welcome from the moment you arrive, all requests are fulfilled promptly. During our stay we were fully relaxed cos knew - if anything, we will be in safe hands. For us basically staff is the reason that heavily offsets room size deficiency. Will stay at hotel next time when in Paris without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience @ Renaissance Paris Vendome”
Reviews.Author: lindy1991
Reviews.Content: Spent seven days here and the staff was fabulous, helpful, pleasant in every way. Room small, but quiet and excellently appointed with a very comfortable bed. Hotel location a plus. Highly recommended. Restaurant was good, but not great for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed at the best...and this is better!”
Reviews.Author: DCDaveBrad
Reviews.Content: There's a reason this hotel spent years ranked in Trip Advisorâ€™s top 20 out of 1700 hotels in Paris and it belongs back there. I don't know at what other hotels the people who gave this one bad marks have stayed previously, but I've stayed at Ritz Carltons, Fairmonts and The Breakers in Palm Beach and the service, facilities, and accommodations at this hotel are on par with, if not better than, the best of these. As others have reported, the hotel is in a beautiful building on a nice, quiet street one block off the Rue de Rivoli. The location is amazing! We were five minutes from the Louvre or the Champs Elysees, two minutes from the Tuilleries Garden and its Metro station, and within easy walking distance dozens of great cafÃ©s, including CafÃ© Angelina with the best hot chocolate on the planet, not to mention the fun and friendly Carrâ€™s Irish Pub across the street! The dÃ©cor is warm and inviting and the staff is friendly and efficient. We had decided to upgrade to a â€œDeluxeâ€� room and it was a good move. Was the room a bit small by American standards? Yes, but Iâ€™ve stayed in smaller and this one was quite comfortable, with plenty of closet and storage space in the nice, wood wall units. There was ample room to move around, and the flat screen TV was very cool, especially with the DVD/CD player hooked into it (I could play my CDs through the TV!). Also, it was really nice having windows that opened, but they also sealed up tight and the double-paned glass did a great job keeping out what little noise there was. We also loved the queen-sized bed, from the foam pillows weâ€™d requested in advance to the â€œjust rightâ€� mattress to the soft, cozy comforter. I usually donâ€™t sleep well in hotels, but I slept great in this one! Iâ€™ve read the comments about the showers, and this would be the only thing I might be tempted to complain about. I confess Iâ€™m not clear on why they wouldnâ€™t just put in a shower curtain or a full glass door on the tub, but Iâ€™m assuming thereâ€™s a good reason. However, the bathroom was very nice and we adapted to the situation with very little effort. My wife decided to take a bath instead of a shower each morning while I shaved, and when it was my turn, we just put down the bath mat and her towel and that pretty much kept the floor dry (the towels are so huge, it covered half the floor anyway!). This was a very minor inconvenience and we were not bothered by it at all. The service was excellent. We took advantage of the free breakfast every morning, ordering pretty much whatever we wanted, and our meal was delivered promptly every morning at the time weâ€™d specified the night before. We had a little trouble adjusting the A/C (which we needed because it was unseasonably warm the week we were there), but one call to the front desk took care of that. And, the concierge was very helpful, obtaining our museum passes for us and steering us to a nearby â€œtabacâ€� for the phone card we needed. And, the icing on the cake for this hotel is the pool!
