In a beautiful room decorated with tile and teak wood, it was actually a bit larger than I expected. It even has those big water â€œjetsâ€� at one end so you can swim toward them and itâ€™s like youâ€™re swimming laps without moving! Not that we were looking to exercise at the end of the day! The pool was the perfect way to relax after several hours of walking and admiring the sights and if you stay here, definitely take advantage of it. Location, amenities, service, comfort, this place has it all. The Renaissance is an outstanding hotel that will help make your special trip to Paris even more so. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: TravelWithKids2
Reviews.Content: We got family room at 5th floor. For almost 500Euros per night, it was definitely not worth it. Room was so small ... Not only square footage of the room was small, but ceilings were low as well, I would say about 2m high. Room felt as a little box, nicely decorated, clean - box. Service was OK, nothing more then that. Dinner was OK, nothing more then that. Having stayed in some other hotels in Paris at same location, with larger rooms at lower price, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Paris Vendome -- Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: FredMacmurray
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days at the Renaissance Paris Vendome. It was an absolutely wonderful experience. The location is great --the hotel is 1 block from the Tuilleries Gardens and just off the heart of the Rue Faubourg shopping district. The staff could not have been more nice and accommodating. It was my wife's 50th birthday and I worked with the hotel's concierges --David and Julien -- to book spa treatments for her prior to our arrival. They made sure all of the arrangements were perfect. Not once did we enter/leave the hotel without one of the doormen opening the door and wishing us a smiling "bonjour" or "bon nuit." The same "we are glad you are here" attitude was displayed by all of the hotel employees, from the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff. The hotel's interior is radiant -- fresh flowers are in the lobby everyday. Our room was very nice -- it was on the sixth floor and faced the courtyard. The room itself was more than large enough -- plenty of space to store our luggage. The bathroom was great -- it had separate stalls for the bath tub and shower. And the bed was extremely comfortable. This was our 4th trip to Paris -- and we have stayed in about 8 hotels during those trips -- ranging from the L'Odeon, to the Prince DeGalles, to the suite next to the famed "Bernstein" suite at the Crillon. I have to say -- our stay at the Renaissance Vendome was even more enjoyable than any of our previous stays. My wife and I are already planning to return here next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location! Great Honeymoon spot!”
Reviews.Author: jaywong54
Reviews.Content: I am not going to go into a lot of details, since the other reviews cover most of it. However, I will say that this hotel is an A+. They will do whatever it takes to make your stay a pleasurable one. Anytime I called down to concierge, they made sure that I was taken care of. In one instance, I needed a nail clipper and they even offered to go out and buy me one. They will absolutely go the "extra mile" for you. The bar downstairs was probably our favorite. We spent a lot of time in there between trips in and out of the hotel. MENG, the bartender, is wonderful and a joy to talk to. She really made our experience a lot better. Also, the doorman during the day was overly nice as was the concierge. Beware, however, that although there is someone at the front desk 24 hrs a day, the concierge closes at midnight and re-opens 9 AM in the morning. However, they will try their best to accomdate you in the meantime. The room service nighttime menu is very limited, but the chicken curry was excellent. The cheese and fruit plate is also very good. The in-room fridge has a nice selection of waters, juices, sodas, wine (white) and champagne. There is in-room wired Internet service for 15 Euro for 24 hrs or 7 Euro for 1 hr. The TV (21" LCD) has quite a few channels and there is a DVD player in the room as well, although it won't play USA region code DVDs. There is some closet space in the rooms, but overall they are small - but you expect that in Europe. Each room has a small desk, desk ottoman, and a single sofa-chair. The rooms are immaculate and are cleaned every day. The maids do an excellent job. There are two phones and an alarm clock as well in each room. Overall, this hotel is so good that we will probably only stay here the next time we travel to Paris. It is about 2 blocks from the Louvre, one block from the main avenue - Rue De Rivoli (which has great food and souvenir shops and leads to Champs E'lyesses about 1 km down). We love the location and could not ask for anything more. EXCELLENT EXPERIENCE. You will not be disappointed, and this is coming from someone that calls concierge at least 4 times a day. =)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel2929
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful. The room was so nice. It is a small and intimate hotel. It has a modern decor with clean lines. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are nice and large. It was very clean. It is a nice, luxury hotel with a bed that you can just sink into after a long day of sightseeing. It is wonderful hotel, you will not be disappointed! It has been awhile since I have been there, but I have stayed there twice and enjoyed both times and would definitely recommend this to anyone that I know that is going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located - worked perfectly for us”
Reviews.Author: retrac5
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - not perfect, but perfect for us. Here are some details. Our stay: 2/18/07 - 2/24/07 Booking: Very easy - we used Marriott Reward Points Location: Excellent. A VERY short walk (5 minutes) from the Tuileries Metro station and only 10 minutes to the Louvre, 15 minutes to the D'Orsay, 45 minute walk up the Champs-Elysees to the Arc, about the same to the Eiffel Tower. Every thing could be walked to within one hour - but the easy Metro Access gave us many choices and the RER station at the D'Orsay gave us direct access to Versaille as well. ***Warning - the Metro ticket machines do not accept American Credit Cards or paper euros. If you plan to use the machine, bring coins. ****Warning #2 - the Tuileries metro ticket window was not open on Saturday morning at 7:30AM when we were leaving for the airport (CDG) - so without enough coin change, we were unable to buy tickets directly to the airport. It required exiting the system while still within zone 1 (which is all the change we had) to buy tickets to the airport from a staffed ticket booth. Check-in: Wonderful. Staff was very pleasant and had our room ready when we arrived at the hotel shortly after 12 Noon. Room: As advertised in other postings, a little small. Very nice, very modern (flat screen); but limited drawer space. Our room was on the first floor with a balcony to an interior courtyard. Very Quiet. Bathroom: Very nice, but again, as other postings have stated - the shower leaks a lot. This could be solved rather easily in my opinion by putting a flange on the bottom of the door to capture and redirect water back into the shower instead of allowing it to fall outside the door onto the bathroom floor. Smoked glass bathroom doors (both from the room and to the shower and toilet provide little privacy when the lights in the bathroom are on. There is enough ambient light though from the room, so when we wanted privacy, we just left the bathroom light off. Service: Excellent. If we left the Privacy sign on the door, we were left alone; even when we forgot, they always knocked and made sure that it was OK to come in. When we were out, the room was cleaned quickly and well; regardless if we had left the Privacy sign out all day and removed it at 6PM. Even at that hour they cleaned without our request. Nightly turn down service was also provided (when the Privacy sign was not on the door) with tasty chocolate suckers brought to the room. Price: As mentioned, we booked the room with Marriott Reward points, however, we upgraded to the Deluxe Room - which provided a larger room and a full breakfast for 3 of us each day. The charge for this upgrade was 60euro per day, which we considered reasonable. Restaurant: Breakfast - Wonderful - eggs to order or scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, toast, fruit, cheeses, sliced meats - we ate there everyday (to take advantage of our deluxe upgrade). Dinner - Very popular and the menu looked good, but the one night that we decided to eat there for dinner, there were no reservations available. This was fortunate for us as the Concierge recommended a wonderful neighborhood restaurant only 5 minutes walk down the same street - which served great food and even better atmosphere. Excercise Room, Spa, Pool - very nice. In the basement and underutilized. We enjoyed a relaxing swim and sauna. Overall - perfect for us. We would love to be pampered at the Four Seasons, but can't afford that type of experience (yet). This hotel had very friendly staff, a comfortable bed, and was a GREAT LOCATION for touring. We would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing, so many better choices in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jwbiv
Reviews.Content: After having read the reviews here, we were looking forward to a great experience at this hotel, but what a joke. While one reviewer wrote "the rooms are small, but this is Paris,", after having stayed in more than a dozen other hotels in Paris, many less than half of the price of this one, I can honestly say this was the tiniest hotel room I ever had. At these prices, there is simply no excuse. Yes, the location is terrific -- and that's important because you certainly can't stay in your room. There is also no place to unpack (no drawers, horrible use of space), and not even enough room to keep your suitcase on a rack. Second day there we awoke to no electricity in our room. We finally got reception to pick up the phone, and were told "they'd get back to us". A half an hour later someone showed up, said they hadn't realized whole block of rooms were without power (and air circulation) but they were getting it back on. There was never the slightest apology about this. The concierge is a waste -- the only bad meal we had in Paris was his recommendation, and the breakfast in the hotel, at 29 Euros, is insane -- and not much too it. There are numerous cafes in the area, while also pricey, offer a decent "petit dejeuner" for around 10 Euros instead. We used Marriott points so shouldn't complain this much, but friends stayed there as well and they were really ripped off. Believe me, we stayed at a hotel for half the price on the Left Bank, had a sense of true Paris, great, large room, with a view, impeccable service -- and the room rate was less than half of this. Don't settle for an inferior experience -- if you are only comfortable in chain hotels, Westin around the corner and the Hilton on the left bank (where rooms are also twice the size) are far superior choices. A horrible experience...

Reviews.Title: “Great base for visit on foot”
Reviews.Author: IngsDroitwich
Reviews.Content: Easy taxi from Orly, 35euro, yes smallish room but well presented and faced into the inner quad so very quiet. Did not have breakfast or dinner, well very expensive and why bother when there are so many options nearby. Had great walks from here to Ille onto Bastille (Le petit Bofinger great for lunch full of French), shopping on the Rue de Opera, Louve nearby, Place de Concorde onto Eiffel Tower past Arc down Champs and back for rest. Pool small but fantastic, very quiet and relaxing loads of towels - great. Restaurants nearby, La Sourdiere around the corner 4, rue de la Sourdiere (great value great food). L'absinthe in a great square nearby ( brill) with many other options, Le Dauphin along the rue St Honore on the way to the Comedie (more pricey wine list). Irish bar opposite front door to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Kradjian
Reviews.Content: I will prefice this review by saying that we used our Marriott Rewards points and therefore cannot comment to the value of the stay. That being said, this is on par with 4 star hotels in the states and we couldn't find any faults with the hotel. The staff was professional and receptive. The location was without peer. The room was small, however, that is Europe. The shower was strong, there was a very nice bath. The bed was excellent and the room was very quiet allowing for great sleep.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong! Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandbear
Reviews.Content: Great Location!!! Located one block from the Tuileries Metro and just about everything is walking distance, including the Louvre and the Champs Elysees. The hotel is tucked away on a very quiet street and the beds were heavenly, so every night was a very peaceful sleep. The pool was very cozy. After a long day of sightseeing, it's a great place to unwind with a glass of wine (that I would recommend buying at a little grocery store if you walk by one. You can buy a wonderful bottle for less than $10.) Bundle up if you go in the winter. It was cold and cloudy but oh so beautiful with the Christmas trees and the lights. This is a great hotel for married couples traveling alone, although I'm sure it's good for children as well. Oh, one other thing, we were there on Christmas Eve and Day and they brought us a box of German chocolate cookies. They were so good and I thought that was very kind of them. By the way, if you travel during the holidays and are fearing that nothing will be open, do not worry. Most all of the museums were open on Christmas Eve, including the Louvre and the Eiffel Tower is open on Christmas Day. We had no problem finding restaurants either. Sadly, everything was open, but that was great for us hungry tourists. I HIGHLY recommend Rick Steve's Paris 2007 guide. Rick Steve's is the best guide book writer ever.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Mediocre Hotel, But Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: david_k001
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, close proximity to many major Paris attractions and conevenient to Metro. Common areas are comfortable and clean, but the rooms are not. I switched rooms three times for reasons ranging from gnats to dirty bathrooms. As it is, the room I settled for wasn't much better than those I abandoned. The majority of the bathroom floor tiles were cracked, the grout on the bathroom floor was virtually gone, there was flaking paint surrounding the bath ceiling light fixtures, flaking paint above the vanity, and the shower was down right dirty (black crud in the corners and in the grout). The reading light on one side of the bed was hanging by its wires and there was a film of dust on the shelf. Housekeeping is not a priority at this hotel. Given that this hotel went through a recent renovation, it's a shame that it isn't maintained well. In my disgust with my accommodations, I sought out other hotels in the same price range, but sadly have to say that this hotel was the lesser of the evils. I will return to Paris, but I won't return to this hotel. I'll probably have to spend more in order to find a hotel that has better upkeep, but so be it. It's frustrating to spend alot of money and not be happy with one's accommodations. This hotel, in my opinion, really needs to crack down on housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 star experience in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Nick_UK-7
Reviews.Content: We booked the Renaissance Vendome on a Mariott Magic 1-2-3 promotion (stay over the weekend for and get 25% off the second night). Having stayed in Paris before we knew that 4 star quality could be variable, and wholeheartedly enjoyed the Vendome! Location is great, 10 minutes walk from the Opera and five minutes to the Louvre and Tuileries. The hotel resides in a quite street with minimal traffic. We stayed in a deluxe room on the 5th floor and had no noise issues whatsoever. Our friends stayed on the 1st floor and had no complains either. The hotel was recently refurbished. Modern room decor, curtains, bathroom with Bvlgari perfumed shower products, the bed all were exceptional. In fact closer to a 5 star level, not to mention fitness centre with pool in the basement. The size of the room was totally consumed by the enormous (Queen) bed. The room could have been larger, but we have seen much smaller ones as well. The service was typical laid back French and required some getting used to, but overall the stuff was very friendly and trying hard to be helpful - one of the better examples we have seen. Overall, it's no Bristol or George V, but a great 4 star in the heart of le Grande Bulevards and I have no problems recommending it!

Reviews.Title: “Hmm...”
Reviews.Author: JonnyMcMuffinMan!
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Louvre and all that, friendly staff, and nice clean modern facilities, but some complaints: 1) Space: you're paying a lot of money for your room, so you expect a bit of space - well you're not getting any. An estate agent might describe these rooms as "intimate", if you know what I mean. 2) Price: you expect pricey food, drinks, broadband, and all that kind of stuff, but not this pricey, which reminds me - if you do fancy a pint in the Irish pub across the road be aware that they'll charge you a jaw-dropping â‚¬7 a beer. 3) TV: you only get four english language channels (Sky News, CNN International, BBC World and Bloomberg - and really, who cares about Bloomberg!), and half the time we've been here they've either been totally unavailable or subject to cuts in transmission. Dissapointing really: 2 out of 5. I'd recommend the larger suite at the Hotel du Louvre - great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LisaUSA
Reviews.Content: I cannot disagree more with the previous review! It was perfect in every way. The hotel looks exactly the same as the photos. From the minute you arrive, the staff tries to please. They are happy young and professional; they smile. They recommend restaurants, tours, etc. They will clean your room at 6pm when you forget to take the do not disturb sign off your door. The room, while cozy, was not too small. It was spotless. It overlooked a quaint street with an Irish Cafe on the corner. It was not too loud. I was compelled to people watch between 1 and 3 am when jet lag kept me up. One thing I could not figure out was how come the people pouring out of there at that time looked so sober. We got an awesome deal directly from the Renaissance web site (Pure Magic package). I was going to stay at the Ritz or FS, but I just could not part with 1000 bucks a nite. We got a room for 299 E per nite, breakfast included, with the third nite 50% off. The breakfast was delicious. Croissants, pain au chocolate, fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt, etc. We had room service one nite, very expensive (hamburger and fries 21E), food ok, hit the spot. Pool, sauna, steam room and fitness room were top-notch. we used them every day after our touring. They have a library where coffee, tea, etc are available during the day. The location was perfect for us. It is right across the street from the Louve. This hotel has it all!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellerofseniority
Reviews.Content: We were given an "executive room". I can only say this is the smallest room I have ever been given. It was dark, with no views to speak of. I can only assume that this was a broom cupboard which had been converted to a room. The receptionist said that breakfast was not included even though it was. I had to find my booking to show him it was. I could not bear to spend one night in that awful room. Inspite of having paid a package for 3 nights, I had to leave and paid for a room in Le fouquet, which was great. I am extremely surprised about the reviews I read in tripadvisor. I am 62 and have been all over the world. I have never seen such a bad shoddy excuse for a room. There is no way on earth this could be describe as a 5 star hotel. More like the worst 3 star hotel I have seen.

Reviews.Title: “mid week break”
Reviews.Author: owenl
Reviews.Content: Stayed as mid week break. Overall the hotel was great with a very convenient location. Expensive for what you get but balanced against the convenient location. Staff very accommodating apart from one bad experience with a duty manager. The handle of the door to the ladies health suite changing rooms broke leaving guests unable to access the room. The Duty Manageress had no sympathy nor empathy for my wife's inconvenience at waiting in the corridor for ten to fifteen minutes until door was fixed. Small issue maybe but amplified unnecessarily by the fact that it was raised in the requested customer comment sheet filled in before leaving. Noone has got back to us from Marriot with a reponse suggesting the "after break" service is not high on hotel agenda. Spent approx 750 euros over two nights so disappointed at lack of response to our only gripe of the stay. It has made us question whether we use same hotel on another trip to paris next year.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic weekend - Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: bedefelts
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on TripAdvisor and again wasn't disappointed. The rooms were clean and well laid out and had everything one could need. Great location and found ourselves walking to the Louvre and catching the Metro close by. Didn't get to use the hotel bar or restaurant as we ventured out for all of our meals and coffees - let's face it you are spoilt for choice in Paris. A weekend and stay to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Experience!”
Reviews.Author: suze_shoes
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the U.S. last week, sleepy and disoriented and were happy to find out that our room here was ready. It was only 10 am, but we were warmly greeted and taken to a lovely room on the second floor overlooking an internal courtyard. Pluses of this include the lack of street noise, minuses: you have to crane your neck to lookup and check the weather...not a problem, though. The breakfast was included in our rate and was well rounded with eggs, fresh fruit, juices, pastries, coffee, tea and more. The marble bathroom with separate commode, shower, bathtub, wonderfully it makeup mirror and towel warmer was luxurious. Spacious closet and shelving for clothes (they store your suitcases for you). comfortable king size bed with plush pillows and down comforter. Flat screen t.v., excellent lighting. safe for valuables. helpful concierge and staff. this is a first rate hotel and especially good for english speaking guests who want comfort, cleanliness and no-smoking areas (although the lobby and the bar allow smoking). highly recommend this top notch facility! it made our stay a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but first class”
Reviews.Author: SD_Happy_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Our room at this hotel was ridiculously tiny! We barely had any room to turn around. However, all of the hotel amenities were first class! Super comfy bed, flat screen TV, DVD player, beautiful bathroom, nice chocolates in your room every night with the turn-down service, and great toilettries. The hotel staff was super helpful (we worked with them to book dinner reservations EVERY night of our stay, and they never blinked an eye at it). They also helped us locate some unusual things in Paris that we requested. Lobby was beautiful and the attached restaurant (Pinxo) was wonderful (portions were small, but food was wonderful!).

Reviews.Title: “Had a really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mklafter1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. The hotel is located close (walking distance) to the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay and L'Orangerie, which was ideal for us. It is only a 1-2 block walk to the metro. We had a taxi called for us by the concierge for a Sunday morning departure. The taxi arrived exactly on time and there were none of the added charges that we had been warned about. The only thing we didn't like was that the air in the hotel was a little smoky, despite being in a non smoking floor and room. Maybe they need to clean the filters in their system.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Orfila
Reviews.Content: Simply the Best. Awesome location and friendly service. Cleaniest Room.

Reviews.Title: “Great - but tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: richardlondon
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Paris Vendome is a great hotel in a perfect location. Service is highly professional yet discrete. The hotel is extremely well appointed with a contemporary, modern feel. My only negative was the size of the room (I was in #606). It was so tiny that I had to climb over my suitcase to get to the bathroom. The bathroom was also tiny with no bath just a shower. It was fine for one person for one night, but for 2, or any longer than a night I think it would have been claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Marriott Champs Elysee”
Reviews.Author: abenakee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful week at the Vendome. The location is superb and the staff terrific. The rooms are on the small side but very well appointed. We had a problem with the shower in our room and they moved us to another room the next day. The concierge was extremely helpful and the diningroom excellent. We had stayed at the Marriott Champs Elysee and like this hotel better.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Retreat”
Reviews.Author: EllenBM
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with beautiful amenities. Although our room was on the small size, the amazing bed more than made up for it. The bathroom was fresh and modern. The room was very clean. I loved the french doors that opened into the courtyard. You can walk to just about any major attraction in Paris from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UTLonghorn2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Vendome for 4 nights during our first visit to Paris. The location is excellent, within 5-minute walk to all the top attractions and metro station. The hotel is right off Rue de Honore and there are loads of great shops on that street. Everyone working at the hotel was helpful and spoke perfect English. Our room was on the first floor over looking the Diane Von Furstenberg store. The room was very small by American standard, but is very clean and in great shape. The bed was extremely comfortable, furniture very modern, and the room came with two clean and comfy robes. The bathroom was a lot bigger than I expected, the French door provided great natural lighting. The only problem was the shower, as there was no shower curtain and only a very small glass panel as a shield, water leaked everywhere. Housekeeping is excellent, they are fast, efficient, and does an excellent job of changing robes, towels, sheets every day. We had to ask for extra towels for the bathroom floor because of the shower. Housekeeping was very nice about it, probably because we were not the first ones to request that. (I had read reviews on this site and saw others had similar problem with the shower). We had breakfast everyday during our trip at the hotel restaurant. The selection is great, fruit always fresh, loads of pastries, cooked to order eggs/omelets were extremely well prepared, and great selection of coffee/tea. The breakfast really started our day in the right direction. The only downside to our hotel was the construction of several shops on that street outside our window. The noise was extremely loud and started early in the morning. With the construction right under our window, it was impossible to open the great French door we had in the bathroom as it was extremely dusty outside. But that's not the hotel's fault. Overall, this was an excellent hotel in a great location and we enjoyed staying here. It is so comforting to come back to the hotel after a long day of walking and sightseeing and just relax before going out to dinner. The hotel was one of the reasons that we enjoyed our Paris trip so much. It is a bit pricy but you definitely get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ghostie
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this hotel. We arrived off the Eurostar quite early and took a taxi to the hotel, hoping that we could drop off our luggage and then check in later. Even though we were early, the hotel found us a room which was lovely. In addition to the some of the traveller photos, we had a separate walk-in shower. The only downside of the hotel was the restaurant. We came back having walked all over Paris during the day, and just wanted an easy meal without having to set out again. The hotel's restaurant is Japanese style and seemed very stylised, rather than offering the sort of food we wanted. In the end we headed over to Carr's and had a meal there, which was nice, but quite expensive. The other recommendation that we'd make is to bring your fitness and swimming gear. We didn't - but checked out the pool and gym and they looked great. We would definitely bring our stuff with us the next time we visit. The best thing about the hotel is it's location - it's so central and yet very quiet. We loved it and would definitely stay here again. I would reiterate some of the comments about the prices charged by the hotel. We were waiting for a taxi to go back to Gare du Nord and ordered two coffees in the lobby - this came to about 25 euro, which I thought was excessive. There's so much to see and do in Paris that we didn't spend enough time in the hotel, but it's a great base to have for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: Top-notch-Tastes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on our first trip to Paris. We are quite picky with our choices and were very pleased with this hotel. Admitted Trip Advisor junkies, we read all the reviews of this hotel and others in Paris before booking our trip. Our big "musts": cleanliness, location, ambiance, and as close to 5 star quality as possible. CLEANLINESS: This hotel was immaculate! Not one complaint. Everything looked and smelled new. The room and bathroom were spotless. LOCATION: tucked just one tiny block off of the Tuilleries Garden entrance on a super quiet street. The Tuilleries Metro stop is maybe a 3 minute walk from the hotel. There are a few bus stops along this route too. There is a small Irish pub just outside, great atmosphere. If you want to be in walking distance of the Louvre, Musee Oâ€™rsay, Tuilleries Garden, Place de la Concorde, shopping and your choice of small cafes, this hotel is perfect. AMBIANCE: my husband and I dislike fussy and overly ornate dÃ©cor. The hotel is beautiful with classic, clean lined furniture and decorations. Not too modern and perfectly comfortable. Huge, ever-changing, flower arrangements add to the elegant feel of the lobby. This small hotel is quiet and pleasant to return to after long days of site seeing. My husband and I rank this hotel with 5 stars. We were treated well, by English speaking staff and had absolutely no issues with this property. We did not utilize the facilities in the hotel. Once we were up, we were out the door and then back after darkâ€¦so much to see and do in Paris! Our room was small as most rooms in Europe are. The bed and linens were superior and comfy. Room service food was delicious and quick. I have several photos of hotel, but the .jpeg sizes are too large to upload to this website...too bad. When we return to Paris this hotel will definitely be our first choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: CLHughes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance for 1 night, August 29th on our return trip from a Danube River Cruise. The location is perfect-near many major museums, shops, restaurants, and public transportation. The hotel, while part of the Renaissance chain, is more like a boutique hotel. Great attention has been paid to small details that make you stay even more enjoyable- Down comforters, fluffy pillows, flat screen TV& Bvulgari toiletries. The room (a standard),while small, was beautifully appointed and imaculately clean. A floor to ceiling window opened to the street below,but never was any traffic or pedestrian noise heard. The stafff was very pleasant and extremely helpful. Once we checked in, we were always greeted by name. Did not use the restaurant, but menu was quite expensive. Gorgeous bar at Lobby level. Will definately stay here again-this is our new Paris home!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Plaza Vendome (marriot hotel group), Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: parny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Plaza Vendome for 2 nights. The staff are friendly and very helpful, excellant concierge service. The room was very clean, though small, very modern with LCD tv with cd player. The bed was one of the most comforable we've ever had and each night you will find a chocolate with the turn down service. There were lovely Bvlgari toiletries to use. The view from our room was of a courtyard, however it was quiet. The fitness suite and spa was very well appointed. Breakfast was fine, fresh fruit, choice of how you wanted your eggs cooked, hot and cold meats and cheeses, yoghurts, juices and breads. The hotel did lack the wow factor when you walk into the lobby, but this does not take away the excellant location to the louvre and jardin des Tuileries which is a couple of minutes walk away, as is the Tuileries metro stop. Taxi to hotel from airport was 40 euros including tip, however the metro would cost 9 euros each but not ideal if you are carrying alot of luggage or are travelling at rush hour times. Overall excellant hotel, excellant location

Reviews.Title: “Where are the facilities ?”
Reviews.Author: bdaria
Reviews.Content: Once gone. Never again. Beautiful location but a lot of little problems transformed our staying in a bad experience. A closed restaurant in august was not very apprecciated. We payed 516 US dollar for a room when the rack rate was 460 dollars. That's all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: zulan78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and were nicely surprised how nice the hotel is. I found the receptionists to be very helpful and professional. On arrival our receptionist informed us at check-in that as a honeymoon couple they were giving us a free bottle of champagne and free breakfast during our stay. Our room was on the 5th floor and had a king size bed. Unfortunately the matress was a bit too soft so I had back aches during the last few days of our stay. The bathroom was very nice with a seperate shower, bathtub, and toilet room. Our room had a nice flat screen television and there is a refrigerator big enough to stuff our own bottle of water. We used the safe and found it to be useful to store our valuables. The breakfast is definitely worth the visit as it was buffet style and closes at 10:30am. We enjoyed our breakfast thoroughly every morning and ordered room service if we missed it while room service for breakfast ends at noon. The hotel is very close to all the attractions and the Metro is only a few blocks away. I would highly recommend staying. Our flight was to leave late on our last day, so the receptionist said they would allow us to keep our room for longer if the hotel was not booked to capacity. Unfortunately it was but they were more than willing to store our luggage until we left. The swimming pool was nice and quite big and the sauna couldn't have been hotter. Definitely worth another visit.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite !!!”
Reviews.Author: TXBrowns
Reviews.Content: The location is awesome! You can walk everywhere. The hotel was clean, cool, and pleasant. Staff was very friendly and helpful. If you are going to the eiffel tower, I suggest going around 9:30 PM, bring french wine/cheese, blanket to sit on. The tower is lite, but at 10:00 sparkling lights rapidly move around the tower. It is very beautiful. A little bit of a walk from the hotel, but a great break from museums and tours. Museum passes are the way to go. You avoid lines and they give you the opportunity to visit museums you may not have considered going to. Don't miss Rodin's "The Thinker" a small museum, not too far from the D'Orsy. Don't forget Student IDs. They will ask for them.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.... but....”
Reviews.Author: RusNewton
Reviews.Content: I took my family and parents to Renaissance Paris Vendome for a week. We had three rooms. The hotel is very nice, the staff were friendly and accommodating but I came away feeling "nice, but.." when I compare it with stays at other five-star hotels. On the "nice" side were the gym and swimming pool, both of which appeared very new, were not at all crowded (in fact most of the time we were the only ones in the pool which was lovely), with decent locker-rooms and showers. Flat-panels in all the rooms, and DVD players (but no evidence of a menu of DVDs to borrow although I didn't look that hard because we were out all the time so we didn't need in-room entertainment). Beds were very comfortable, with a very nice "topper" on the matress which is not that common but gives a luxury feel. On the "but" side: 1. We asked for interconnecting rooms so my kids (aged 6 & 8) could have their own room but get to us easily. We were initially given rooms separated by two other rooms - when we complained, we were moved to adjoining but not interconnecting rooms after one night. Not the end of the world, but even so annoying. 2. The bath robes were regularly removed from the room and not replaced, which was a bit annoying given we didn't have interconnecting rooms so if the kids wanted us in the middle of the night it is kind of handy to have a robe to put on when you step into the corridor. We asked repeatedly and eventually got robes but again, annoying to have to ask. 3. The one and only PC with internet connection in the lobby was out of action for our entire stay 4. One of the two lifts was out of action for most of our stay, meaning some competition with the bell-boys for elevator space 5. We asked for a taxi to collect us from Gare du Nord so we didn't have to sweat in line after a 3 hour train ride. This is a ten euro trip, but the hotel wanted me to pay 120 euro for their driver to collect us. I consider that an insult when the total budget for the week was already close to ten thousand euro. 6. Similarly, babysitting at 30 euro an hour plus 30 euros for taxi home is a rip-off: even the Biltmore in Miami which is a very expensive hotel, offers better value babysitting than that. 7. Breakfast was very expensive and they didn't seem to offer any reduction for children: both Le Meridien and Four Seasons typically offer children much cheaper breakfast than 29 euro. So, we had a nice week but it could have been just that little bit better -- and when you book five star, you expect the best, not second best.

Reviews.Title: “The Renaissance was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: jrgebbia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from 2 weeks in Europe and spent 8 days at the Renaissance. Outstanding location--3 blocks from the Louvre. There were many restaurants and cafes nearby. The hotel staff could not do enough for us! Rooms were wonderful and good sized for Europe. Would definitely recommend and wouldn't stay anywhere else on the next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel with good central location”
Reviews.Author: Nutty_663rd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel. We stayed in a prestige room, for which we paid 380 Euros a night, with breakfast included. The Room ------------ We were initially located room 101 overlooking the street, but because we and they couldn't get into the room safe, we were immediately transferred to room 314, overlooking the central courtyard. The rooms weren't as small as I was expecting given some of the comments in the reviews I'd read before flying out to France, although talking to the receptionists, they did say that some of the prestige rooms were smaller than the others. Room 314 was slightly smaller than room 101, but it had the advantage of a separate shower and bathtub, which room 101 didn't have. Rooms are well appointed, with an LCD style TV, DVD player, "King sized" bed, air conditioning, well stocked minibar, iron, good bathroom (but as reported before with frosted glass doors so not maximum privacy) and robes/slippers. The bed was very comfortable as was the bedding, with plenty of pillows. However be aware that in both prestige rooms we saw the King sized beds are in fact 2 single beds with single mattresses pushed together, so not a true King bed. Overall though we liked the room and it was perfect for our needs. I think they're better geared towards tourists than business travellers as the desk was small, but in future we'll choose a smaller room because we don't think, for the little time we spent in our room, that it was worth 380 Euros a night. A few grumbles about the room before I move on .... 1.) The new safe was on the top shelf in a cupboard, and therefore we couldn't see into it without standing on a chair. Clearly roomkeeping hadn't done this either as there were 2 whisky bottles on top of the safe. 2.) Excessive prices of minibar drinks: 6 Euros for a coke. It's pure greed. If my airline can charge me less than 1 Euro for a coke and make a profit, I don't expect a hotel to keep on this sort of nonsense. We therefore spent no money in the hotel on drinks, although I would have quite happily settled into a few cocktails each evening if I didn't feel that I was being ripped off. After all at 360 Euros a night, something we thought was somewhat excessive for the room size, the hotel could and should be generating a great deal of goodwill by offering drinks to hotel guests at much much cheaper rates. 3.) DVD rental. The LCD TV system doesn't offer movies so the hotel offers DVDs for hire for 10 Euros. I think all hotels could generate a great deal of goodwill if they dropped this stupid nonsense of overcharging for in-room movies. The Staff ----------- The staff were all excellent, spoke English well, and were a pleasure to deal with. The Breakfast ----------------- We choser to have our included breakfast in our room, for which there is no additional charge, although you're limited to choosing from the continental menu. So it's the usual selection of French pastries, cereals, and fresh fruit salad, which suited us well. However with the location of many cafes and restaurants in the surrounding area, in the future we'd choose to have breakfast away from the hotel. We can't comment on the breakfast in the restaurant as we didn't eat in there. The Pool and Gym --------------------- Ok well I don't do gyms, but there were about 8 or so pieces of high end equipment. The pool was excellent - small, but usable to exercise in and cool off. The pool has two adjustable underwater jets for those of us who like to exercise against a current. Wonderful! A very classy pool with slate and wooden surroundings. Note that whilst you can turn the jets on or off, they can be very powerful, and so children shouldn't be allowed to use them without supervision. As well as the pool and gym, there's a boiling steam room (the hottest I've ever experienced) and a sauna, plus shower. Location ---------- I agree with everything that everyone else has said about this hotel's location. A quiet street, in a lovely area of Paris, within a short walking distance to great shopping, sight seeing and famous landmarks. This is a perfect part of Paris to stay in. Would we return? --------------------- Probably, if we could get a better rate. For my money, the hotel's location, and the ability to have a swim at the end of a day's walking and shopping, are what will bring me back to this hotel, but as a said, so long as we can secure a better rate!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: AureliaTraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to France. While in Paris, we stayed at the Renaissance Place Vendome. We had two stays at the hotel, one night before leaving for Provence, and five nights while we explored Paris. We booked a prestige room for the one night stay, and a quality room for the five night stay. The only difference between the two was a little more space, a king sized bed vs a queen sized bed, and a separate tub and shower in the bathroom for the prestige room. Our breakfast at PINXO (the hotel's restuarant) was included for three days. The breakfast is a buffet, and the staff will fix eggs for you, plus bring you coffee, hot chocolate, etc. The buffet consists of cereals, breads, and hams. When breakfast wasn't included, we ate elsewhere. The location is excellent - you are in walking distance of the Louvre, the Orsay, the Place de Concorde and you are in the elite shopping district of Paris. There are plenty of ATMs, restaurants, the Tuilleries Metro stop, and Batobus stop close by. The only downside to the Renaissance is if you want a beautiful view from your room, it isn't available. The hotel is located on a side street. The hotel is very modern and well maintained. We had a very enjoyable and comfortable stay. The staff is very friendly and everyone speaks English. Whatever our request, it was promptly taken care of. I would definately stay at the Renaissance Place Vendome again if I ever return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have recently returned from a very enjoyable weekend in Paris where we stayed at the Renaissance Paris Vendome. The hotel is located in an excellent position about 5 minutes walk from both the Louvre and the luxury shops of Place Vendome. It is a very well furnished hotel, with comfortable beds and it even has Bvlgari toiletteries in the bathroom! The staff were helpful and polite and my only negative comment would be that the rooms although described as deluxe were rather small for the money. It is worthwhile trying to find a discounted rate (Renaissance is part of the Marriott group of hotels) and we found an offer for two nights accomodation and return eurostar tickets from London for about Â£300 each (try the hotel link on the eurostar website) where as the advertised rate for the room was 360 euros per night with eurostar being another Â£300 each return. Overall we would be very happy to return to the Renaissance next time we are in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay, close to everything!!”
Reviews.Author: yasilis
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel while searching tripadvisor. We are very happy we choose this hotel. Spent 4 days during easter and it has a great location, great service, nice rooms and very clean. Rooms are spacious but small closet, Beds are comfortable. Everthing is a few minutes walk; the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, shopping, Metro stations. We recommend any time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in This hotel from 13 to 19 April 2006. Location is excellent. Rooms very very clean. Prestige rooms are big enough for couple. Separate shower and bath. Breakfast is good,clean...but selection could be better. General service and attitude of the hotel employers is excellent. This is very important since attitude and customer service in France is 0 from 1 to 10 range... And that is the biggest issue in France.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel but the marketing is skewed”
Reviews.Author: slickoperator
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. It's a modern, recently designed and built establishment in an excellent, central location. You're within 10 minutes' walk of the Louvre and just 15 minutes of the Opera. From that point of view it could hardly be bettered. The service is second to none and the breakfasts are very good. I think breakfast is probably very expensive even by Paris standards, so if you want to save money, you should know that within a few minutes' walk of the hotel there are some very pleasant cafes on the Rue de Rivoli. I booked on the internet and upgraded my booking because I wanted to give my wife a treat. I have to say that I was disappointed on several counts: 1. When I arrived the staff appeared unaware of the upgrade or what it entailed; 2. The upgrade was supposed to give me a bottle of champagne on arrival, but it was not to be had until asked for; 3. The room was small. I think this was the biggest disappointment. If they offer an upgrade for couples I think that the room ought to be a priority - but it was so small that my wife and I had to negotiate verbally before getting out of the bed because there was so little room. The bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom. Furthermore, I'm not pleased that the first thing they said to me when I checked in was that I could upgrade my room for 80 euros. Well, if you've already upgraded your booking, why should you have to upgrade again if you want a decent-sized room? So on balance, this is a very good hotel, but their marketing is, I think, annoyingly skewed. Either you upgrade, and you upgrade properly, getting a decent room, or you don't. It's as simple as that. But to have several layers of upgrade, none of them understood by the staff, seems to me crazy.

Reviews.Title: “great location, small room”
Reviews.Author: First_Wandering_Brit
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights over Easter. The location of the hotel is superb- the major sights are a short walk. The Metro is also very close. Service was good. The rooms are well designed but very small. Bed was very comfortable. We ate at Pinxos one evening and the food was excellent (though the ambience was a little cold). Despite the small room, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance Vendome - best location!”
Reviews.Author: CJK50
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night stay. The hotel location is excellent - just a few minutes walk to Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, shopping, Metro stations. Rooms and bathrooms spacious; we had adjoining rooms for family of 4. Staff were most helpful in every way. No complaints. This was our second trip to Paris, and the location was biggest factor in our choice of this hotel. We walked to Notre Dame, Centre Pompidou, etc. Recommend this for all!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One of the best Marriott hotels around. Great location (practically next to the Louvre). Classy but they were a bit snotty at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Low Key”
Reviews.Author: ClannParis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a short break. This is a very pleasant hotel situated in a really convenient location for most tourists (near cultural sites, high fashion shops, high street stores, cafes reataurants etc). The decor is in a low key tasteful comfortable modern style. It does lack any wow factor however. We also found the rooms to be small considering the costs. Overall I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: COhotelcritic
Reviews.Content: After much research, we chose to stay and this hotel, despite the much larger price than we usually pay for hotel rooms. This was our first trip to Paris and we were very relieved to have an entire English speaking staff, including maids. I am certainly very picky and critical about hotels. Amazingly, I can't think of anything to complain about! We stayed here 4 nights in Feb and were surprisingly upgraded to a room with a king size bed and 2 separate bathrooms (one with toilet, one with shower). As we stayed over Valentine's Day, there was an issue before hand to ensure the availabilty of a non-smoking room. We called the day before and, indeed, our room was non-smoking. We had a courtyard view and didn't hear a single thing at night. I'm not sure if the hotel was just empty or not, but it was a peaceful visit. The bedding is quite comfortable and new. It is great to be in a new hotel in Europe.... so rare! All the bathrooms are modern but classy. Heated towel rack, Blvgari soaps, and 3 euro chocolates on your pillow every night all are nice touches. I read many complaints about the shower and it leaking on the floor. It did a bit, but you just have to be aware of it. We did not use the work out room or pool, but they look extremely kept up and luxurious. The photos already posted on this site are extremely accurate. The location is great. It is 3 blocks off the yellow line at the Tuleries stop. This stop is next to the gardens, which are a steps from the Louvre and just across the river from Musee d Orsay. It is also 2 or 3 blocks from Place Vendome, which means it is surrounded by many fancy shops (Gucci, ect). There is an ATM about a block away and an overpriced small grocery store 2 blocks away. I will surely stay at this hotel on my next trip to Paris and would recommend it to all. I doubt that the rates are nearly as good during tourist season (we paid 280 euros/night) or that I'll get such a great upgrade next time, but it still ensures a comfortable visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: holiday-anyday
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor hotel reviews were so helpful in finding accommodations, I have to give back. I booked this hotel for 8 nights in February 2006, based on the reviews in this website. It did not disappoint. My husband and I stayed in a Deluxe room on the sixth floor, overlooking the small courtyard. We did not have any problems with the ceiling height - it was a uniform height throughout. The room was quiet, and very dark when the shades were closed, just as we like it. We were surprised to learn that internet access is not free, but when we informed the front desk that our reservations indicated it was included, they waived the charges. The location is in a pricey, higher-end section of Paris, but conveniently located. The concierge was very helpful making restaurant reservations before and during our stay. Since the restaurants were ones I requested, I did not have the opportunity to try any that the concierge may recommend. My husband's luggage was "delayed" for 2 days en-route from Italy, and the concierge helped track its status and ensure it was delivered to our room. We used the pool and sauna 3 times, and it was a relaxing way to end the day. Complaints are minor: we did not get turn-down service one night. Drinking water was only provided in the room the day we checked in. The sauna was not turned on one time, and we had to go to the front desk to fetch someone to turn it on (which was controlled in a locked cabinet next to the sauna), and it took so long to heat up that we did not stay. We did not try breakfast at the hotel, although we did enjoy a nice cup of coffee one morning. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully comfortable and elegant!”
Reviews.Author: GreenMermaid
Reviews.Content: It's great staying at a recently renovated hotel where everything is brand new! We used Marriott points for 5 of our 6 nights stay and were upgraded to a prestige room for no extra charge. The difference of the prestige room may have been the bathroom, which had a glass pocket door to save space, and shower stall separate from bathtub. Did not experience any problems with shower leakage as described in some other reviews. Heated towel rack was great for drying out damp clothes! We were on the 5th floor, where the walls start to slant in a bit, but the space was roomy enough to make this a non-issue. Only one window that looked onto a courtyard -- across was an office building, so we kept our curtains closed most of the time. That was OK, since the thick fabric kept the heat in too (February is pretty cold). Hotel staff used discreet separate entrances/elevators from guests â€“ they were invisible most of the time, and we felt like we had the hotel to ourselves. I wore the provided robe and slippers to take the elevator directly down to the basement spa area. The pool, though heated, was still a bit chilly for us Floridians, but the space was gorgeous -- balmy air and relaxing meditative music piped in. The icy cold foot pool which you must step into as you enter the pool area is kind of weird. We used the steam room with the starry ceiling, the sauna and the huge showers down in the spa and always had the place to ourselves. There are some exercise machines (treadmills, etc.) that looked nice, but who needs these when you're climbing all those stairs in the metro? The staff was wonderful -- friendly and ready with a "Bonjour Madame" or "Bonsoir Monsieur". Staff supplied us with a power converter, and if there was anything we needed in the rooms that maid service had forgotten, it was cheerfully supplied to us "tout de suite"! We ate dinner once at Pinxo, the Michelin-rated restaurant adjoining the hotel. The meals are tapas portions. Even though it was creative, juxtaposing unusual ingredients, I still wasn't sure what I was eating even though our menu was in English. The only thing that was clear was the pricey bill at the end -- and that we were still hungry. We preferred the places with typical hearty French cooking, and enjoyed those with prix fixe menus. The concierge gave us recommendations (& made our reservations) to wonderful bistros in all areas of the city that were (at our request) reasonably priced. There is a coffee/cappuccino/hot chocolate machine just off the lobby that makes a delicious hot beverage with frothy milk! No need to have coffee maker in room. Hotel is in a great area on Right Bank -- near shops on Rue de Rivoli and close to Louvre and the Seine. Perfect location for our exploration of Paris, and a relaxing place to come back to after a rigorous day of walking and sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for Paris - love it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After lots of research for hotels - decided to go for this hotel - and its didn't disappoint. The location is excellent - very central. It is modern but cosy, the staff bend over backwards to help. we asked them to recommend restaurants, cafes etc - and they came up trumps with ideas. Its not a pretentious place, eg the staff take your bags but dont expect tips every two seconds. The rooms are a good size, and hasv excellent sound proofing (from street noise), very clean marble bathrooms and comfy beds. The spa has a lovely pool, with underwater lighting, a sky light and slate tiling. There's also a steam room and sauna. I fyour looking for a relaxing weekend, then stay here, I promise you won't be unhappy! (and i'm not being paid to write this!)

Reviews.Title: “Love it Evrytime”
Reviews.Author: TareksLondon
Reviews.Content: I have styed in this hotel twice now and i found the service excellent. my first stay i must admit was somewhat disappointing as i booked a executive room and they only had superior however after speaking to the manager and expedia managed to get a suite for my next visit and the service was vastly improved. Quite street good location and overall a great stay highly recommend!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay on the 6th Floor!”
Reviews.Author: Wootie
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Vendome is a lovely hotel in an excellent location. Everything was top notch. My only issue is that we were placed on the top floor. Because of the roofline, the walls slant into the room. It was impossible for two people. One of us had to lie on the bed to let the other one by. Tiny, tiny, tiny. Smaller than ANY hotel room in Paris or anywhere else I have ever stayed in. The bath was miniscule as well. I could not use the hairdryer with the door open--there wasn't enough room. If either of us had been overwieght, we would not have been able to squeeze into the narrow space for the toilet. Needless to say, we did not get the king sized bed we were promised. The people are lovely and attentive, but word to the wise--don't let them put you on the 6th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ophelia89
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable and quiet location. The front desk staff were polite and helpful. The room was clean and pretty good sized by Paris standards. The only complaint I would have is that the one day I forgot to leave a tip for the maid, she threw all of our loose clothes into a rumpled pile on the floor, which resulted in some wrinkled, dirty clothes. We were afraid not to tip after that!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel - we traveled as a family, meeting in Paris to start off the trip - and what a wonderful way to begin! The hotel was beautiful, clean, centrally located and had staff that were very helpful! We took a chance, booking it off of the recommendation of the tripadvisor site - and we were so glad we paid attention - it was phenomenal! We'd only stay at this hotel - what an experience!

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for business travel”
Reviews.Author: NorthernSpy
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights from 11/30 to 12/4 in a "prestige room" which means you have the option of a king bed. Room faced the inner courtyard/atrium and was very quiet except occasional ka-thumping of other rooms' doors. Bathroom was split with toilet and sink in one small room and at the other end of bedroom, larger area with full tub and vanity. I enjoyed the room and decor very much but this design element was somewhat inconvenient for me. In looking at the floorplan, it appears that most of the rooms are not designed like this. Room was kept spotless during my stay. Staff was helpful without being intrusive. Did not have a chance to sample the pool or spa facilities - maybe next time. I needed internet service and booked this hotel for that reason - service in the room is 19.95 Euros per day- that's not inexpensive and not for the casual user. Did not have a chance to try the wireless in the lobby so I don't know how much that costs. What I used worked flawlessly. Location is excellent for business and sightseeing. I did not have a chance to sample the breakfast but assume something more substantial and less expensive can be easily found nearby. I did have dinner at Pinxo and it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: DMM64
Reviews.Content: I'll add my two cents by agreeing with the very positive reviews of this hotel. It's in an excellent location on a quiet street, although I don't think any room has a view to speak of. It was a very easy walk to the Louvre and the Opera area. The Tuilieries metro station is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. My room was on the third floor overlooking rue Mont Thabor and the Irish pub across the street. The room was modern and of average but adequate size (it was substantially larger than a room in London I stayed in for the same price). The bathroom was on the small side, and I agree with other reviewers regarding the shower spraying water all over. I didn't think it was a big deal though. I loved the pool, etc. and got into a routine of using the pool, sauna and steam room after sightseeing and before dinner and evening activities ... it was so relaxing. I found the staff to be competent if a little distant (perhaps it was my rusty French). I paid Euro 295 per night, and I thought it was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “exquisite hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Exquisite hotel. Perfect location. Friendly and very helpful staff. Pool is a real plus. Shower doesn't leak if you make it quick (how much time does it take to wash your hair anyway?). Quiet location. For breakfast there are neighborhood markets, cafes and patissieres 2-3 blocks away on the Rue Saint-Honore plus coffee and tea in the lobby. Would never consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and stean room but ....!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the back of comment from this site and I highly recommend it. The hotel has a great contemporary feel, large rooms, a wonderful bar and the perfect location. The bar mixes a great cocktail with wonderful nibbles. The pool and steam room are a great asset of this hotel. Wooden panel and black slate floor. I spent time at the start and end of the day relaxing on the loungers and warming up in the steam room. However, on my first trip to the pool I slipped in the foot pool and badly injured my shin and staved my big toe. So watch out!!! When I mentioned this to the reception staff they were a little disinterested. Despite my slip this is a top hotel, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable and friendly, but rather plain and dull”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you arrive at the Renaissance Paris Vendome by taxi your driver might have some difficultly finding it; the hotel is tucked away in a small dark back street a block away from the Tuileries. Even the hotel signs are not illuminated, and when I arrived (after eleven) there was no-one at the small entrance. The lobby is no more imposing: it is relatively small and unassuming, although the dark hardwood and stone looks expensive. Still no porter after check-in, but the lift was 5 yards away so I carried my bags to the room with no trouble. I found the room moderately sized; the king bed dominated it, leaving little free floor space. Two built-in wardrobes gave plenty of room and I was pleased to see an iron and ironing board as standard, and off course the two sumptuous dressing gowns neatly folded. The desk had a light and a broadband connection; however the business traveller might find it a little small. Room enough for a laptop and a couple of sheets of paper, but not much more. The hotel must have blessed the invention of the flat screen TV hanging on the wall, because it is hard to see where a decent sized standard set would have gone. The bathroom was somewhat more generously sized. It had both a shower and bath, with separate toilet compartment and was nicely finished in marble, smoked glass and chrome, and spotlessly clean. The shower door seal leaked though (as other reviewers have pointed out) and mopping up after became a daily ritual for us. A worse problem though was to come: before settling down for the night we switched the a/c off to cut out the slight hum that appeared to be coming from it. Strangely, the hum continued. After a bit of investigation we discovered that the main fans for the hotel a/c were situated directly above our room. The noise was not that loud, but it was a bit like being on a George Lucas set with the constant low rumble of a star-destroyer main drive engine in the background. For the real noise though, we could open the room window â€“ now we get a noise of Ridley Scott proportions from the huge metal cooling duct that runs up the side of the hotel. Admittedly, we did not have much reason to open the window - the view was of a tiny courtyard. In the end though, it was not these things that put me off the hotel. The main disappointment was that the whole place was just too uninspiring. Some people write that it is a â€œhome from homeâ€�. Well, if I am paying a monthâ€™s mortgage for three days in a room a third of the size of my apartment, I donâ€™t want to feel at home. I want something a bit swanky. I want guys with hats on the door, a big flashy atrium and some furniture that once belonged to Louis the umpteenth. This is Paris after all, and I want to see something of the glory of France in my hotel. And in case you think this canâ€™t be found, you need only wander around the corner to see the hotels nearby to see what I mean. Of course, there is the Maurice and the Crillon, for which you will pay more, but you can also find a few grand four stars that look pretty impressive. So, in the end I have to mark this hotel down. True, the staff could not have been friendlier. The spar was nice; I loved the black slate steam room and it is one of the few Paris hotels with a pool (though it is small). But I have to knock a small point off the problems in the room, and a big point off for being too plain, downright dull. A business traveller might find this OK, but if you are going to Paris for that once in a life-time trip, do yourself a favour and splash out a bit extra for a real five star, or save the cash and get a nice four star room with a decent view. Oh - and if you have booked it and your taxi driver asks where this hotel is, tell him itâ€™s behind the Maurice.

Reviews.Title: “all perfect except breakfast”
Reviews.Author: cecilette
Reviews.Content: an amazing hotel no doubt one of the best in Paris. No better location. The check-in is fast and easy, the staff are great. The pool/spa is fantastic (millions of soft clean towels, and relaxing sofas, large showers with complimentary Bulgary gel shower!). The rooms are great, clean, comfy and quiet. But the breakfast, oh My, what a disappointment, avoid! What a rip off. The service is very slow and disorganised, the buffet is extremely poor and the atmosphere is cold. We stayed in room 508, which was great. It is a prestige room with a balcony/terrace. I had a look at another smaller room and it looked lovely too. Shame they don't do ice cube and tea/coffee thing in the room. but hey, you are in Paris, you have to enjoy outside too! I recommend this hotel warmly and will stay again whenever I can!

Reviews.Title: “Utterly comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: cheeseburger23
Reviews.Content: We absolutely, hands-down loved this hotel. My husband and I stayed there for a week and a half in September 2005 and can't imagine liking a place better. We enjoy hotels that are high quality, classy, but comfortable and personal. This fit the bill perfectly. Location: If you are touring Paris, the vacation is very central. Right across from the Tuileries, Tuilieries metro stop (on a very central, convenient line), a block from the Louvre, the most wonderful boutiques and shopping right around the corner, restaurants, groceries and cafes everywhere, and yet the hotel is tucked into a side street so it is perfectly quiet. Somebody wrote a review that said there was nowhere to get food nearby. A half a dozen cafes with coffee, croissants, soda, and groceries weren't 20 paces away - they must not have explored thoroughly. Room: We stayed on the 1st floor in room 109. Our room was beautifully decorated with a very contemporary look. The furnishings seemed brand new. A little small, but had ample closet space so once we were unpacked, we had no trouble. We loved to cuddle in bed after a long day of touring and watch our flat screen tv. The bed was a comfy queen. Room was additionally furnished with a desk, desk chair, coffee table and arm chair. We had a bright beautiful window we could open during the day, but we didn't because the weather was around 85 degrees and we wanted to keep the awesome air conditioning running. Room was always flawlessly clean when we arrived back from touring during the day. The bathroom was the only difficulty we experienced, but we were prepared from the other reviews we had. The half glass panel in the shower guarantees a little leakage, but it was easily controlled with spare towels. The bathroom had plenty of counter space and was furnished with robes, a hair dryer, makeup mirror, etc. Toiletries were very nice and yummy smelling. Mini-bar in the room was well-stocked but ridiculously expensive (6 euros for a coke?) There was extra room in the fridge we filled with cheap water and coke from around the corner. The hotel staff didn't seem to mind. Food: We enjoyed room service two evenings which was fast by US standards (15 minutes or less), and ate one night at Pinxo. Food was very high quality and orders were always well understood, including special requests. Many other fantastic restaurants nearby. Spa & Pool: We took advantage of the wonderful spa and pool facilities while we were there, which were very unique for a European hotel. The pool was just as beautiful as it was in the pictures with lots of comfy seats for lounging. The workout room is small but functional, and we both had great massages in the spa area. Language: Everyone we met at the hotel: concierge, room service, spa workers, even cleaning staff had some command of English. While we made our polite efforts in broken French, they had no problem switching to English to help us out. Room would be great for couples, and maybe families who want to take advantage of the pool. We genuinely felt like this hotel was home, and were quite sad to leave its comfortable accomodations. We believe that you'll feel the same!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel; very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel a couple of weeks ago on our trip through Europe in Aug 2005. Overall, this is an excellent place to stay while visiting such a beautiful city. PROS: (1) location is perfect - you are close to everything, but the street is whisper quiet; (2) the staff were all VERY helpful; (3) the pool and gym are excellent by European standards; (4) the bathrooms are excellent. CONS: (1) The rooms are small, but as you'd expect for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home !”
Reviews.Author: Irish_JC
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked the St Lazare hotel,but based on reviews of the Vendome and guidebooks' comments on the safety around the St Lazare area I decided to change and am so happy I did. This is my 2nd stay in Paris and I am by no means a hotel snob - my normal 3 decision making requirements are - location,safety and quiet. The hotel scores well in all areas. Pros - Location - walking distance from all the sights (except sacre coueur). Perfectly positioned on a quiet side street means you don't hear traffic.(I am a light sleeper so this is a big point for me!) Rooms - big by paris standards. Very well laid out - everything looks and feels new and high quality from the bed to the linen to the desk. LCD tv and dvd player is also great when you get bored of the only 2 english news channels. Bulgari toiletries a nice treat. Bathrooms are nice and big. Broadband access included.bath robes and slippers handy for the pool. Amenities - Pool,sauna,steam room are fantastic after long walks. I only used them one night but we had the pool to ourselves....very nice Staff - Very helpful and pleasant. I didn't bother them too much except for the bill - more on that later. But as others have mentioned they make you feel extremely welcome and I think are the real icing on the cake for this hotel. Bad staff can leave a sour taste in a nice hotel but these guys were great ! Cons- location - if you need a quick fix of fruit or bottled water etc,it's quite a walk to find the nearest market. so shop when you're out in the day! the bathroom cannot be kept dry as mentioned previously...annoying maybe,but didn't bother me too much pool/sauna closes at 10pm...found we were out till that time most nights so would've liked to use it when we came back a couple of other oddities - I received a call from front desk at 7.30am one morning..when I answered they said "sorry" and hung up.... 2 bottles of beer appeared on the bill which I didn't have - only thing i can guess is by looking in the minibar they may be scanned and added automatically? the safe was advertised as "laptop size" but in reality it holds passports and maybe a camera. One reason I enjoyed this hotel so much was that I felt I got a bargain...The rack rate was 269eur but after booking I noticed expedia were offering it at 249. Marriott have a policy of "best price" which means if you find it cheaper than their site they give you a rate of the lower along with a 25% discount....so my rate was actually 182eur. Front desk hadn't been informed by bookings office,but once I was able to produce the email they were more than happy to oblige. I didn't use restaurant/bar so can't comment. One last recommendation for paris from me is use the Batobus !! 16eur for a 5 day pass - basically a boat along the seine with about 8 stops - hop on,hop off - all the major ones...by far the easiest way to go from champs elysees to eiffel, or eiffel to notre dame - and a great view along the way. the metro means walking,changing lines,not a nice view....boat is superb...runs till 10pm too so you can view the sights at night. only wish i'd discovered it at the beginning of my weekend ! I would definitely stay here again - great hotel,location,staff and I would recommend it. you'll feel a little pampered in this home away from home. Deserving of it's high place in ta's customer satisfaction,but it doesn't have the frills of say the beverly hills hotel so I wonder are the people using 5* hotels just more critical?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place - but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: ooookch
Reviews.Content: There's a lot of good things to say about this hotel, but there are also some downsides. The location is just great, especially if you're into art as Musee d'Orsay and the Louvre are within easy walking distance. The hotel is perfectly styled and has a very nice ambiance, I felt at home immediately. It is also rather quiet, as it is on a back street of the very busy Rue de Rivoli. The room (I had a 'Prestige' room) was not very big, but I loved the extremely comfortable bed, the style and the flatscreen tv. The bathroom however is a typical case of 'design over function', which starts with the doors (which aren't really doors); and as other reviewers mentioned, it is impossible to take a shower without flooding the room. The Bulgari toiletries on the other side are wonderful. Housekeeping was not very good: the room was not ready when I arrived at 5pm and was also made late the next day, the mini bar didn't get refilled, a drinking glass was not cleaned, they knocked at the door once despite the 'do not disturb' sign; all nothing severe but it's not nut truly five star standard. The turndown service however was lovely. The Pool and Hamam are fabulous features after a long day of walking around in Paris, and again with great design. I liked the small but cozy bar. The restaurant is a bit expensive but very good with creative, quite light food. I enjoyed sitting at the marble bar where you can watch the cooks preparing the meals. Breakfast however is hopelessly overprized for the variety and quality of the food offered. I don't mind paying 29 Euro for a breakfast buffet, but for that money I expect more. Go to the Meurice nearby if you want to spend money for breakfast, else there are enough French cafes around to start the day. In addition, staff in the restaurant at breakfast wasn't overly polite and sometimes very stressed, and argued in front of the guests with each other about having too much work to do. Last but not least, the best thing about this hotel is the front desk staff, everybody was extremely nice and helpful. Top notch service! Although there are some little downsides, I rate the hotel with five stars for the style, the staff, the location and the pool, and also because with the exception of the George V all five star places in Paris (including the Ritz and the Crillion) I've tried so far had bigger problems than this one. I'd recommend it to single persons or couples who prefer a stylish, personal hotel over the prestige of the big names.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place - expecially for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife at I had the pleasure of staying at the Renaissance Paris Vendome from 7/9-7/16. We were lucky enough to stay for free by using Marriott points. What a great deal! I'm sure I would be more critical if I had to dish out $450/night, but with few exceptions, we found the hotel to be very comfortable, casual and convenient. The room was a typical size for Paris, but the bed was fairly large, and very comfortable. It was warm last week, and we didn't want to get awakened by early morning street noise, so we slept with the windows closed and the a/c on. Even still, it was warm, but that didn't stop us from sleeping late most days. Warning- there's no clock in the room except on the telephone. All of the hotel personnel were very cordial and hospitable. Room service, though expensive, was a very nice luxury. Housekeeping did a great job keeping the room clean, and bathroom stocked with clean fluffy towels. Just make sure to put the "Do not disturb" sign on the door if you plan on sleeping in. Ann and Emmanuelle at the front desk were extremely helpful. Both speak perfect english, and they helped us with dinner reservations, tours and general directions. They were always there with a pleasant "bon jour" and smiles. The pool, sauna and hammam (steam room) were an added bonus. It was really nice to be able to come back to the hotel after a long hot day, and jump in the pool. A couple of mornings I used the facilities before we went out, and I used the locker room to shower and shave, giving my wife some space in the room to get ready. My only compaint was that the steam room was out of service a couple of times, but when it was working it was awsome with the tiny starlights ceiling. In summary, I would recommend this hotel. It's not as opulent as the Meurice, Ritz or Crillon, but it is a great place to relax and take in as much of Paris as you want.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Renaissance Paris Vendome”
Reviews.Author: fortwaynemom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful for my stay in Paris. The location was fantastic.....very easy walking distance to le louvre, musee d'orsay, tuilleries, arc d'triumphe (excuse my spelling, if incorrect) and shopping. There is a metro stop very close by....so easy to get around...I never took a cab. The hotel is very well-appointed, having recently been remodeled. The rooms, though small, were very clean and modern. The beds were very comfortable. Robes and high end bath products were in the bathroom. I did not eat in the hotel, I prefer to get out and walk around to find some options for dining. I will certainly return.

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance Paris Vendome
HotelInfo.Address: 4 rue du Mont Thabor, 75001 Paris, France (Formerly Plaza Paris Vendome)
